Doña Ninfa is 41, is a single mother of an 8-year-old son, who goes to school in the city.  She doesn’t have her own home, so she rents.

Señora Ninfa has had a grocery store for 10 years.  She works in it every day from noon until 3 a.m.  This is her first loan with her communal bank, and she will invest it in the purchase of products like rice, sugar, detergent, sausages, and other basic goods to supply her business.  Her dream is to maintain her health so she can keep working.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergents, sausages, and other basic goods.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 year old single woman she owns a cafe in Tala market where she supplies food to her daily customers. She has been doing this for  one year and gets an income of KES.15,000 per month. 


Mary  was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. She has a good credit history and she is applying for her second loan of KES 20000 from KADET LTD.  She plans to buy cooking cereals, maize, beans, flour, utensils and others items for her cafe.


Mary  will use the extra profit to put back to business. She hopes to own a big restaurant. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cooking cereals, maize, beans, flour, utensils and other items.

loans.name: Saul Abraham

texts.es: Saúl Abraham es un joven muy trabajador y responsable que ayuda a su padre con los gastos del hogar, preocupado por el bienestar familiar y la situación quiere enjarrar las paredes de un cuarto que ya tiene construido y levantar las paredes de otro para ampliar su casa que en un futuro será para el. El joven Saúl aun sigue soltera pero quiere preparar su patrimonio para ofrecer a su futura esposa, el trabaja en una maquiladora de la ciudad donde el cubre los gastos.
texts.en:
Saúl Abraham is a hard working, responsible young man who helps his father cover household expenses.  Concerned about his family’s wellbeing he wants to plaster the walls in a room he already has built and erect the walls for another room to enlarge the house that will be his in the future.

Saúl is still single but he’d like to start preparing his estate to have something to offer his future wife.  He’s employed at an assembly plant in the city which allows him to cover expenses.

loans.use: to build and plaster a room.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian, tiene la edad 21 de  años, está soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de insumos para su plantación de frijol. El cuenta con un terreno apto para la siembra de frijol y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos y fungicidas y mano de obra  para obtener una buena cosecha. El quiere implantar un frijolar que de buena producción para vender un producto de calidad en el mercado local o en lugares aledaños y también para autoconsumo. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su  familia y crecer con el proyecto del frijol. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Adrian is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings. With this loan he hopes to purchase supplies for his bean fields. He has a plot of land that is suitable for planting beans. He will invest in inputs such as fertilizer and fungicides and will pay for labor so that he can have a good harvest. He wants to establish a bean farm with good outputs so that he can sell a quality product in the local market and in neighboring areas. His work is for his own consumption as well. He wants to generate a greater amount of income for his well-being and for that of his family and expand his bean business. 

This is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Previously he had not received other loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR granted him this loan with more ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sow beans.

loans.name: Jecil

texts.en:
Jecil is married with one child. Jecil is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Jecil is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy two piglets and feed. 

She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jecil hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and feed

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina, de 37 años de edad, reside en casa familiar junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija. Ella  se dedica a la venta de verduras: yuca, zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, chiles, güisquiles, etc. ya tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio y es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Para Luz lo más importante es su familia y sueña con el día en que su situación económica se vea mejorada. Ella trabaja duramente para llevar el pan de cada día a su casa y no se cansa  de hacerlo ya que es el que le brinda la oportunidad de accesar a una mejor calidad de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio con el fin de mantenerlo surtido y que los clientes puedan encontrar siempre lo que buscan. Con el crédito desea comprar mayor variedad de verduras como: yuca, tomates, cebollas, zanahorias, chiles, güisquiles, etc. De esta manera espera que sus ventas se vean incrementadas y logre tener acceso a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 37 years old and lives in her family home with her husband and young daughter.  She sells vegetables for a living such as yucca, carrots, tomatoes, onions, chilies, güisquiles [edible plant in the gourd family], etc.  She has a lot of time to dedicate to her business and it is one of her main sources of income.  For Luz, what is most important is her family and she dreams of the day when her financial situation is better.  She works very hard every day to provide for her family and she doesn't tire of doing it as she knows this is what will give her the opportunity to give them a better quality of life.  


She made the decision to request a loan with INTEGRAL so she could invest in her business and keep it stocked so her customers can always find what they are looking for.  With the loan she wants to buy a greater variety of vegetables such as yucca, tomatoes, onions, carrots, chilies, güisquiles, etc.  She hopes that this will increase her sales and allow her access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a greater variety of vegetables such as yucca, tomatoes, onions, carrots, chilies, güisquiles, etc.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia, de 37 años es una valerosa madre soltera, que cuida con amor a su hijo Jhonson en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. A pesar de no tener el apoyo, ella trabaja con ahínco para salir adelante. Desde niña ocupó la mayor parte de su tiempo en la agricultura y aprendió a vivir de ello, por eso desde que conformó su familia no tubo inconvenientes en sembrar papa y alverja en gran cantidad. Ya tiene 17 años de experiencia y lo más difícil es mantener el precio de sus cosechas, ya que varían constantemente. Pero eso no la desanima, pues ella tiene otros ingresos económicos, como 5 vacas que le proporcionan la leche que necesita para realizar los ricos quesos; según cuenta hace un promedio de 6 moldes diarios, además de los 2 toros que le ayudan en el arado de la tierra, las 5 ovejas que enseba para venderlos posteriormente y la tienda de comestibles que puso en su casa; donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Todo esto la hace una mujer luchadora y con ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor deseo es brindarle a su hijo la educación que se merece. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Cayan” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Elvia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus cultivos de papa de la variedad “canchan” y si el dinero le alcanza en surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
37-year-old Elvia is a courageous single mother who lovingly cares for her son Jhonson in her own home which is located in the small village of Cayan.  In spite of not having any support, she works determinedly to get ahead in life.

Since she was a young girl, Elvia has spent most of her time farming and she learned to live off this work.  Since she formed her family, she has had no problems in sowing potatoes and peas in large quantities.  She has 17 years experience and the most difficult part of her business is maintaining the price she receives for her harvests as it varies constantly.  However, she does not lose heart as she has other sources of income such as her five cows which provide her with the milk she needs to make delicious cheese.  She tells us that she makes, on average, 6 molds of cheese each day.  She also has two bulls which help her plow the land, five sheep which she fattens and then later sells, and a grocery store which she set up in her home and where she sells basic household products.  All of this makes her a tenacious woman who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  Her greatest wish is to provide her son with the education he deserves.

Elvia belongs to the 'Progreso Cayan' community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your support so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments in a punctual manner.  With your support, Elvia will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of natural fertilizers to spread over her 'canchan' variety potatoes.  If the money reaches far enough, she will also stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and products with which to stock her store

loans.name: Farukh

texts.ru: Фарух работает таксистом уже два года, в день он обслуживает  более 100-120 пассажиров. Он ответственный, старательный стремится всегда продвигаться вперед в своем деле. Фарух старается создавать комфорт в автомобиле,  для своих клиентов, поэтому старается тщательно проводить осмотр запчастей машины. У  Фаруха  на иждивении более 7 человек. Он хочет развить свой бизнес  путем покупки запчастей машины в случаи  внезапных  неполадок быстро отремонтировать и обслуживать большее количество клиентов- пассажиров.
texts.en: Farukh has been working as a taxi driver for two years and serves over 100-120 passengers per day.  He is responsible and diligent, and always strives to move ahead in his business.  Farukh tries to provide comfort for his clients in his vehicle, and this is why he tries to thoroughly inspect his vehicle parts.  Farukh supports over seven people.  He wants to develop his business by buying spare parts for his vehicle to ensure against emergency breakdowns that can be repaired quickly and service continued to more customers-passengers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Nestor Hildefonso

texts.es:
Nestor de 60 años de edad, es soltero, reside en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de San José del departamento de La Libertad.  Se caracteriza por la actividad pesquera, agrícola y ganadera.

Nestor se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros de San José a Pacasmayo y viceversa, una zona donde predomina la pesca. Para realizar su actividad cuenta con un carro y sus principales clientes son los pobladores de la zona donde vive. El ya tiene varios años dedicándose a esta actividad y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos de su casa y personales.

El desea realizar mantenimiento y cambio de algunos repuestos de su unidad móvil ya que está presentando algunas fallas mecánicas, con la finalidad que al tener su carro en buenas condiciones podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.  Nestor es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Nestor, who is 60 years old, is single. He lives in his own house, which has water and electricity and is located in the San José district of the La Libertad department. This area is characterized by fishing, agriculture, and raising livestock.

Nestor offers transportation services for cargo and passengers from San José to Pacasmayo and return, a zone dominated by fishing. To carry out his business activity, he has a car, and his principal customers are the residents of the zone where he lives. He has already been in this business for several years, and thanks to it he pays for his house and his personal expenses.

He wants to do some maintenance and replace some parts on his car, since it is presenting some mechanical problems. His goal is to have his car in good condition so that he will be able to offer better service to his customers. For this reason he believed it would be convenient to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 PEN. Nestor is well-known and admired by his fellow workers. They consider him a responsible person with a great will to continue advancing himself.

loans.use: to maintain and replace some parts of his vehicle.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом проживает в районе Яван. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. У них один ребенок. Абдусалом занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abdusalom lives in the Yavan region. He is married. His wife is a homemaker. They have one child. Abdusalom breeds large horned cattle at home. He has been in this business for two years. He is taking out the loan to buy more large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle

loans.name: Gandaria 5 Group

texts.en: Hayati is married and a mother of two children. She has been doing laundry for two years. She runs the business from her house. The business is going well. She can help her husband to provide food for the family. Beside laundry, she also sells snacks. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. With this loan, she wants to buy more laundry soap and fragrances. In the future, she hopes she can have a bigger kiosk so that she can receive more laundry orders. She wants her children to graduate from the University, because she only graduated from high school.

loans.use: to buy more laundry soap and fragrances

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 41 years old. Concepcion is married and has seven children.

To earn a living, Concepcion is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Concepcion has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Concepcion is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. In 2011, Concepcion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 42 years old with six children aged 3 to 17. She has also adopted one other child and all of them are in school. 

She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for 4 years. She would like a loan to buy soap, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to sell in her store. She will use any profits to reinvest in the business. She would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Chekalini Central Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chekalini Central Group in Western Kenya! With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Robai and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Robai is the facilitator of the Chekalini Central Group. The photograph shows Robai with her group members. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Chekalini Central Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Robai takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Robai had a good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Robai was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Robai will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mena Ama

texts.en: Mena Ama is married to a farmer and has five dependents.  She sells salted fish, pepper and other food items in Besease.  She has been in business for the past seven years.  She will use this loan to purchase more fish and other food items to sell.  With the additional profit generated by the loan, Mena Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Osman. He is married to a trader and has five children, ages 17, 15, 13, 11 and 2 years. After fifth form, he wanted to enter college but, unfortunately for him, his father died and he had nobody to support his schooling. Therefore, he was left with no other option but to go into business so that he could earn a living. 

In 1994, Osman established a business selling shirts, shorts, T-shirts, sneakers and shoes for both men and women. He is assisted by his distant cousin. Competition is high but he buys quality goods. He usually goes to Conakry twice per month by public vehicle. He serves people around town and his business is popular as his goods are always available when his customers need them. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 2,742,000 leones (SLL) every month from this business. Rise in foreign exchange is one of his major problems. 

Osman would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan to buy jeans (50 pairs @ 47,000 SLL) and T-shirts (50 @ 24,000 SLL). The balance of 450,000 SLL is for transport. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 411,000 SLL.

In the future, Osman plans to build a house and send his elder daughter for studies abroad. It is good for him to take out this loan because he will make extra profit from it. Osman will save some of his profit and add the balance to his existing capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans and T-shirts

loans.name: Margine Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Margine sigue con su negocio de ropa y cosmetico,  asi como la venta de nacatamales los fines de semana, logrando asi mantener sus ventas. junto a su esposo se esfuerzan por lograr las mejoras a su casa, estan construyendo una habitacion el cual llevan bastante avanzadas, lo que con este nuevo prestamo podra terminar, dando mejor espacio a sus hijos, una estudiante de secundaria y el otro en un taller de mecanica  de moto, aprendiendo para un futuro mejor. Materiales a comprar, bloques, arena, cemento, laminas de zinc, perlines, para terminar la obra.
texts.en:
Margine continues with her clothing and cosmetics business, as well as the sale of nacatamales (Nicaraguan steamed corncakes) on weekends. She is managing to maintain her sales. 

She and her husband are trying their best to complete improvements to their house. They are building a room. The work is quite advanced and they will be able to complete it with this new loan, providing better space for their children. One goes to high school, and the other works in a motorcycle repair shop. Both are learning in order to have a better future.

To complete the work, they need to buy materials such as cement blocks, sand, cement, zinc sheeting, and perlins.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for completing a room, which will provide better space for her children.

loans.name: Martin Beranio

texts.es:
Martin Beranio tiene 65 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y los hijos de 40, 38, 36 y 34 años de edad en ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Martín se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para el cultivo de maíz, comprar semillas, abonos, urea, líquidos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir trabajando para la familia.

El sueño es poder ir de paseo con la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Martin Beranio is 65 years old, is married, has 4 children, and lives with his wife and the children that are ages 40, 38, 36, and 34 in Ventanas, a province of Los Rios.

He is a member of "VRC LA UNION", which is located in Recinto Aguas Frías, belonging to the district Ventanas. He does short cycle agricultural work for a living sowing corn, rice and beans.

Martín purchases, cultivates and sells corn, rice, and bean in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan in order to cultivate corn. He will allocate the funds to the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, urea, and fluids. With the help of the loan, he will be able to continue working for the family.

The dream is to be able to go on walks with the family. In his spare time, he enjoys sports.

loans.use: for the cultivation of corn; buying seeds, fertilizer, urea, and fluids.

loans.name: Mbene Ablay's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 3 femmes fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été crée le 07 Février 2001. Il est composé de membres ayant une complicité particulière entre elles et cela depuis des activités de leur Banc Villageois. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Mbene, la représentante est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants dont 04 filles. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va s’approvisionner en bétail au marché de Bambey. Ainsi elle achète une vache et un veau à 200 000 frs les 02, un sac et demi de paille d'arachide à 11 250 frs par mois soit 45 000 frs, 06 sacs aliment bétail industrialisé à raison de 5500 frs le sac, 08 comprimés de teramicyne à 2500frs , le vaccin à 2000 frs. Elle paie pour le convoyage 3000 frs et son transport à elle 200 frs. Le reste de l'argent est utilisé comme roulement pour compléter l'aliment. 

Elle compte revendre les 02 sujets à 425 000 frs après 04 mois . 

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité lui permettent d'acheter des chèvres qu'elle va garder à la maison , augmenter le niveau de ses épargnes et assister son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales quotidiennes.
texts.en:
This group of three women is part of the village lending group that was created on February 7, 2001. It is made up of members with a special bond amongst themselves that has developed since they began their lending group. Standing up at the right of the photo and raising her hand, Mbene, the group leader, is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of nine children, four of whom are girls. 

With the loan, she is going to stock up on livestock at the Bambey market. She will buy a cow and a calf at 200,000XOF for both, a bag and a half of groundnut straw at 11,250 XOF per month, therefore 45,000XOF, six bags of industrial livestock feed at 5500XOF a bag, eight teramicyne pills at 2500XOF, and vaccinations at 2000XOF. She is going to pay 3000XOF for the transport of the animals and 200XOF for her own transportation. The remaining funds will be used as rolling funds for feed. She plans to resell the two animals for 425,000XOF after four months. The profits generated through this business will allow her to buy sheep that she is going to keep at home, increase her savings, and help her husband with the management of the family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a calf to fatten and resell

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en: As a mother of five lovely angels, Flomena's great desire is to see her children grow to become professionals. It is what encourages Flomena and fills her with enthusiasm. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past twelve years. On her farm, she grows maize, has dairy cows, and keeps poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. When she is not farming, she engages in some personal business to help supplement the income she earns. Despite her low earnings, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction. Flomena is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Flomena is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood. Flomena hopes to succeed thanks to the support from the kind-hearted people like Kiva lenders who support smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to buy another quality dairy cow

loans.name: Romel

texts.en: Romel is 31 years old, single and lives in Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Romel owns and operates a transportation transport service to earn a living. He had support the family's daily needs with this income aside from working in a private company. After his work, he does transportation services to earn . Recently, he took a new loan of 30,000.00 to buy tires and repair his motorcycle to commute between his work and in other village in town. His future plan is to buy another unit of motor for expansion of his business.

loans.use: To buy motor accesories and tires.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
This description was written by Richard Mazengo, a staff member for Village Enterprise Fund in Tanzania. He is also a partner representative for Kiva.

The name of the business is Ipagala Curios Group.

Richard started the business with his group of associated and was funded by VEF, in 2002. Their business is buying, making traditional Items and selling to the general public. In their Curio Shop in Dodoma town, they sell Knives, Pens,Fiddle, Mortors or mill, Chairs,Spears, Shoes, Drums, Calabash,and earings.

Through their business they have been making enough profit and they are to pay school fees for their children and meet other family needs. School fees are one of the most important, and difficult to afford, expenses in Tanzania. The majority of children cannot attend school because the families cannot pay these fees.

If they get $ 500.00 they will improve their business by buying more stock to expand their Shop, and this will make more profit for them to pay the loan and other profit for their own use.

Richard M. understands that he is getting a loan and is more than able to pay it back. He is the most experienced man in his region in the business of curios.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
My name is Virgilio E. and I sell soda drinks. I have had my business for 3 years and I have a good clientel as I live in an area that is very hot and the residents drink iced sodas. My business generates enough income to feed my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have higher sales. With the additional earnings, I will buy another, larger refridgerator in order to hold many more well-chilled drinks, as well as feed my family and give a dignified education to my grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Virgilio E. me dedico a la venta de refrescos de cola, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que en el lugar en donde vivimos hace mucha calor y la gente toma mucho refresco helado, mi negocio me genera ingresos para alimentar mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta de refrescos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarme otro refrigerador mas grande para tener muchos refrescos bien helados asi mismo poder alimentar mi familia y darle un estudio digno a mi nieto.

loans.use: To purchase drinks, ice and bags.

loans.name: Misael

texts.en:
Mr. Misael C. has run a home based business for the last 6 years. “My wife and I have worked in our business for 6 years selling miscellaneous items and also new clothing. We purchase the clothing in another city where it costs us less, so that we can sell it to our customers on a layaway program where payments are made every two weeks. We need to purchase more clothing and a display case to hold it.” I am asking for a $1,200 dollar loan to purchase clothing for my business, and a display case in order to increase sales.”

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Misael C. tiene su negocio en su casa desde hace 6 años.”Mi esposa y yo trabajamos en este negocio desde hace 6 años vendiendo miscelánea y también ropa nueva que traemos de otra ciudad que es donde nos cuesta más barata para poder vendérselas a nuestros clientes en pagos quincenales, nos hace falta comprar más ropa y un mueble para acomodarla” SOLICITO $ 1,200.0 dlls para comprar ropa para mi negocio,un mueble y poder tener más ventas.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell and a display case

loans.name: Meleyke

texts.en: G. Meleyke Alikram kizi is a young businesswomen and she runs a sheep breeding business. Her husband is a teacher, but she is not educated. So she wants to help raise money for her family. She keeps lambs for meat production, but the number of lamb is low, so she would like to increase this number. She applied for a loan of 800 USD for purchasing lambs.

loans.use: Going to purchase lambs

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannak A. has sold Khmer noodles in the local market since 2000. Her husband is a farmer and plants rice and vegetables in the village. Her business selling noodles and her husband's farm provide money so that all of her children are continuing their studies in higher education. She was married in 1990 and has 4 children.

Mrs. A. has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. Now she is requesting a loA. of $200. She will use this money to buy a battery and electronic scraper for scraping coconuts for her Khmer noodle business.

loans.use: Purchasing a battery and electronic scraper to scrape coconuts for the noodle business.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun S., age 30, sells mushrooms at the market, earning $3 per day. Her husband, age 28, is a construction worker, earning around $3 per day. They have two children who are too young for school. In order to expand her mushroom business and increase revenue, she would like to borrow $500 to purchase seeds to plant mushrooms in addition to gathering them, thereby increasing her stock. She plans to save the extra income to finance her children’s education.

She is pictured with her husband in front of her inventory of mushrooms.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to expand her mushroom inventory.

loans.name: Martha Adilia

texts.es:
Martha began her business with the help of her partner and her children, renting a space for her business. However, they decided it was better to get a loan to purchase the space. The infrastructure of this location is not ideal, and many times when it rains everything gets soaked, even though she continues to sell her things as best she can.

She began her business with only 2 tables and 8 chairs, and now she has 6 tables with their own chairs. She wants to be able to grow her business more and improve the condition of the space. With the high costs involved she can't do this without support. Martha has worked with CEPRODEL since 2005, and has had 8 previous loans which were paid back. For Martha, her business, together with the help from the loans, has made a huge difference, and she appreciates the support she has been given.

Martha inicia con ayuda de su compañero y sus hijos alquilando un local para el negocio, sin embargo se decidieron por un prestamo bancario para comprar el local. La infraestructura del local no es la apropiada, muchas veces cuando llueve se moja pero da gracias a Dios que aun bajo estas condiciones no deja de vender.

Su negocio al inicio constaba apenas de 2 mesas y 8 sillas, y ahora ya tiene 6 mesas cada una con sus respctivas sillas, sin embargo en sus planes esta crecer mas y lograr una mejor condicion en la infraestructura de su local, ya que por ahora no la ha hecho debido a los costos altos que esto implica.

Desde el 2005 Martha trabaja con CEPRODEL, teniendo un record ded 8 creditos. Para ela el trabajo en conjunto Institucion-Cliente ha sido de gran trascendencia en su negocio, y agradece a CEPRODEL el apoyo que le ha brindado.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO GROW , MAKING NECESSARY IMPROVEMENTS ON THE LOCATION TO STOP LEAKS.

loans.name: Komlan Faustin

texts.fr:
Mr A. Komlan Faustin was born on May 21, 1963 in Lomé and is the father of one (1) child. He also takes care of another person. Because of financial difficulties, he had to give up his training in data processing and learn how to make shoes instead. Having received a diploma after this training, he is asking for a $600 credit in order to open a workshop and buy supplies and materials for shoe manufacturing so that he can demonstrate his knowledge and get new customers. A well organized man, he would like to later on, obtain a more consistent credit for his workshop as well as other commercial initiatives. His dynamism and skill are also important assets that will contribute to the success of his project.

Monsieur A. Komlan Faustin est né le 21 Mai 1963 à Lomé et père d’un (1) enfant et une autre personne en charge. Par manque de moyen, il abandonne sa formation en informatique et apprend la cordonnerie. Ayant reçu son diplôme après sa formation, il sollicite un crédit de $600 afin d’ouvrir un atelier et acquérir des fournitures et matériels de cordonnerie pour faire ressortir son savoir faire à sa clientèle. Bien organiser, il pense avoir plus tard un crédit plus consistant pour associé à la cordonnerie d’autres initiatives du genre commercial. Son dynamisme et son habileté constituent autant d’atouts pour le succès de son projet.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and opening of a shoe making workshop

loans.name: Aydee Ambrosia's Group

texts.en:
Aydee, Domenica, and Santa have been members of the community bank “Sr. de Luren” for between two and five years. During that time, they have learned about responsibility, saving, and punctuality. In addition, they have learned how to depend on themselves and develop enduring relationships with other bank members.

Aydee is 33 years old and has a seven year old daughter. She owns a bakery that was started by her mother. She has been running the business since her mother retired four years ago. In addition, Aydee is studying to be a lawyer.

Domenica is 33 and has a five year old son. She knits items such as hats and gloves that she sends to Lima to be exported. She knits all of her products by hand. Domenica has been knitting for five years, before that she sold firewood. She is much happier now.

Santa is 32 and has two children. She moved to Ayacucho nine years ago from the jungle region of Peru and started a business selling food staples such as rice, sugar, and oil. Since that time, and especially since joining the community bank, her business has grown considerably.

Aydee, Domenica, and Santa need loans of 1200, 600, and 400 soles respectively (3 soles = $1, which they will invest in buying materials to expand their business. These include flour, yarn, wool, sugar, and butter. The loan helps them buy in larger quantities and receive lower prices.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Aydee is saving to take her graduation exam. Domenica and Santa are saving to buy land and build a house. Their respective dreams are to become a lawyer and professional, own a home, and to be able to run their business from their home.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials to expand their businesses.  These items include flour, yarn, wool, sugar, and butter.  The loan helps them buy in larger quantities and receive lower prices.

loans.name: Javier Natividad

texts.es:
Javier V. es un caballero muy esforzdado que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la actividad de la ganadería y pecuaria con basta experiencia en el ramo de los animales por ser su único negocio al que se dedica.

Es padre casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos en edad escolar. Para lograr salir adelante ha buscado la manera de mejorar su situación económica y lo ha hecho mediante los créditos brindados por Ceprodel siendo estos invertidos en la compra de vacas para alimentarlas, reproducirlas y luego venderlas o destazarlas para comercializar la carne o leche.

Desde que ha trabajado con Ceprodel ha sido un excelente cliente cumpliendo con el pago de los créditos de manera eficiente. Hoy en dia sua mayor necesidad es la adquisicion de los animales para su respectiva conmercializacion.

loans.use: Compra de vacas en preñez

loans.name: Okouromi

texts.en: Okouromi I.is 45 years old, married and has a kid. He resides in Benin-City, Nigeria. He uses motorcycle to move people from place to place. He needs a loan of $625 to enable him replace his old motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Neema's Shalom Group

texts.en:
Neema is 31 years old and is divorced with 2 children. Neema has been a clothes seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Neema now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Pamela and Caroline, who have businesses dealing in millet sales and chicken sales.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Dilorom N. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 51 years old, married and has four children. She sells fruits and vegetables and has her own vendor space on the market. This business is the only source of income for her family. In order to improve her family's living conditions, she needs to work very hard. At this time Dilorom need to pay a year's rent for her space on the market. She does not have enough cash flow and available funds to pay a large sum of money and this is why she needs a loan. She plans to pay it off within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нурмахмадова Дилором жительница города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 51 год. Замужем и имеет 4 детей. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания( овощи и фрукты). Имеет торго вую точку на рынке города. Ее бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Для того , чтобы улучшить условия жизни она должна много работать. Сейчас ей необходимо оплатить арендную плату за свою торговую точку. Но оплачивать крупную сумму из оборотных средств у нее нет возможности , поэтому она решила получить кредит, который сможет частично погашать в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To pay the year's rent

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es:
Amadeo R. is requesting a loan in order to invest in his small business. He lives, together with his wife and two sons, in Almendro. His oldest son, who is 16 years old, is in his third year of secondary education and the other is 11 years old and in the fifth grade.

With effort he has managed to establish his small business in his house, which enables him to offer perishable and non-perishable items. With this he is able to generate income to guarantee the well-being of his family and grow his small business. In addition, Amadeo works selling livestock which helps with the household expenses and improve his income, at the same time improving the family living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Amadeo R. está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio, habita junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 2 hijos en su casa ubicada en el Almendro, su hijo mayor de 16 años estudia su tercer año de educación secundaria y el otro de 11 años de edad estudia su 5to grado.

Con esfuerzo propio ha logrado establecer su pequeño negocio en su casa de habitacion, lo que le permite ofrecer productos perecederos y no perecederos el cual le brinda ingresos para garantizar el bienestar familiar y consolidar su pequeño negocio; además don Amadeo se dedica a comercializar ganado el que apoya los gastos del hogar y mejorar su ingreso, al mismo tiempo que mejora las condiciones de vida familiar

loans.use: Buying perishable items for his store

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
Born January 15, 1980 in Agblangandan in Ouémé County in the southwest of Benin, Mrs. Albertine Adjike is married and the mother of two children, Roberto (10) and in 5th grade and Raïssa (6) in 2nd grade. She is specialized in the sale of underclothes and women's and children's clothing which she buys in Lome, Togo. Finding herself presently faced with economic difficulties, she is asking for her third loan in the amount of 200,000 francs (US$ 500) so as to respond to the ever increasing demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 15 janvier 1980 à Agblangandan dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud-ouest du Bénin, dame ADJIKE Albertine est mariée et mère de deux enfants Roberto âgé de 10 ans en classe de CM II et Raïssa âgée de 6 ans en classe de CP II. Elle est spécialiée dans la distribution des sous vêtements, des habits de femmes et d'enfants qu'elle achète à Lomé au Togo. Face aux difficultés financières actuelles, elle sollicite pour son troisième crédit une somme de 200 000 francs afin de répondre aux demandes sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 dozen women's underwear and 15 dozen children's garments

Achat de 10 douzaines de sous vêtement pour femme et de 15 douzaines d'habits d'enfants

loans.name: Mahougnon Chantal

texts.fr: Born around 1976 in Cotonou in Littoral County in South Benin, Mrs. Mahougnon Chantal C. is married and the mother of 3 children: Eric, 15, is in 7th grade, Josiane, 13, is in fifth grade, and Vivien, 9, is in third grade.  She is requesting this loan in order to bolster her business and satisfy her customer demand. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva VolunteerNée vers 1976 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud Bénin, dame C. Mahougnon Chantal est mariée et  mère de trois (03) enfants: Eric âgé de 15 ans est élève en classe de cinquième au cours secondaire, Josiane âgée de 13 ans est élève en classe de CM2 au cours primaire et Vivien 09 ans est élève en classe de CE2 au cours primaire. Elle demande ce crédit dans le soucis de renforcer son activité et de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cases of tins of milk, 25 crates of drinks, and 1 case of sardinesAchat de deux (02) cartons de boîtes de lait, de 25 casiers de boissons et d'un carton de sardine.

loans.name: Azizmo

texts.ru: Зиеева  Азизмо жительница города Яван. Работает на центральном рынке города. Привозит из Душанбе товар – ткани , затем реализует у себя на рынке. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит и использовать его для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот.  Это поможет развитию ее бизнеса.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев. Азизмо замужем и имеет  пятерых детей.
texts.en:
Azizmo Z. resides in the town of Yavan and works in the town’s central market. The goods and fabrics she brings in from Dushanbe are sold at her spot in the marketplace. She has been in this business for ten years. Azizmo plans to take out a loan to increase the turnover of inventory, which will enable her business to grown. She will be able to repay the loan within fifteen months. Azizmo is married and has five children.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover of inventory

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: La necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos la llevo a ofertar frutas y verduras de forma ambulantes en el municipio, ella hace sus compras en el mercado de Masaya por docenas y vende por unidad, por su alto espíritu  emprendedor actualmente tiene clientela fijas a las cuales abastece durante toda la semana, siendo su mayor inversión los días sábados y domingos donde logra vender al 100 % su mercadería. Vive con su esposo el que trabaja en albañilería y le ayuda con los gastos de  la casa. Sus hijos estudian en escuela de secundaria, tiene su casa propia, y sueña con remodelarla en un futuro
texts.en:
Reina's need to have a source of income brought her to travelling sales of fruits and vegetables in her town. She makes bulk purchases in the Masaya market and then sells by the unit. She has a very enterprising spirit, and she has clients to whom she supplies her product throughout the week. Saturdays and Sundays are the most financially rewarding days in that she is able to sell 100% of her merchandise. She lives with her husband, who is a mason, and helps him with the household expenses. Her children are secondary school students. She has her own home and dreams of remodeling it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz tiene 39 años, por falta de dinero aun no se ha casado, pero vive muchos años ya con su pareja, con la cual tiene tres hijos. En el pasado Liz trabajaba como empleada en casa, pero hace 6 años a decidió ser una trabajadora independiente, buscó un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad donde paga por el espacio suma  de 15 soles, aparte del agua y la luz. Ella se levanta 3 de la madrugada para alistarse y preparar el menú del día, menciona que en estos tiempos la venta no es tan buena, pero la temporada que viene de diciembre hasta julio mejora su venta, es ahí donde al menos puede ahorrar un poco, porque diario gana 150 soles aparte de su capital. Le agrada lo que hace porque le permite educar a sus hijos, su dificultad es cuando le sobra la comida, pierde y su ganancia baja. Este es su préstamo nº 6 con MFP. Su meta es repara y mejorar el puesto donde vende, también pintarlo para que se vea más atractivo. En el futuro seguir ahorrando para comprar motocarros para hacerlas trabajar en transporte de pasajeros.
texts.en:
Liz is 39 years old, and because of a lack of money she is still not married, but has been living with her partner for many years, and they have 3 kids. In the past Liz worked as a domestic employee, but 6 years ago she decided to work independently and she found a store in the market in the city which she paid 15 soles for, excluding electricity and water. She gets up at 3am to get ready and prepare the day's menu, and she mentions that in this season sales are not very good, but from December to July sales improve and at least at that time she will be able to save a bit as she will earn 150 soles daily. She likes what she does because it allows her to educate her kids, the difficulty is when there are lots of leftovers and her earnings get lower. This is her 6th loan with MFP. Her aim is to repair and improve her store, as well as painting it so it looks more attractive. In the future she will keep saving to buy cars to work in public transport.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the appearance of her store where she sells food/Mejorar la apariencia del puesto donde vende comida

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is about 40 years old. She has got five children: two sons and three daughters, and her house is located in Nasaji Bagrami. During the war, her house collapsed and she could not repair it well, so she needs an individual loan of 30000 Afs to repair her house and buy construction materials. She is very pleased with this small loans procedure which supports her a lot.

loans.use: buying construction materials to repair her war-damaged house

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila L., es viuda, tiene 30 años y vive en una casa con sus padres en la ciudad de General Artigas. Tiene 2 hijos pequeños que viven y dependen económicamente de ella.

La señora Lucila es propietaria de una Despensa con Carnicería que posee en su domicilio desde hace varios años, y es atendida por ella misma. Esta actividad a ella le permite criar y educar a sus hijos, cubrir todos los gastos que se presentan en el hogar y mediante esto llevar una vida digna y sin preocupaciones, ya que desde que su esposo ha fallecido ella ha tenido que luchar sola para poder salir adelante. Su madre, quien vive en el mismo lugar, es una docente jubilada que también le apoya en todo momento.

Esta señora actualmente esta solicitando el crédito para surtir más su negocio con mercaderías para la temporada de fin de año, ya que en la zona tiene mucha clientela que constantemente esta acudiendo a su comercio para realizar sus compras.
texts.en:
Lucila L. is a widow. She is 30 years old and lives in a house with her parents in the city of General Artigas. She has 2 young children who live with her and are dependent upon her. Lucila owns a grocery store/butcher shop which she opened in her home a number of years ago, and which she takes care of herself. This business allows her to raise and educate her children, pay the household expenses and thus live a respectable life without worries as since her husband's death she has had to fight alone to better her life. Her mother, who lives in the same house, is a retired teacher who supports her in all things. She is requesting this loan in order to stock her business with seasonal New Year's merchandise as she has many clients in the neighbourhood who come to her store to make their purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of merchandise such as canned items, fresh bread, cider, wine, soda, candy masses, Christmas arrangements, and others.

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.en:
"Los Lirios" is a Bank of Hope located about five minutes from the Esperanza office in Los Alcarrizos. The bank's newest group (Group 4) have just finished their training with Esperanza International and have submitted their first loan applications. Gloria, Christofer, Marta, Andrea, and Evelyn will be using their loans to expand or begin the following businesses a small hair salon, wristwatch sales, a convenience store, and clothing sales. All members of this group will be investing their money directly in merchandise purchases.

In the future, these micro-entrepreneurs state that they'd love to see better lives for their children—good health-care and education, they'd like to grow their business ventures further, and some would like to continue their own studies (at the secondary and university level).

The picture provided shows these group members gathered at Marta's convenience store.

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: purchasing merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. O. recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya.

As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Elizabeth joined K-MET because she was interested in the health and nutrition training that K-MET provides; she was also interested in taking out a loan.

Elizabeth is an early childhood development teacher. She has been teaching for 9 years and this year, on January 5, 2009, she opened her own school for young children.

Fifty children are currently enrolled at Elizabeth’s school and registration continues. The school is located in the Nyalenda area of Kisumu.

Elizabeth has applied for her first loan from K-MET in order to purchase furniture and school materials like reading charts, flash cards, chalk, and books. She is requesting approximately $275.

Elizabeth is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children, 2 of whom are in primary school, while the third attends Elizabeth’s school.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and school materials

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Cette femme  a pour lieu de résidence le quartier  de bé kpota, qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé,  elle fait comme activité le commerce de produits congelés, elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2004 et a ouvert une boutique qu’elle appelle  « établissement la LUMIERE ». Actuellement la demande de sa clientèle est plus élevée que ce qu’elle peut offrir, elle demande donc à wages un crédit pour s’approvisionner avec 13 cartons de croupions dinde, 14 cartons d’aile de poulets, 08 cartons de poulets. Elle est une femme mariée qui a un enfant, avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
This woman resides in the Bé Kpota quarter, a suburban neighborhood in the city of Lomé. Since 2004, she's been running a business consisting in selling frozen products in her store, called "Etablissement La Lumière". At this time, customer demand exceeds her capacity. She's thus seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, in order to replenish her stock by purchasing 13 boxes of turkey rump steaks, 14 boxes of chicken wings, and 8 boxes of chicken. She's married, has one child, and uses her profits to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell frozen meat

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en: Winifred A. has been selling milk and rice in Cape Coast since 2004.  She is married with two children. She received her education through vocational school.  Her husband is a goods seller.   She is responsible for paying water and light bills. Her loan will be used to stock up her store with various goods. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To stock her store with various goods.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy Chávez García tiene 40 años, es presidenta de su Banco Comunal, vive en Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria, abandonò los estudios debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola. Tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Gladys se dedica a la venta de menú (comida), iniciò su negocio hace 5 años, primero vendiendo marcianos y luego en un comedor donde ella cocinaba para las socias y gente particular, con el tiempo decidió poner su negocio en su casa donde ahora vende su menú y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias obtenidas a logrado comprar los utensilios y ollas para su negocio el mismo que desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para la preparación de marcianos. 
Con el crédito de 500 soles, que será cancelado en  4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de productos de primera necesidad para la venta de menú (insumos).
Nancy sueña con tener una bodega y un restaurante en Virú.
Ella pertenece al club de madres de su sector.
texts.en:
Señora Nancy Chávez García is 40 years old. She is a president of her Communal Bank. She lives in Human Settlement Aurora Díaz, district of Salaverry, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through the 3rd year of secondary school, then abandoned her studies because her parents did not have the economic means to continue supporting her. She has 2 children that depend on her economically. Gladys is dedicated to her restaurant (food) business. She started her first business 5 years ago selling frozen popsicles and then worked in a dining room where she cooked for the members and for private parties. In time she decided to put her business in her house where she now sells her dishes and has many clients. With the profits she obtained she has managed to buy the utensils and pots for her business that she runs in her residence. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her Communal Bank, called "The Auroras in Action II", she invested in the purchase of supplies for the preparation of popsicles. With the loan of 500 soles, that will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest n the purchase of basic supplies for the sale of her dishes. Nancy dreams of one day having a grocery and a restaurant in Virú. She belongs to the mothers club of her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for making foods for sale

loans.name: Mandah

texts.en:
Mandah H. is 48, married and the father of two. His family lives in a "ger" (traditional Mongolian tent) district on the plot of land he owns in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Since 1996, together with his spouse Tsesenjav, he has run a traditional shoe making business. He has many repeat customers from both the capital city and the countryside. He has lots of experienced and his shoes contain many beautiful traditional decorations. With the profit from his business, Mandah bought a vehicle so he could run a taxi service to earn extra income.

He recently got an order to make many traditional shoes, and requests a loan to buy raw materials. Mandah says, "I have many dreams, including to have my own little shoe factory. I'm saving for my daughter's future home when she gets married. I also want to continue to develop, and am learning computer skills from my son".

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making shoes

loans.name: Akouyo

texts.fr: Agricultrice, Mme Akouyo A. est née en 1954 à Adzralakopé. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle pratique la culture du mais, activité qui lui procure les revenus indispensables pour se prendre en charge et sa famille. Aujourd’hui ses rendements diminuent à cause de l’appauvrissement de ses sols. Elle demande donc un crédit pour acheter les engrais et autres intrants agricoles en vue d’accroître ses rendements et ses revenus.
texts.en:
Agriculturist, Mrs. Akouyo A. was born in 1954 in Adzralakopé. Married and the mother of 2 children, she grows corn, which brings in indispensable revenue to support herself and her family. Today, her yields are diminished because her soil is expended. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and other agricultural inputs in view of increasing her yield and her revenue.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer for growing maize

loans.name: Wédayamana  2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wédayamana 2  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 35ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles excellent uniquement   dans la culture de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   Wédayamana 2 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,   au grand marché de Koutiala ville.
 Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Wédayamana 2 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 80 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wédayamana 2 Group is a group of married women from the village of Sirakélé in the main city of Koutiala in the Sikasso region (Mali's third administrative region). The women live in traditional large, extended families and have an average age of 35 and at least five children each. Their sole business is growing peanuts. Anxious to make their agricultural business profitable, the members of the Wédayamana 2 Group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program five years ago. Having fully repaid their first four loans, they are now on their fifth farming loan. The current loan will be used to buy sufficient quantity of peanut seeds and small items of farm equipment and fertilizer at the main market in Koutiala. At the end of the off-season, the harvested crops are placed in storage for a certain period to gain value before being sold at the main market of Koutiala and surrounding markets at retail (and often wholesale) prices. The produce is sold for cash to customers who generally come from the large towns. Once their agricultural produce has been sold, the members of the Wédayamana 2 Group each expect to make a profit of CFA 80,000, which will be used to repay the loan interest and cover everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and small items of farm equipment

loans.name: Eskimo Group

texts.es:
Foto De izquierda a derecha: Lester de los Angeles Gaitán Gaitán, Angela del Socorro Téllez y Fanny del Carmen López Tórrez.

Este grupo es originario del barrio Monte Fresco de la ciudad de masaya, son perswonas trabajadoras y bien conocidas entre ellos.

Don Lester de los Angeles es un joven señor que se dedica a la venta de esquimos de forma ambulante, vende en el mercado y en los barrios de Masaya, hace esta actividad desde muy joven y cuando se casó se dedicó totalmente a este negocio porque no encontraba trabajo, ahora tiene muchos clientes y de esto mantiene a su familia que está compuesta de cinco hijos y su esposa. Sueña con poder darle educación a sus hijos, ellos estudian en la escuela cercana a su casa.Es el coordinador del grupo para este ciclo.

Doña Angela del Socorro tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa, con lo que ayuda a su esposo con los gastos, tiene muchos años de experiencia, sus hijos le ayudan a atender la venta, están en edades adolescentes y dos pequeños. Ella sueña con poder mejorar su casa.

Doña Fanny del Carmen vende quesillos de forma ambulante, sale a vender a otros departamentos del país, compra estos quesillos en el mercado de Masaya, ofrece su producto a  buen precio y por eso sus ventas se han incrementado, el crédito lo ocupó para comprar mas quesillos y tortillas.
Tiene como meta mejorar su casa para darle mejores condiciones a su hijo.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Lester de los Angeles Gaitán Gaitán, Angela del Socorro Téllez y Fanny del Carmen López Tórrez. This group is from the Monte Fresco neighborhood in the city of Masaya. They are hard working people who know each other very well. Lester de los Angeles is a young man who works as a street vendor selling ice cream sandwiches. He sells in the market and the Masaya neighborhoods. He has been doing this since he was very young. When he got married he worked at this full time because he could not find other work. He now has lots of customers. This is how he supports his family, which consists of five children and his wife. He dreams of being able to give his children an education. His children go to a school near their house. He is the coordinator of the group for this cycle. Angela de Socorro has a small convenience store in her house, which is how she helps her husband with the household expenses. She has many years of experience. Her children help her with the sales. They are adolescents and two are small. She dreams of being able to improve her house. Fanny del Camren sells cheese as a street vendor. She sells in other departments of the country. She buys the cheese in the Masaya market. She sells her products at a good price, and her sales have been increasing. She used the loan to buy more cheese and tortillas. Her goal is to improve her house in order to give her son better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ice cream sandwiches, cheese, and other things

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Juana del Carmen P. es una cliente antigua, en su historial demuestra que es una cliente responsable y que ha sabido aprovechar sus financiamientos. Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de frutas y verduras, ella inicio vendiendo frutas en su vivienda, en donde ofrecía mangos, naranjas y bananos, pero Juana es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable con sus obligaciones de madre, por lo que además decide incursionar en la venta de ropa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, y le ha gustado mucho pues disfruta su actividad. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que cuando llueve tiene problemas.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana del Carmen P. is a long-standing client who has demonstrated her responsibility and knowledge of how to handle her finances. She is a clothing vendor. Prior to this, she sold fruits and vegetables from her home where she offered mangos, oranges and bananas. Sra. Juana is a persistent woman and responsible with her obligations as a mother. She then decided to sell clothing. Having been in this line of business for 4 years now, she says she enjoys her work.

She will use her loan as working capital for her business. Her biggest dream is to set aside funds for home repairs so that she can avoid problems when it rains.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Osunbiye

texts.en: Osunbiye is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She sells textbooks and notebooks. She has been in this business for the past 18 years. Osunbiye lives in Ogun state. She is requesting for the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more textbooks and notebooks to sell. She thanks all kiva lender.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks and notebooks to sell

loans.name: Omoloye

texts.en: Omoloye is 41 years old and married with 3 children. She sells firewood and rents out videos to earn a living. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more videos and firewood to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more videos and firewood.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el centro poblado menor Enrique López Albújar, ubicado en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años tiene un pequeño puesto en el Mercado José Balta, ubicado en una de las principales avenidas de Chiclayo, allí ejerce el oficio de costurera y trabaja todos los días con la finalidad de apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Ella trabaja en base a pedidos, aunque también confecciona diversas prendas de vestir que luego vende a sus clientes, el fruto de este trabajo lo invierte en la compra de más material para seguir confeccionando prendas.

Su más grande anhelo es poder crear un taller en donde sólo se dedique a la confección de prendas, y conforme vaya creciendo, emplear a otras mujeres que, como ella, comparten la misma necesidad de trabajo y las aptitudes y creatividad necesarias para progresar dentro de este tipo de negocio.

Sus dos hijos se encuentran estudiando y el deseo de brindarles un futuro mejor le motiva   a seguir luchando por lograr sus sueños y sacar adelante a su familia. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más material para seguir confeccionando prendas de vestir.

Rosalía ya ha venido trabajando con nosotros durante tres años y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerada una buena cliente.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 43 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the centre of Enrique Lopéz Albújar, a small village located in the city of Chiclayo. For the last 15 years Rosalía has had a small stall in the José Balta market, located in one of the principal avenues of Chiclayo. She works there every day as a seamstress to support the economic upkeep of her family. Although she works principally from orders, she also makes various items of clothing which she later sells to her customers. She invests the fruit of her work in more material to continue making clothes. Rosalía's greatest wish is to build a workshop where she could just concentrate on making clothes, and as her business grows, employ other women who, just like her, share the same need to work and the necessary aptitude and creativity to progress with this type of business. Both her children are currently studying and the desire to give them a better future motivates Rosalía to continue fighting to achieve her dreams and keep her family going. For this reason she is applying for a loan of 1800 nuevos soles which she intends to invest in more material to continue making items of clothing. Rosalía has already worked with Kiva's partner institution for 3 years and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in her repayments, for which she is considered to be a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to make clothes

loans.name: Adelio

texts.es:
El Sr.Adelio A. de 25 años de edad está casado hace 3 años con la señora Nathalia Vallejos de 20 años, la pareja no cuenta todavía con hijos.-  
El señor Adelio después del matrimonio decidió con su señora formar  su propio negocio con el capital que tenían, además con la ayuda de sus padres, empezaron con la cabina  telefónica y con el correr del tiempo incorporaron servicios de Internet, ventas de celulares y accesorios en general que le está resultando muy bien el negocio, teniendo en cuenta la ubicación del mismo al costado del mercado municipal, por el momento no tienen previsto tener hijos.-                        
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de celulares, accesorios y de esta forma tener variedad en las mercaderías disponibles y con eso tener la posibilidad de aumentar su ingreso mensual.
texts.en:
Adelio A. is 25, and he has been married to Natalia Vallejos, 20, for three years. The couple does not yet have children. After getting married, Adelio decided to start his own business with his wife. They used the money they had, and with help from his parents, they started with a telephone booth. As time went by they included Internet services, cell phones sales, and accessories sales. The business is generally going very well, and they have a good location by the municipal market. For the moment they do not plan on having children. He is asking for a loan to buy cell phones and accessories. This way he will have a variety of merchandise available, and he will have the possibility of increasing his monthly income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phones and accessories

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Jadat, es casada, tiene 43 años, cuatro hijos de 19, 16, 8 y 6 años, los tres menores están estudiando en al escuela estatal. 
Carmen se inició trabajando en una tienda como administradora, cuando bajaron las ventas se quedó sin trabajo y se dedicó a su casa, siempre buscando en que podía trabajar, pasó una etapa dificil porque a su esposo lo despidieron tambien del trabajo, sin embargo, Carmen quería salir adelante, asi que se puso a vender menú repartiéndolo por las diferentes tiendas de la Avenida San Juan (Al Sur de Lima, es una avenida muy comercial) hasta que formó un grupo de clientas que todos los días le piden menú, también se puso a vender raspadillas (helado de hielo molido con sabores de frutas). 
En Finca Perú ella aprendió a atender a los clientes y como ganar mas clientes, gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe.
Carmen Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la comprar de descartadles y víveres al por mayor, para dar menú todos los días.
El sueño de Carmen es  tener un negocio de venta de fruta en algún mercado, algo más estable.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Jadat”. She is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children (ages 19, 16, 8, and 6). The three youngest children are students at a state school.

Carmen started working as a store manager, but she lost her job when sales were low. She spent time at home and always kept looking for work. She went through a very difficult phase when her husband was also laid off from his job. However, Carmen was determined to get ahead so she began selling food items to different stores along San Juan Avenue (which is located in a commercial district in southern Lima). She soon accumulated a group of regular customers who requested her daily menu items. In addition, Carmen also began selling “raspadillas” (Peruvian snow cones – shaved ice with fruit toppings).

As a client of FINCA Perú, Carmen learned about customer service and how to attract more business. She is grateful for the training she has received.

Carmen needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy disposable dinnerware and groceries in bulk so that she can prepare and serve her daily menu items. She hopes to have another business selling fruit at the market or something more stable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries & disposable dishes in bulk

loans.name: Olga Hortencia

texts.es:
LA SRA. OLGA HORTENCIA A. A., CASADA, TIENE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD Y 4 HIJOS,UNA MUJER EMPRENDEDORA QUE ADMINISTRA SU PROPIA IMPRENTA DE NOMBRE “OLGRAF”, Y  HA INCULCADO EN SUS HIJAS LOS DESEOS DE PROGRESO A BASE DE SU PROPIO TRABAJO Y ESFUERZO.
HACE  20 AÑOS, INICIÓ TRABAJANDO COMO VENDEDORA PARA UNA IMPRENTA, ECONOMICAMENTE NO CUBRÍA SUS ESPECTATIVAS, PERO ADQUIRIÓ MUCHA EXPERIENCIA Y LUEGO DE UN TIEMPO, EMPEZÓ A TRABAJAR INDEPENDIENTEMENTE LO CUAL  LE RESULTABA  MUY TRABAJOSO YA QUE TENÍA QUE ALQUILAR  MÁQUINAS PARA CUMPLIR CON EL TRABAJO.
HOY EN DÍA CUENTA CON UN LOCAL EN UNA ZONA MUY COMERCIAL, CON EQUIPOS PROPIOS, ADEMÁS CON SUS INGRESOS HA CUBIERTO LOS GASTOS DE ESTUDIOS SUPERIORES DE SUS HIJAS.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO DESTINARÁ EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES PARA CUMPLIR CON UN PEDIDO DE LIBROS.
texts.en:
Olga Hortencia A. A. is married and is 43 years old. She has 4 children and is an entrepreneur who manages her own printing press named "Olgraf". She has instilled in her daughters' minds ideas of progress based on one's own work and effort. Twenty years ago, she began working as a salesperson for a printing press. Financially, she was unable to cover her expenses, but she gained a lot of experience. After some time, she started to work independently which made her very hardworking, given that she had to rent machines to carry out the work. Today, she has a shop in a commercial district with her own team. She has also covered her daughters' higher education costs with her income. She will use the loan that she is requesting to purchase materials to carry out a book order.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in materials for a book order

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia ANA MARIA, pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”, es natural de la ciudad de Tacna y radica en la ciudsd del Cusco.

La socia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijas, la mayor estudia en la universidad y la menor estudia en el colegio.    

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de ropa y de productos de belleza como cosméticos pulseras, perfumes, aretes, etc. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar su producción de venta de ropa e incrementar la venta de productos de belleza.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This is Ana Maria. She is a native of the city of Cusco and a member of the Amauta Communal Bank.

Ana Maria is 45 years old, married, and has two daughters. The older daughter is a university student while the younger one is in high school.

She divides her time between her household chores and her business selling clothing and beauty products such as cosmetics, bracelets, perfumes, earrings, etc. She is requesting a loan so that she can acquire more of these products.

Ana Maria is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & beauty products

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Lazaro tiene 47 años, está casado y es padre de 6 hijos; junto a su esposa tienen una casa propia, donde viven con toda su familia.
Desde su juventud se dedica a los trabajos de albañilería, construye casas de material noble y de adobe. En esta labor prefiere trabajar generalmente por contrata y de ser pequeños trabajos cobra a diario la suma de 35 soles por  tarea, incluido almuerzo. Asimismo, tiene sus cultivos de café y plátanos donde trabaja en compañía de su esposa e hijos. 
Pero lo que más le agrada a Lázaro son los trabajos de albañilería, ya que rápidamente acumula el dinero con el que mantiene a su familia, aunque  también sabe que es muy pesado, pues últimamente se ha sentido un poco adolorido de la columna, debido a que el mes pasado había cargado demasiado peso al trabajar en un techado.

Para Lázaro, este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que tiene grandes expectativas, además sabe que este dinero le será muy útil, pues comprará fertilizantes para sus cultivos y herramientas para su trabajo de albañil.
texts.en:
Lázaro is a 47-year-old married father of six. He and his wife have their own house where they live with all their family. Since he was young, he has done masonry, building houses out of concrete and adobe. He generally prefers to do contract work. He does small jobs that pay 35 soles per day, including lunch. Additionally, he grows coffee and bananas, working the farm in the company of his wife and children. But what makes Lázaro happiest is masonry.
