The work allows him to make money to support his family, but he knows it is hard work. Recently, he has felt pain in his back because last month he carried too much weight when working on a roof. This is Lázaro's first loan with Microfinanzas Prismas, and he has a lot of great expectations for it. He knows the money will be very useful, because it will allow to buy fertilizers for his farming and tools for his masonry work.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying masonry tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mrs. Som L., age 50, is pictured with her son at their house. To earn a living, Som L. cultivates a rice crop as well as raising some poultry. She was married, but her husband died of senility years ago and has left four children. Two of them have an occupation and the other two are unemployed.

Som L.’s employed children face difficulties with traveling. They go to work by a taxi or walking because they have no vehicle for riding purposes. To solve this obstacle, Som L. would like to request a loan to add to her savings to buy an old motorbike for her kids to use to commute to their work locations.

loans.use: To buy an old motorbike for her children's commute

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 49 years old. She is married and has six children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist area in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana, so the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing. Diana is a trader. She runs a provision store by the road side in the community and also sells food items. She procures her goods from Accra. Diana has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: Purchase provisions

loans.name: Burma's Group

texts.ru:
Абдылдаева Бурма – лидер данной группы. Она вместе с семьёй проживает в г. Карабалта. Бурме пятьдесят два года. Муж Бурмы работает школьным учителем. Бурма с мужем вырастили четверых детей. Старшей дочери тридцать три года. Второй дочери двадцать девять. Третьей дочери двадцать шесть лет, и младшему сыну двадцать два года. В семье Бурмы издавна господствуют демократические принципы, т.е. они с мужем предоставили детям свободу выбора своей профессии и будущего, предварительно дав им хорошее воспитание и образование. Старшие дочери уехали работать в Бишкек. Сын в данное время учится в университете. Старшая дочь стала модельером. Вторая дочь пошла по стопам отца и стала преподавателем. Третья дочь временно не работает. Бурма же осталась дома следить за хозяйством. Они с мужем на протяжении многих лет копили деньги с зарплаты и смогли купить корову. С тех пор Бурма занимается животноводством и продаёт молоко. В месяц Бурма зарабатывает три тысячи сомов ($60). Бурма решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы вложить деньги в покупку ещё одного бычка для содержания. Бурма сейчас хлопочет насчёт своих дочерей. Она надеется их выдать замуж, построить новый дом и сарай возле дома для скота. 

У Бурмы три партнёра по группе: 

Табалды – кызы Лаззат двадцать восемь лет. Лаззат – домохозяйка. Она разводит овец, держит коров и продаёт молоко. Муж Лаззат работает в охранном агентстве. У Лаззат двое детей. Дочери восемь и сыну пять лет. Лаззат обратилась за кредитом с целью купить кобылу для разведения. Лаззат мечтает увеличить поголовье скота и дать детям хорошее образование. 

Салыйке сорок один год. Салыйка занимается домашним хозяйством, разводит скот и продаёт молоко. Муж Салыйки работает в сельской администрации инспектором по наделу земли. У Салыйки четверо детей. Старшие дети учатся в университетах, дочь ходит в школу и младший сын – дошкольник. Салыйка решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы оплатить контракт за обучение сына. Дать образование детям – одна из самых важных целей всей жизни для Салыйки. 

Гульзат двадцать четыре года. Она не замужем. Гульзат самостоятельно ведёт своё хозяйство. Иногда ей помогают родители и брат. Скот достался ей от родителей. За счёт разведения скота Гульзат купила машину, бытовую технику и мебель. Гульзат надеется получить кредит и купить мобильный телефон. Она надеется отремонтировать дом, сарай и выйти замуж. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Burma Abdylaeva is the leader of this group. She lives in the city of Karabalta together with her family. Burma is fifty-two years old. Her husband works as a school teacher. Burma and her husband raised four children. The oldest daughter is thirty-three years old. The second daughter is twenty-nine. The third daughter is twenty-six, and the youngest son is twenty-two years old. Democratic principles have governed Burma’s family for a long time, i.e. Burma and her husband gave their children the freedom to choose their career and future, having previously given them good upbringing and education. Oldest daughters left to work in Bishkek. The son is currently attending a university. The oldest daughter became a designer. The second daughter followed her father’s footsteps and became a teacher. The third daughter is temporarily unemployed. Meanwhile, Burma stayed at home to take care of the household. Her husband and she have been setting money aside for many years and were able to buy a cow. Since then, Burma has been involved in animal husbandry and selling milk. Burma earns three thousand som ($60) in one month. Burma decided to request a loan in order to purchase and keep one more bull. Burma is now worried about her daughters. She hopes to marry them off, build a new house and barn for the livestock next to her home.

Burma has three partners in this group:

Lazzat T. is twenty-eight years old. Lazzat is a homemaker. She breeds sheep, keeps cows and sells milk. Lazzat’s husband works at a security agency. Lazzat has two children. Her daughter is eight and son is five years old. Lazzat requested a loan in order to purchase a mare for breeding. She dreams of increasing livestock headcount and providing her children with good education.

Saliyka is forty-one years old. She takes care of the household, breeds livestock and sells milk. Saliyka’s husband works at the village administrative office as a land inspector. Saliyka has four children. The oldest children are attending a university, and the youngest son is a preschooler. Saliyka decided to obtain a loan in order to pay off the contract for her son’s education. One of Saliyka’s most important goals is to provide her children with an education.

Gulzat is twenty-four years old. She is single. Gulzat runs her own household. Sometimes, her parents and brother help her with it. She got the livestock from her parents. Due to the income from livestock breeding, Gulzat was able to purchase a car, household appliances and furniture. Gulzat hopes to obtain a loan and purchase a mobile phone. She also hopes to repair her house, barn and get married.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase one more bull

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: G. Ayaba est née le 23 Juin 1966 à Ouidah dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Ayaba s'est installée à Godomey dans la commune d'Abomey-Calavi, il y a 17 ans environs. Mariée à GBESSINON Omer, Ayaba est mère de trois enfants. Le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Les dépenses de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Ayaba n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour assurer ses charges et venir en aide à son mari, Ayaba mène comme activité, la vente d'huile d'arachide et d'huile de palme à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Ayaba a complété la vente de sachets et de sucre en poudre, ce qui lui permet d'avoir une autre source de revenu. Ayaba mène cette activité depuis 12 ans environs et s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ayaba a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien remboursé le crédit. Actuellement Ayaba ne dispose pas suffisamment de fonds pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire tous ses clients et de se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses différentes charges. C'est donc pour renforcer son activité que Ayaba sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Ayaba G. was born June 23, 1966 in Ouidah, in the Department of the Atlantic of Benin. She settled approximately 17 years ago in Godomey, in the area of Abomey-Calavi. Married to Omer GBESSINON, Ayaba is mother of three children, but the couple have two other children under their care. Some of the children are educated. The couple share family expenses. Ayaba has not attended school. To meet her expenses and assist her husband, Ayaba sells peanut and palm nut oil from her home. She also sells plastic bags and powdered sugar, which provides her with an additional source of income. Ayaba has been doing this for the past 12 years, and gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Ayaba has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, and reimbursed it in full. She currently lacks the funds necessary to satisfy all her customers and generate sufficient profit to cover her various expenses. Therefore, Ayaba is requesting a second loan to bolster her activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 5 jerrycans of peanut and palm nut oil, two bags of sugar.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Forty-three-year-old Julita is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She is thankful she has a business she can earn money with. Her rice farm provides her family with food to eat, clothes to wear, and their other daily needs. She hopes to grow the farm to earn more so that her family’s living conditions can be improved. She has requested a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to acquire seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies that she is lacking.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Luisa Natali

texts.es:
La señora Luisa C. tiene diez años de dedicarse a la Costura, aprendio cuando trabajaba en una Maquila durante seis años, pero tuvo problemas de salud y no podia seguir trabajando, por eso decidio instalar su pequeño taller de costura, en su mayoria sus clientes le solicitan reparaciones a la 
ropa como ser cambio de ziper, pegar botones, hacer ruedos a pantalones entre otros, asi mismo esta temporada es buena porque comienzan las clases y le han solicitado la elaboracion de varios uniformes, tambien hace pantalones, camisas y faldas, doña Luisa es madre soltera, tiene dos niños
los cuales ya estan en las escuela, recibe ayuda monetaria del papa de los niños. 
Es muy trabajadora ya que tambien elabora refrescos naturales y charamuscas de varios sabores.
necesita el credito para comprar materiales para costurar.
texts.en:
Luisa C. has been a seamstress for 10 years. She learned while employed for six years at a Maquila (bonded assembly plant set up by a foreign firm). Health problems prevented her from continuing in that employment so she decided to set up a small tailoring workshop. Most of her customers request clothing repairs like: zipper replacements, button attachments, hemming pants, etc. In addition, this season is good because the new school term is starting and she has been asked for several school uniforms. She also makes pants, shirts and skirts. Luisa is a single mother; she has two children who are in school; she receives some child support help from the father of her children. She is very hard-working because she also prepares fruit juices and charamuscas (frozen fruit drink served in plastic bags) of various flavors. She needs funding to buy sewing materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, needles, pins and zippers.

loans.name: Patuju Group

texts.es:
El banco D. emprendimiento denominado  "Patuju", esta conformado D. 9 integrantes, los cuales se encuentran su primer ciclo,  en la mayoria D. los casos son pequeños comerciantes y productores.                                                                 
La Sra. Antonia es la presidenta del banco cumunal, vive en el municipo D. Cotoca Barrio San Juan D. Dios al rededor D. 12 años, vive en casa familiar con su esposo el Sr. Asis y con sus tres hijos. Tiene la Actividad D. elaboracion D. jalea el mismo que es comersializado en el mercado central D. Cotoca, esto con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Su esposo trabaja D. guardia D. seguridad en el centro D. la cuidad, el prestamo solicitado es para aumentar su capital ya que se encuentra con bastante pedido, el mismo que les ayudara a mejorar su calidad D. vida.                          
La Sra. Robertina es una D. las integrantes D. banco D. emprendimiento la cual vive por el municipo D. Cotoca Barrio Lindo, en casa familiar (D. la Madre), se dedica a la elaboracion D. masitas para venderlos en el mercado, y el prestamo solicitado es para aumentar la produccion del mismo, su objetivo es seguir en el negocio para que con este pueda seguir estudiando.                                                                                                                                             La Sra. Claudia vive en el barrio San Pablo del municipio D. Cotoca en la casa D. sus padres y su pequeño hijo D. 2 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, sabanas y edredones ambulando por las calles, el prestamo solicitado sera para compra D. mas mercaderia, su anhelo es llegar a contar con un negocio estable o puesto fijo para estar  un poco mas tranquila y atendiendo a su hijito, ya que es madre soltera y no cuenta con la ayuda del padre D. su hijo. 

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras, estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada enla otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The "Patuju" communal bank is comprised of 9 members, who are in their first loan cycle; most are small merchants and producers. Antonia is the group president; she has lived in the San Juan D. Dios neighborhood in Cotoca for about 12 years. She lives in the family home with her husband, Asis, and their three children. She makes jelly that, with her children’s help, she then sells in Cotoca’s central market. Her husband is employed as a security guard downtown. She will use the funds to increase her capital because she has quite a few pending orders and this will help improve their quality of life. Robertina is one of the members of the communal bank; she lives in Cotoca’s Barrio Lindo neighborhood. She lives in her mother’s house and makes masitas (a type of pastry) to sell in the market. She will use the funds to increase production; her goal is to continue working in her business so that she can continue with her studies. Claudia lives in Cotoca’s San Pablo neighborhood in her parents’ house; she has a two-year-old son. She sells clothing, sheets and bedspreads as a street peddler. She will use the funds to buy merchandise. Her goal is to have a fixed, stable sales location so that she can be a little calmer and able to care for her son; she is a single mother and gets no help from her son’s father. All of the members are responsible and hard-working people; they are grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa K. is married and has four children. She started her business from money she received from her eldest daughter.  She started trading cotton and poplin materials.  As her income continued to increase, she expanded by purchasing more items.  Hawa K. continues to sell the same type of goods.  

She can now boast of having farm land which she acquired as a result of her business.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan to expand her stock and generate more income.  She intends to increase the size of her farm land, travel to neighbouring countries to buy stock and build a dwelling house for her family.  She is honest and dedicated to her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa C. is from the village of Miputak. She is 37 years old. Rosa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling variety of products to local community and members. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosa from PMPC and 3rd in kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Marlene H. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Marlene is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marlene owns and operates a business providing transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a motorcycle-transport service. Marlene has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Marlene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Marlene is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the second loan taken out by Marlene from ASKI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Boutsomé

texts.en:
Madame Boutsomé A. is 43 years old. She's been selling fish from her home for the past two years. Boutsomé is married and has four children. Her husband is also a salesman of sorts. 

Boutsomé purchases her merchandise from Ghana. She is requesting a loan of 400,000 CFA to purchase 25 cartons of frozen fish. This will be her third loan from WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase frozen fish

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria C. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pudo comprar el equipo de sonido que necesitaba.
Solicita nuevamente un préstamo ya que tiene los gastos de la graduación de la escuela de su hija, no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar lo que le están pidiendo.
Pagara el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de renta de mesas y sillas para eventos sociales.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Maria C. is very thankful for the cooperation with the previous loan with which she was able to buy the sound system that she needed. She again requests a loan since she has the graduation expenses for her daughter, and does not have the necessary money to pay what they are asking of her. She will repay the loan with the profits that she obtains from her business renting tables and chairs for social events.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay graduation expenses for her daughter

loans.name: Katiuska Rocio

texts.es:
Katiuska tiene 34 años, es madre soltera  de dos niños, de 6 años y de 1año y 7 meses, el primero de sus hijos esta en segundo grado de primaria.,ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, huevo, gaseosas, harina, sal, fósforo, etc) ella comenzó a vender  en el 2004 en el  Jr Grau, cerca del mercado central, pero por motivos de incremento del pago de local tuvo que cambiar de local.
El 2007 se mudo a un local ubicado en Magdalena aquí permaneció hasta el 2008 al culminar el año tuvo que buscar otro local ya que no le quisieron renovar el contrato de arrendamiento. De esta manera encontró un nuevo local cerca del Mercado Nery García donde hasta la fecha se encuentra vendiendo desde el 2009 ella menciona que tiene muchos clientes ya que brinda una buena atención. 
Los Sueños y las metas que ella tiene es que sus hijos sean profesionales 
Katiuska menciona que gracias a las capacitaciones que Finca Perú le brinda esta mas pendiente de sus hijos y que tiene mayor cultura de ahorro.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de huevo, aceite, azúcar, harina, arroz, gaseosa.
texts.en:
Katiuska, 34, is a single mother of two children whose ages are 6 years and one year and 7 months; her oldest child is in second grade. She sells groceries (sugar, rice, eggs, soft-drinks, flour, salt, matches, etc.). She started out in 2004 selling in Jr. Grau near the central market but rent increases for her location necessitated a move to a different locale. In 2007 she moved to a location in Magdalena and stayed there until 2008. At the end of that year she looked for another place because they wouldn’t renew her rental contract. This is how she found a new place near the Nery García market where she’s been located since 2009. She tells us that she has many regular customers because she provides good customer service. Her dreams and goals are that her children become professionals. Katiuska mentions that it’s been thanks to Finca Perú’s training program that she is able to better care for her children and has improved her savings habit. She will use the loan to buy eggs, cooking oil, sugar, flour, rice and soft-drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs, cooking oil, sugar, flour, rice, soft-drinks.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah N. is a 51-year-old resident of Machakos town. She is a widow with three children, all of whom are younger than 18 years old. She has been farming for many years and later opened a retail shop. In her shop, she sells foods such as beans, maize, and peas to generate income for her family. Since she is the sole breadwinner in her family, she strives to educate her three children because she believes education is the key to a better future.

She joined the New Mwala group, whose members guarantee each others' loans from Faulu Kenya. She has previously borrowed two loans from Faulu Kenya, which she timely repaid and used to improve her business. For this reason, she is now seeking another loan, this time in the amount of 40,000 KES ($500). This loan would be used to add to her stock of beans, maize, and peas. She is determined to expand her business into a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., beans, maize, and peas)

loans.name: Mera Flor

texts.en:
Mera Flor G. is from the village of Poblacion, Sibutad. She is 23 years old and married with one infant child.

To make a living Mera Flor operates a business in construction, selling sand and gravel. Mera Flor has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Mera Flor joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from PMPC, for 7000 PHP, to invest in her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Aoua

texts.fr:
Madame Aoua Traoré est âgée de 34 ans, mariée mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier de  Koulikoro de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Aoua  n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier, ce qui justifie son intégration dans le commerce qu’elle apprit auprès de sa mère depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle s’est finalement initiée à l’achat la vente d’articles divers (tels les tissus, chaussures, et autres) depuis 11 ans.  Madame Aoua  Traoré est très  sollicitée et appréciée par ses clients pour la qualité de ses articles.  
Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, Aoua  a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a  3 ans. Après avoir  4 prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel dont le précédent a été bien payé.  
Elle compte acheter, 20 pièces  de pagnes wax avec ce prêt.  
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue sa vente en ville  à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant  et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de son échéance, participer aux charges quotidiennes de la famille et poursuivre son activité avec le reste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aoua Traoré is a 34 year old married mother of four. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband and children in the Koulikoro neighborhood of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region). For sociocultural reasons Aoua never went to school, which is why she is now practicing the business she learned at her mother's knee. After unsuccessfully trying a number of different activities, she settled into buying and selling assorted goods (fabrics, shoes, etc.) 11 years ago. She is greatly sought after, and her clients appreciate her because of the quality of her goods. In order to grow her business and satisfy her clients, Aoua decided to join the microfinance partner Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. She has been a part of 4 group loans and is now requesting her second individual loan; all her previous loans were repaid on time. She plans to buy 20 wax print wraps with this loan. She buys her goods at the Koutiala market and sells them in town for cash or credit, to a clientele of both women and men. She expects to earn 90,000 francs per month income which she will use to make loan repayments, contribute to the daily expenses of the family, and re-invest into her business.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wax print wraps

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Huaquillay Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Ofelia, tiene 63 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos ya adultos. hace cinco años  forma parte del grupo "Santa Rosa de Huaquillay" integrado por siete personas residentes del distrito de Comas.
Hace ocho años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, inició vendiendo los cosméticos por catálogo, ofreciendo a sus familiares y amigos. Asi también encargaba sus productos con una amiga que tenía su puesto en el mercado para que pudiera venderselo; hasta que esta amiga le recomendó alquilarse un puesto y ella no lo pensó dos veces. Desde ese día empezó a trabjar en el mercado, puso un puestito de bazar.
Con su trabajo diario ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio, ha surtido variedad de productos de belleza y marcas, y éste negocio le permite solventar sus gastos personales y de salud.
con el préstamo solicitado invertirá en la compra de vinchas, ganchos, accesorios de cabello para damas.
texts.en:
Rosa Ofelia is 63 years old, married, and has four grown children. For five years, she has been a member of the “Santa Rosa de Huaquillay” group, which is comprised of seven people that reside in the Comas district. She has dedicated herself to selling beauty products for eight years, having started by selling items to relatives and friends from catalogs. She also sold through a friend who had a stall at the local market and could sell products for her. Her friend recommended she lease her own place in the market, which Rosa didn’t have to think twice about. Since then, she has been working at the market in a small bazaar she opened. Her daily efforts have allowed her to grow her business, supplying it with a variety of beauty products and brands. This business allows her to cover her personal and health expenses. She will use the loan she requests to buy barrettes, pins, and other women’s hair accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair pins, barrettes and accessories.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna G. is from the village of Sapang Dalaga. She is 44 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Paterna owns and operates an agricultural business venture raising hogs. Paterna has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 2,900 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Paterna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paterna is requesting her first loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Cano Romero

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Calceta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Agustín, ciudad conocida por su gente trabajadora y sus mujeres hermosas.
 
La señora M. tiene 56 años, esta casada y tuvo 8 hijos todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven con ella, uno de sus hijos es especial (discapacitado)  y con mucho amor y abnegación ella  lo cuida y lo seguirá haciendo toda su vida, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella desde hace muchos años aprendió  corte y confección, tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde realiza muchos trabajos a las personas que le llegan a buscar ya que ella siempre ha quedado bien con sus clientes y según sus clientes es muy buena en lo que hace, confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero dice que prefiere la ropa de damas ya que hay más variedad de diseños. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9am hasta las 12pm y desde las 15h00 hasta las 18h00,  en las noches cose su hija, ella le ayuda cuando tiene muchos encargos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace dos años, la llevo su hermana y le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir los prestamos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran taller para administrarlo  con su hija.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Calceta the San Agustin communal bank meets every two weeks. The city is known for its hardworking people and beautiful women.  
 
M. is 56 years old. She is married and has 8 grown children. Three of them live with her, and one of her children is special (handicapped). With much love and sacrifice she takes care of him and she will continue to do so for her whole life.  Her husband is a farmer. 

Many years ago she learned to cut and sew clothing. She has a small sewing workshop where she does a lot of work for people who seek her out because she has always pleased her customers. She is very good at what she does; she makes all kinds of clothing but says she prefers women's clothing, since there is more variety in the designs. She works every day from 9am until 12 am and from 3 p.m. until 6 p.m. At night she sew with her daughter, who helps when she has a lot of orders.

She will use this loan to buy fabric and other materials for sewing. She has been in the communal bank for two years. Her sister took her and she likes how easy it is to take out loans. 
 
Her dream is to have a large workshop to run with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina A. is married and has four children. She has been through senior high education. Sakina sells maize and smokes fish at Abura. Her husband is a driver. Sakina uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Sakina will use the loan to buy additional fresh fish to smoke for sale. Sakina plans to invest the new profits from her expanded business in her children’s education.

loans.use: buy additional fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Mirzorahmad

texts.en:
S. Mirzorahmad is 49 years old, is married and lives with his wife and 8 children. He has been a farmer for the past 14 years, which he began with the goal of supporting his household and above all to satisfy the needs of his children. For Mirzorahmad, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Within it, vegetable production is what he likes most as it is easier to cultivate these plants and the product is profitable in season, which is annually. But the earnings are greater and beneficial for every farmer, especially when buyers purchase the product in great quantities and the expense of transporting the products is avoided as the buyers come to harvest and take them away themselves. Now Mirzorahmad wishes to borrow money, which he wants to invest in seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. He is sincerely grateful to all of you.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Uong's Group

texts.en:
The four members of this group loan live in Boeng Kraom village in Kandal province. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to  improve their businesses. They have selected Mrs. Uong S. as group leader. 

Mrs. Uong S.  was born in 1964.  She is the mother of four children, two of whom are farmers while the others are attending school.  Mrs. Uong S. and her husband, Mr. Doul An, are farmers who own a seven-hectare plot of land where they grow rice and corn to sell to support their family. They also own a flour machine for rent to anyone who needs it.  

Her problem is that her crop field is far away from the irrigation system, so to improve production, Mrs. Uong S. is requesting a loan to buy gasoline.

loans.use: To buy gasoline

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es: Giovanna, de 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su madre y sus 2 hermanas, juntas cada día se esfuerzan por salir adelante. El día empieza muy temprano para esta dedicada profesora, pues debe recibir a los alumnos en  su centro educativo y comenzar con las enseñanzas diarias que los educará para que sus niños sean  hombres de bien. Desde hace 10 años empezó con la labor de docente, y desde entonces trabajo con mucho ánimo hasta que logró refaccionar su casa;  y ahí mismo instaló su centro educativo particular. Le gusta mucho el trabajo porque con el tiempo ha ido mejorando su negocio y en la actualidad también es la encargada de mandar confeccionar los uniformes de los educandos y por esto obtiene regulares ganancias. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado continuar con la ampliación del colegio ya que  quiere brindarles lo mejor a los niños. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Giovanna tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en el refaccionamiento de los servicios higiénicos de su centro educativo pues desea  mejorar el colegio  para beneficio de sus alumnos.
texts.en: Giovanna, age 33, lives in her own house beside her mother and her 2 sisters. They work hard together every day to move forward in life. The day begins very early for this dedicated teacher. She must greet students at her educational center and begin the day’s lessons, which will teach the children to become good men. She began her work as a teacher 10 years ago. From then she worked enthusiastically until she managed to refurbish her house. There in her house she created her private educational center. She likes her work very much because over time she has been improving her business. Currently she is also in charge of ordering uniforms made for the pupils. This gets her regular profits. Because she is a very enterprising woman, she plans to expand the school to provide the best for the children. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She commits herself to making payments on time. She does not want to be on bad terms with the people that have made possible the money which allows her to continue working towards progress. Giovanna plans to invest the requested money in refurbishing the two restrooms in her educational center. She wants to improve the school for the benefit of its students.

loans.use: Refubrish the restrooms in her educational center

loans.name: Victor Nicolas

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 56 años de edad, es separado y vive solo en la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad bastante conocida por su movimiento comercial y de transporte, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace más de diez años vendiendo sandalias y zapatillas en el exterior del mercado del distrito de Pomalca, un distrito agrícola situado a quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Todos los días viaja hacia ese centro de abasto para comercializar la mercadería que previamente ha adquirido en el Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Esta actividad es su única fuente de ingreso, por lo que siempre trata de mantenerla de la mejor manera.

Víctor desea adquirir mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio, ya que durante los meses de verano la demanda por las sandalias suele aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Víctor ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el Fondo Kiva, a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. Con el dinero de aquel préstamo pudo adquirir mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Gracias a esa colaboración su negocio ha podido tomar un pequeño impulso para empezar a desarrollarse, lo que le hace sentirse contento y agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Víctor, 56, is separated and lives alone in the city of Chiclayo, a city that is quite well known because of its commercial movement and as a transportation hub; it’s the capital of Lambayeque region.

He has worked for over ten years selling sandals and slippers in the outdoor market in Pomalca district, a farming district located fifteen minutes from Chiclayo.  He goes to the wholesale foodstuffs market every day to sell his wares which he has previously purchased in Chiclayo’s Modelo Market.  This activity is his only source of income so he always works to maintain it in the best possible way.

Víctor would like to buy more merchandise for his business because during the summer months demand for sandals increases.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan.

Víctor has had a previous Kiva funded loan through Edpyme Alternativa and its Seed Capital program.  With money from that loan he was able to buy more merchandise to expand his business.  Thanks to that collaboration his business got a small push to start developing which makes him happy and grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy sandals.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas W., age 33, runs a general open air business in Tala. He is married to Gladys Ndulu, age 30, and they don’t have any children. He has been running his business for two years and his monthly profit is 12,000 Kenyan shillings.
 
Thomas was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Tala office. This loan of 20,000 KES is his first loan with KADET and he intends to use the loan to increase his stock of baby toys, cosmetics, umbrellas, belts and necklaces for resale. If the loan boosts his business, Thomas will add stock to his business and pay school fees for his sisters and brothers. Thomas dreams of having a big shop. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To increase stock of baby toys, cosmetics, umbrellas, belts and necklaces

loans.name: Darou Ndiaye Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité est crée le 14/05/2010.il est composé de 13 femmes venant du même quartier. le groupe a été composé par affinité entre ses membres et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de FONK SA BOPP GRAND LOUGA.

GNAGNA T. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du Groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. 

Elle fait du commerce de légume au marché central de son quartier depuis plusieurs années. Elle est à son second prêt avec CAURIE-MF

Elle compte appuyer son mari dans la prise en charges du ménage
texts.en:
This group was formed on May 14, 2010. It is made up of 13 women members, all originally from the same quarter. The group came together through friendships and neighbors. The group is part of the community bank named Fonk Sa Bopp Grand Louga. 

Gnagna T. is pictured in the far right in the photo and she is the leader of the group. She is 43 years old, she is married, and she has 7 children. 

She has had a produce business for many years, selling in the central market of her neighborhood. This is her second loan through Caurie-MF (Kiva Field Partner).

She plans on helping her husband support their family.

loans.use: To purchase produce for resale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba F. is married and has four children. Her husband is a fisherman, while Aba is a fish monger in Elmina. Aba uses her income to assist her husband in feeding and clothing and for the education of her children.

Aba will use her loan to purchase extra fish to smoke for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to buy some land.

loans.use: To purchase extra fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Achola

texts.en: M. Achola is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 29 years old, married to a teacher, and has 2 children – 1 is currently attending school. M. borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to resell. In the future, with the extra profits from  her business she hopes to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia P. C., es de la Ciudad de Santaní, del barrio Coronel Vicente Mongelos, es soltera, propietaria de una despensa en su propio domicilio, cuenta con clientela bien formada, con buen ingreso mensual, posee buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
Según ella que empezó a trabajar como macatera (vendedora ambulante de comestibles) por la zona de Guayaybi y Santaní. Y ahora ya tiene una despensa bien surtida.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la ayuda que le brinda, gracias a eso compra más mercaderías para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, su sueño es tener un local comercial más amplio para obtener más  ingresos mensuales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia P. C. lives in the city of Santaní in the Coronel Vicente Mongelos neighborhood.  She is single and runs a grocery store out of her home.  She has a well-established customer base and a good monthly income.  She also has good business and personal references.

She began to work as a food peddlar in the areas of Guayaybi and Santaní.  And now she has a well-stocked grocery store.

She is grateful to the Paraguaya Foundation for the assistance she receives.  Thanks to the loan she is able to buy enough goods to meet customer demand.  Her dream is have a larger store so she can increase her monthly earnings.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables, bread and beverages

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, tiene 52 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de provincia de Talara del departamento de Piura. Actualmente, Susana vive en la ciudad del Anta del departamento del Cusco. Susana es un mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de papa, maíz y leche.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Susana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar queso como por ejemplo leche, sal y otros ingredientes. 

Susana pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de las Casas” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Susana is 52 years old and has four children. She was born in Talara Province in the Department of Piura. At the moment, Susana lives in the city of Anta in the Department of Cusco. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who succeeds on behalf of her family. Susana is a merchant who sells potatoes, corn, and milk. She has been in this business for several years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Susana is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy supplies for making cheese, such as milk, salt, and other ingredients.

Susana is a member of the Communal Bank “San Bartolomé de Las Casas”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for this opportunity being given to her and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making cheese.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Vin S. is a 44-year-old widow who currently lives in Siem Reap province. She earns a profit by providing massage to people who need to relax their bodies. She started this job over three years ago.
Vin S. is blessed with four single children who are enrolled in school. She faces difficulties with her traveling needs because she always pays a lot of money for a taxi when she goes to work. Therefore, she hopes to reduce the amount she spends on transportation by using her loan to purchase a used motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria Elena; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de colchas, también hace el negocio de llamadas en forma ambulatoria y también vende loseria como platos, tazas, ollas entre otras, la socia se dedica a diferentes negocios pequeños, la socia por medio de estos negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar los negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para sus negocios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gloria Elena is a member of the "Siempre Unidos" (Always United) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Gloria Elena is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her businesses.  Gloria sells  bedspreads.  She also has a call business which she doesn't carry out from a fixed location and sells pottery products such as plates, cups, pans, etc.  She runs more than one small business.  Her businesses enable her to get her children ahead in life and she would like to expand them.

Gloria is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her businesses.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her businesses

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace D. has ten children. Married to a farmer, she helps support their large family by running a provision store in her village Mfuom, which is near Abura town in Ghana’s Central Region. Grace’s income from her provision store helps pay for school fees and some other household expenses. Currently, she sells goods such as tinned tomatoes and fish, oil and water. In order to grow her business, she needs a loan from Kiva to purchase more of these goods and a greater variety of items. This will help her attract a larger customer base and cater to the needs of her existing clients. The anticipated additional earnings will be reinvested into her business and also saved up for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more and a greater variety of items.

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken S. lives in Ddmashen village in the Sevan area with his wife, his mother and his brother. Babken is 32 years old and for 10 years he has been running his own farm. Besides animal husbandry, Babken is also busy with beekeeping and he likes his occupation very much. His family helps him a lot on his farm and with this shared work they provide for their family. 

Babken needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy 20 beehives and bee colonies. This will allow him to increase his family’s income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy 20 beehives and bee colonies

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 21-year-old farmer from the village of Bejano, South Georgia. She lives with her husband, his parents and brother and two-year-old daughter. Anna’s husband and his brother are musicians. Anna and all the family members are involved in agriculture. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow potatoes, carrots and beets. The harvested vegetables are sold locally to the wholesalers. Along with the above-mentioned business, the family owns a small dairy farm. 

With the requested loan, Anna plans to purchase calves and seeds for potatoes. Potatoes will be sown in their plot. The calves will be raised and sold after six months for a higher price. 

With the income from the sales of the potatoes and calves, the family plans to purchase a house in the village.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and seeds to sow

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio es un joven de 21 años con mucha capacidad de riesgo, desde hace 6 años y proveniente de Valledupar en el departamento del Cesar, vino a vivir a la ciudad de Barranquilla en casa de su tía y  decidió emprender su propio negocio en el que actualmente su tía lo apoya; él tiene un punto de venta cerca a un complejo comercial llamado “Metrocentro”, donde vende chancletas y calzado en general,  sus clientes son los peatones que por allí circundan de día y de noche y que él ha aprovechado muy bien para posicionarse,  porque el sitio donde está ubicado es un corredor comercial  de mucho movimiento, lo cual  favorece  sus ventas.  Julio compra y  vende de contado y al detal, aunque también tiene algunos clientes a quienes les financia sus compras, pues  ellos distribuyen en otros mercados sus productos  al menudeo. Aunque la competencia que rodea al negocio es alta,  también encuentra muchas oportunidades en el mercado, porque entre todos los comerciantes  se conocen y entre ellos, hay mucha cooperación. Julio es un joven con muchos sueños entre los cuales está el tener su casa propia, por eso persiste en su labor diaria, aunque tenga el gran desafío del pequeño capital de trabajo con el que funciona. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual recurre a su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  con el cual comprará calzado en mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos por la compra de contado y la cantidad, pues  se está preparando,  desde ahora, para el segundo semestre del año que trae muchos festivos, vacacionales y especialmente la fiesta del día del padre que se acerca y tiene clientes que le han encargado las chancletas que regalarán a sus progenitores, a propósito de esa temporada comercail. Mientras Julio se esmera por cumplir su sueño de crecimiento personal y empresarial, continua esforzándose por incrementar la rentabilidad sobre sus ventas que en la actualidad es no menor del 32%.
texts.en:
Julio, 21, has worked for the last 6 years with a large risk capacity.  He moved to Barranquilla from Valledupar, Cesar department and lives with his aunt and decided to set up his own business with her help.  His store is near a commercial complex called “Metrocentro” where he sells sandals and different types of shoes.  His customers are the pedestrians who are around day and night and he has done well by positioning himself in a commercial area with a lot of traffic which helps sales.  Julio buys and sells retail with cash , although he has a few customers who buy on credit but they are the ones who sell his products retail in other markets.  Although he has a lot of competition near his business, he has also found many opportunities in the market because  the merchants know each other and there is a lot of cooperation.  

Julio is a young man with great dreams, like having his own house, and that is why every day he persists in his work, although his challenge is his small amount of working capital.  This is the reason he is requesting a Kiva loan with his first financing though the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He will use it to buy a large quantity of shoes so that he can receive discounts while paying with cash, and he is saving up for the second half of the year when there are many holidays, vacations and especially Father’s Day.  It is coming soon, and he has customers who have ordered sandals to give to their fathers.  Besides this is a season of many sales.  While Julio works hard to fulfill his dream of personal and business growth, he continues making an effort to raise the profit from his sales that are now no less than 32%.

loans.use: To buy sandals and a variety of shoes wholesale and with cash

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es: La señora Bertha Alicia es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene sueños y proyectos en su vida. Hace 2 años puso su negocio de abarrotes denominado “Miscelánea Minerva” donde ofrece todo en abarrote en general, refrescos, lácteos,  botanas y más de marcas reconocidas a un bajo precio. En este momento Bertha solicita de un préstamo para pagar a uno de sus proveedores, que le surte la mercancía y para no tener solo los estantes necesita realizar esa compra para que su negocio este bien surtido y de esta manera reciba mayores ganancias para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bertha Alicia is a very hard working woman who has dreams and life projects.  Two years ago she opened her grocery store called “Miscelánea Minerva” where she stocks all kinds of groceries in general, soft drinks, dairy products, snacks and other products of well known brands at low prices.

At this time, Bertha is asking for a loan to pay one of her suppliers who supplies her merchandise so that her shelves won’t be empty.  She has to make this purchase so that the business will be well stocked in order for her to earn higher profits to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay her suppliers.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del  Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de San José”, ubicado en el distrito de Mañazo,  provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Tiene estudios universitarios.
Su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de carnes de cordero.  Trabaja desde hace tres ciclos con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos. 
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevo soles, comprará cinco degollados de cordero.  Nos cuenta que los compra en las ferias de la  localidad y los vende a las tiendas, en el negocio la ayudan su suegro y su cuñado, su esposo trabaja en la mina de Cusco.
Su sueño es crecer más en el negocio y tener su propia tienda de carne así mejorar las ganancias.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the communal bank  “Santa Rosa de San José”, located in the Mañazo district in the province and department of Puno.  She is 28 years old, lives with her partner and has one child.  She has attended university.
Her first loan was for 500 New Soles, money which she invested in her business of buying and selling lamb meat.  She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement through three cycles.
With this new loan of 1200 New Soles she will buy five lamb carcasses.  She buys them at the local markets and she sells to stores.  Her father in law and brother in law help her in the business.  Her husband works in the mine at Cusco.
Her dream is to grow her business and have her own meat store this way improving her income.
What she likes about the communal bank is the ease and punctuality of the loans.

loans.use: to purchase five carcasses of lamb.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 57 and a married mother of 6 children, ages between 15 and 25. Three of the children are currently attending school. Annah has been in the farming business for 15 years now, producing pineapples, bananas, tea and milk which she sells locally. She mainly depends on her farming income to cater to her family's needs.

Annah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES in order to purchase a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable her to pay school fees for her children and improve her family's livelihood. She hopes that in the next 5 years, her dairy farm will have greatly improved since she intends to buy quality dairy cows. She faces the challenge of diseases which affect her production.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Rabiia

texts.en: Rabiia is a 33-year-old single woman who has been working in women's beauty and care for 20 years. She was very young when she started this business, in order to help with her family’s income. She opened her one salon in 2007 to improve her living and to increase her capital. Rabiia is a hardworking woman who is preparing herself to get married soon. That’s why she requested a loan from Al Majmoua. She wants to increase her beauty creams capital and finish her wedding preparations. Rabiia has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive loans. All of them had an excellent effect on her social and financial situation and she is a good standing borrower. Rabiia hopes to stay up on her customers’ opinion and meet their needs.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty creams

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña Maria, de profesion tecnica quirurgica, se desempeña en un hospital de la capita, madre de dos hijos, estudiantes, su esposo labora en ventas.
Como meta ha sido la terminacion de su casa, en donde, le falta repello, techo y piso, pero esta contenta por que cada dia logra cerrarla mas. Asi como tambien, el terminar su carrera es de gran gozo y beneficios para su familia, el cual hizo mucho esfuerzo para alcanzar su profesion. Y que tambien fue con Afodenic que logro comprar unos libros bien caros.
Asi como la terminacion de su casa, con estos financiamientos , en donde con este prestamo invertira en compra de laminas de zinc, arena, cemento, perlines, golosos y seguir la obra.
Y asi pasarce pronto a su nueva casa, con su familia, el cual ha sido el sueño ahnelado.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a surgical technician who works in a hospital in the capital city.  She has two school-aged children and her husband is a salesman.  Her goal is to finish her house which requires the drywall, a roof and flooring, but she is content to be able to do a little each day.  She is also happy about finishing her education because of the benefits to the family.  It took a lot of effort to earn her degree.  Through Afodenic she was able to buy the expensive books she needed.

She plans to use the loan to buy zinc sheeting, sand, cement, supports, screws and pay for the work.  She hopes to be able to move into the new house soon with the family, which is their greatest wish.

loans.use: To buy zinc, supports, screws, sand, and cement for a roof and walls

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en: Miguela works hard to support her family. Miguela is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Miguela requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Miguela would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Pheary

texts.en: Pheary is newly-married to her second husband and has three sons. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 25 kilometers from the center of town. Pheary earns a living by selling rice in a local market, while her husband drives a taxi. She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy more rice to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mayra Virginia

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mayra es socia del banco comunal Eugenio Espejo, vive por la parroquia de Baños, en este  lugar hay fuentes a de aguas termales y tiene muchos sitios para visitar, cuenta con variada gastronomía típica del lugar, su gente es amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones del sector.

La Señorita. Mayra tiene 21 años, es madre soltera de una niña de un año y seis meses. Vive en casa de su mamá quien le apoya en sus estudios ya que se encuentra en el cuarto año de contabilidad superior y auditoria en una universidad de la ciudad.
  
Ella para aportar al hogar y también para ayudar a su mamá ofrece a sus amigas de estudios y conocidas la ropa que su mamá vende.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para continuar con el negocio familiar. 

Su meta es tener un almacén para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Mayra is a member of the “Eugenio Espejo” communal bank.  She lives in Baños Parish.  This is a place where there are thermal springs and lots of places to visit.  It has a varied cuisine that’s typical of the area.  Its people are very kind and maintain the culture and traditions of the sector.

Mayra is 21 years old and the single mother of a year-and-a-half old daughter.  She lives in her mother’s house who helps her with her school costs since she’s in the fourth year of accounting and auditing at the local university.  

To be able to contribute to the household and to help out her mother she offers the clothes her mother sells to her classmates and acquaintances.  This is her first loan with the communal bank that she was invited to join by her mother.  The money from the loan will be used to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes to continue with the family business.  Her goal is to have a store to sell her merchandise in.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a 41 year old single lady who loves nature. She became a florist and opened her own store in Wehdat 7 years ago.

During these 7 years she has added another section to her store that sells decoration accessories. She has gained a lot of good feedback from the customers. Now Basma has applied for this loan to add more types of plants and flowers to what she sells.

loans.use: to add more types of plants and flowers to what she currently sells.

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en:
Mrs. Chheang, 39, is married with six children who are single and live together with her. Some of her children work in a garment factory located in Kampong Chhnang province. They do not have their own motorcycle to use to travel to work. That is why they have to spend money for daily transportation fees. Mrs. Chheang is in the business of selling mixed products in her community. She sells items like groceries, sweets, canned food, packed food and other kinds. She usually earns around $2 USD per day from this business.

Mrs. Chheang has requested some funds from Kiva through HKL to support her children by buying a second motorcycle for them to use to travel to work. This loan will help reduce the expenses of transportation for the family and improve her living conditions.

In the future, Mrs. Chheang hopes to expand her store because many items are sold out.

loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle for her children

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is married and has a business selling ice cream in the Philippines.

Nida requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

Nida has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has been involved in the milk business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last year. He is 22 years old and single.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more milk stock for sale in his shop.

In the future, Joel hopes to expand his milk business to more areas in Ndunyu Njeru town and to become one of the leading milk traders and distributors in the area.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Mwanzo B Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is the facilitator of the Mwanzo B group. Her group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Everlyne is a mother of four children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Everlyne will build a house and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Mwanzo B group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
Everlyne is pictured with her group members, with their Field Officer, Ben, on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимджон начинал свою деятельность с купли- продажи скота и их откармливания. Более 5 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и успешен в своем деле. Он покупает скот на рынке кишлака, привозит домой и откармливают их в течение 15-20 дней. После откармливания  продает на местном  рынке за хорошую цену, от  которой получает прибыль. Олимджон запрашивает займ для покупки мелко рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Олимджон надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас за ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Olimjon started his business with buying and selling livestock and fattening it up.  He has been involved in this business for over five years and is successful at it.  He buys livestock at the village market, delivers it home and fattens it up for 15-20 days.  After fattening it up, Olimjon sells livestock at the local market at a good price, from which he gets a profit.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of small livestock in order to expand his business.  Olimjon relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your mercy.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El señor Raúl se dedica a la venta de CDs y DVDs al por menor. El crédito que solicita es para aumento de capital para comprar mayor cantidad de Vds., pues en estas fechas navideñas suben sus ventas. Raúl es soltero y  tiene  dos hijos. Vive en casa alquilada  ubicada en la zona  de Villa Nueva Potosí de la Ciudad de La Paz. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los  créditos otorgados anteriormente (dos) que fueron pagado puntualmente. Esta es la segunda vez que desea que su crédito sea enviado a kiva para fondeo.
texts.en: Raúl sells CDs and DVDs at retail.  The loan he’s requesting is to increase capital and sell a larger amount of DVDs because during the Christmas season sales increase.  Raúl is single and has two children.  He lives in a rented house in the city of La Paz’s Villa Nueva Potosí zone.  He is very satisfied with his previous loans (two) which were promptly repaid.  This is the second time he’s wanted his loan to be sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy more DVDs.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru:
Мансуру 50 лет, женат, воспитывает четверых детей. Основным источником дохода для семьи Мансура является животноводство, начатое им в 2007 году на кредит компании «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Мансура,  в  его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется дойная корова и 28 баранов, а также заготовлено 500 кг хлопка на продажу.
В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Мансур обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма. Доходы от кредита Мансур планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в  будущем –дать образование своим детям.
texts.en:
Mansur is 50 years old, married and raising four children. The main source of income for Mansur's family is animal breeding, which he began in 2007 after a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners". Thanks to Mansur's persistence and perseverance, he currently has one dairy cow and 28 sheep on his farm, and also a harvest of 500 kilos of cotton for sale. 

In order to further increase the number of livestock, Mansur turned to the company "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cattle for fattening. Mansur plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase the number of livestock, and in the future provide education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: La señora Benigna  es una cliente antigua de la institución,  es una persona responsable y emprendedora tiene una tienda de barrio-ferretería la cual esta ubicada en la zona de María auxiliadora, en su mismo domicilio que es casa propia, también vende comida por las mañanas en la misma zona en la parada de trufis,  su familia esta conformada por  su hija que se encuentra estudiando, La Sra. Benigna es separada de su esposo, por lo que ella es la única persona que sustenta su familia y con la educacion de su hija quien es su razon de vivir como dice la Sra. Benigna, el crédito solicitado le permitirá comprar abarrotes para surtir su tienda y continuar desarrollando su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Benigna has had previous loans with Emprender, and is a responsible and enterprising person. She has a neighborhood and hardware store, located on the periphery of the María district, in her home, which she owns. She also sells food in the morning at the bus stop in the same district. 

She has a daughter who is in school, and Benigna says her daughter is her reason for living. Benigna is separated from her husband, so she is the only person to support her family and the education of her daughter.

The money from the requested loan will allow her to purchase goods to stock her store and continue developing her business.

loans.use: to have the working capital to purchase goods for her store

loans.name: Marco Vinicio

texts.es:
MARCO VINICIO tiene31 años de edad es casado tiene una hija de 9 años de edad, vive con la esposa y con la hija en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

MARCO VINICIO es empleado privado. Solicita el crédito para comprar material cemento, barillas, piedra, arena. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la construcción. 

Las compras las realizará en Guaranda. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades por el mal clima.

 El sueño es terminar de estudiar.  En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarce a su familia.
texts.en:
Marco is 31 years old. He is married and has a 9-year-old daughter. He lives with his wife and daughter in the city of Chimbo, Bolivar Province.

Marco is a private employee. He is requesting this loan to buy materials such as cement, bars, stone, and sand. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy what is necessary for construction.

He will make his purchases in Guaranda. The challenges that he is facing are illnesses due to the bad weather.

His dream is to complete his education. In his free time, he likes to devote himself to his family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, bars, stone, and sand.

loans.name: Judeth

texts.en:
Judeth is a married woman, 49 years old with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Judeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. Judeth requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase new fishing nets, tackle and gasoline for her boat.

Judeth has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets, tackle and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
This description was written by Moses Onyango, a staff member for Kiva and VEF in Uganda

Joseph O. is a hardworking man who buys the goats from rural areas and keeps them at his home tied with ropes on their necks and takes them to graze by pegging their ropes on the ground so that they do not disturb the neighbors he takes them water in the middle of the day and then goes to bring them back in the evening and ties them a round his Varanda of his house on the pole or pegs.

Joseph started with goat keeping and selling of goats right away. Most Butchers have known his business. So a number of them come to him and buy the goats. He can buy and sell between 10 â€“ 15 goats with great profit.

He feeds them basically on grass, potatoes pealings. For us in especially Eastern Uganda, the grass is plenty and free so he feeds the goats on grass and potatoe pealings are seasonal. The goats normally spend only eight month and itâ€™s old and grown enough for other slaughter or sell.

The market is very open since most Ugandan rear goats and cows for raising money whenever, need arises like school fees and sickness.

Joseph has attended business training and he is capable of handling and paying the loan back.

loans.use: Buy goats

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
Nafisa is 54 years old and lives with her 5 children in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

She shares a business with her husband with whom she took a 2nd loan cycle. Like a good partner, Nafisa cleans and packages the goods and then her husband sells them at the bazaar. With this process they can make a good income.

They believe that by taking a loan through AFSG they can buy more goods and increase their business.

loans.use: To buy goods .

loans.name: Logo

texts.en: Logo’s husband works full-time and earns about ST 150 per week.  Leveraging her horticulture talents, Logo can often bring in more than that by selling the flowers and plants that she raises in her backyard.  Logo’s talents are so well known in her village that her local customers generally seek her out at home to purchase her renowned flora.  The income from her sales is a necessary contribution to meeting the needs of her family of six.
