Counted among her dependents is Logo’s elderly mother, who relies on Logo and her husband for care and financial support.  Providing a loan to Logo will allow her to purchase the additional supplies (seeds, fertilizer, pots) necessary to expand the supply and the types of potted plants, flowers and herbs she can offer her customers.

loans.use: Buy seeds, pots, fertilizers to enhance her product offering

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia has three children, she thinks that being a woman and not having the support of her husband does not imply a defeat, but rather an opportunity to grow and to show that women are capable of self development and are capable to proper despite the adversities. In order to support her children she started a business of selling groceries, where she has done been quite well with the sales. Unfortunately, the floods in the city of Reynosa, Tamaulipas caused damages in her store. She needs a loan of $375 to do the repairs needed and to keep on working and growing. You can be an important part in the development of this business and in the life of this family. Don’t hesitate and support them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia tiene tres hijos, ella considera que ser mujer y no tener el apoyo de su esposo no implica un fracaso, sino más bien una oportunidad para crecer y demostrar que las mujeres son capaces de desarrollarse y salir adelante pese a las adversidades. Para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos emprendió su negocio de venta de abarrotes, donde le ha ido muy bien con sus ventas. Desafortunadamente las inundaciones en la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas provocaron deterioros en su local y necesita de un préstamo de $375 dólares para hacer las reparaciones correspondientes y continuar trabajando y creciendo con su tienda. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en la vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 2 cooking mekos (stoves) and bulk stock of flour, cooking oil and baking powder

loans.name: Ni Wayan Astiti

texts.id:
As a good housewife, Wayan Astiti could not just sit still. Besides taking care of her 2 school age children, Wayan Astiti also runs a pig farming business. Wayan Astiti's husband Ketut Rana is also busy raising government own cows, so everybody is busy. Wayan Astiti raise 1 mother pig and 1 male pig. The mother pig is now 1 month pregnant. The male pig is quite profitable, each husbandary could earn her Rp 30,000 (about US$3.30). Each month from husbandary Wayan Astiti could earn Rp 500,000 (about $55). That is why Wayan Astiti dare to borrow from Dinari for Rp1,700,000 (about $187). This capital will be used to buy rice shell clippings, wheat shell clippings and tofu leftovers. Since tofu leftovers is good for pregnant mother pig, Wayan Astiti is persistent in learning how to raise pigs. Wayan Astiti wish is that her pregnant mother pig could bore plenty and healthy piglets.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai Seorang ibu rumah tangga yang baik Wayan Astiti tidak bisa berpangku tangan saja. Selain disibukan untuk mengurusi 2 anaknya yang sudah bersekolah wayan Astiti juga memiliki usaha beternak babi. Suami Wayan astiti ketut Rana juga memiliki kesibukan pelihara sapi kereman milik pemerintah jadi semuanya memiliki kesibukan . Kesibukan yang dimiliki Wayan Astiti memelihara 1 induk babi dan 1 pejantan. Induk babinya baru dikawinkan umur kehamilannya baru 1 bulan. Pejantan yang dimiliki Wayan astiti cukup laris , harga setiap kawin mencapai Rp.30,000,-. Setiap bulan dari hasil pejantan saja Wayan Astiti mendapatkan uang Rp.500,000,-. Oleh sebab itu wayan Astiti berani pinjam modal di Dinari sebesar Rp.1.700.000,-. Modal ini dipergunakan untuk membeli dedak padi, dedak poral dan ampas tahu. Karena ampas tahu baik untuk induk babi yang hamil. Wayan Astiti rajin mengikuti penyuluhan-penyuluhan sehingga mengetahui bagaimana memelihara babi yang benar. Harapan Wayan Astiti supaya induk babinya yang sedang hamil ini bisa melahirkan anak yang banyak dan sehat.

loans.use:
To buy feedstock and pig feed

Membeli bibit dan pakan babi

loans.name: Maritza Lizet

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza Lizet Sáenz B. is a native of the city of Bluefields. She is 35-years-old and is married to Oscar Selva. They have 4 children. Mrs. Sáenz has sold cosmetics through a catalog for more than 5 years. Her clients are men and women of all ages who prefer her because of her specialized service and because she comes to their homes to make sales. Mrs. Sáenz needs to buy: 7 units of women’s perfume at $10 each, 1 unit of eye shadow for $3, 1 eyebrow pencil for $4, 1 unit of lip gloss for $2, 1 unit of face mask for $3, 5 units of face cream at $14 each, 2 units of hair gel at $3 each, 1 unit of hair conditioner for $3, 1 toothbrush for $2, 1 unit of liquid soap for $5, 1 unit of vitamins for $6, 1 shirt for $13, 1 unit of body spray for $5, and 1 unit of deodorant for $4. With this investment, she will be able to offer a variety of products to her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Maritza Lizet Sáenz B. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Oscar Selva, ambos tienen 4 hijos. La Sra. Sáenz tiene mas de 5 años de vender cosméticos por catalogo, sus clientes son hombre y mujeres de todas las edades que la prefieren por dar un servicio a domicilio y especializado. La Sra. Sáenz necesita comprar : 7 unidades de perfumes para mujeres a $ 10.00 dólares cada perfume, 1 unidad de sombra para ojos a $3.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de lápiz para cejas a $4.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de brillo labial a $2.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidades de mascarillas para el rostro a $3.00 dólares la unidad, 5 unidades de cremas para el rostro a $ 14.00 dólares cada unidad, 2 unidades de loción para cabello a $3.00 dólares cada unidad, 1 unidad de acondicionador para el cabello a $3.00 dólares cada unidad, 1 unidad de cepillo de diente a $ 2.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de jabón liquido a $ 5.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de vitaminas a $ 6.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de camisa a $ 13.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de spray para el cuerpo a $5.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de desodorante a $4.00 dólares la unidad, con esta inversión podrá ofertar variedad de productos para su clientela.

loans.use: To buy:  perfume, eye shadow, eybrow pencil, lip gloss, face masks, face cream, mascara, conditioner, deodorant, liquid soap, a toothbrush, vitamins, shirts, and body spray.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in her products for retail

loans.name: Segunda Violeta

texts.es:
Mrs. Segunda Violeta is 44 years old. She finished highschool. She has a son who is older and does not economically depend on her. She lives in the Porvenir disctrict on the Trujillo province in the state of La Libertad.

Mrs. Segunda travels to Mache every weekend to purcahse pigs, rams, chickens and guinnea pigs. She also purchases wholesale fresh cheese, which she uses to produce other forms of cheese to sell at different markets in Trujillo.

She used to house cleaner but once her father got seek she had to take over his business.

She is part of the “Progresistas” comunal bank, where she received her first loan of S/. 300.00, which she used to purchase fresh chesse. With the S/. 1,800.00 loan she will purchase 23 pigs, guinnea pigs, chickens and turkeys. She promises to pay back the loan within four months.

Her dream is to purchase a little stand on the “La Rinconada” market in Trujillo city in order to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Segunda Violeta tiene 44 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa, tiene un hijo que ya es mayor y no depende de ella, vive en el distrito del Porvenir , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. La señora Segunda viaja a Mache todos los fines de semana para comprar cerdos, carneros, cuyes y gallinas y también compra quesillo al por mayor, el cual produce queso para luego repartirlo por los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Trujillo. Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como empleada del hogar, pero al enfermar su padre tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio. Es socia del banco comunal “Progresistas”, lugar donde recibió un primer préstamo de S/.300.00, el cual utilizó para comprar cuajada (quesillo). Con el préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, el cual cancelará en 4 meses, comprará 23 cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y sobre todo pavos. Su anhelo es comprar un puesto en el mercado “La Rinconada” de la ciudad de Trujillo para la venta de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase animals (pigs, guinnea pigs, chickens, turkeys)

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is single with a grown son who is married. She lives in Simferopol, Crimea. Anna decided to try her luck in business after the collapse of the Soviet Union. Today she sells household items, clothing and shoes, cosmetics, and other merchandise at a local city market near the train station. Anna has been in this business for 17 years. Currently, her income is about $2000 a month. She has about $20,000 in inventory.

Anna would like to work hard and persist in her entrepreneurial efforts so that she can build a good credit history with Nadiya Ukraine and be able to expand her business with financial assistance she receives through loans. Today she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase household inventory from the local wholesalers in Simferopol. She is hoping to generate enough profit to buy an apartment for her son and daughter-in-law. One of Anna’s long-term plans for the future is to open her own little retail store.

loans.use: Purchase Inventory

loans.name: Magloria

texts.es:
Magloria sold clothes for a long time. From a very early age she worked in markets and streets as a traveling vendor. She worked in this manner, until she opened a stall in market "Central No. 3" in Huaycán. However, in recent years this work has not been very profitable. Therefore, two years ago, she decided to change from selling clothes to selling CD's.

Today, she sells movies, music videos and music discs of all kinds. When she began this business and with the idea of moving forward and progressing, in order to see her children in a good school, she thought it would be a good idea to open an additional stall, and did so.

So now she manages not only the CD's post, but also a vegetable store in the front. Fortunately with the help of her husband, that business has no problems. Now, with the idea of completing construction of her house and hopefully being able to rent rooms in the future, both are working harder than ever.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Magloria vendió ropa por mucho tiempo. Desde muy joven ella trabajaba en mercados y calles como vendedora ambulante. Hasta que abrió un puesto en el mercado “Central Nº 3”de Huaycán. No obstante, en los últimos años este trabajo no le era muy rentable, pues no le iba bien. Por ello, hace dos años, decidió cambiar la venta de ropa por la de CD’s en el mismo puesto. Hoy en día vende películas, videos musicales y discos de música de toda clase. Al mismo tiempo de empezar con este negocio, con la idea de salir adelante, progresar y ver a sus hijos en un buen colegio, pensó que seria buena idea abrir un puesto más, y así lo hizo. Es así que ahora maneja no solo su puesto de CD’s, si no también una tienda de verduras al frente. Felizmente cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, por ese lado no tiene problemas. Con la idea de terminar de construir su casa y en un futuro poder alquilar cuartos, ambos trabajan más fuerte que nunca.

loans.use: Loan will be used to complete constuction of additional rooms in her house in order to rent them. (Terminar de construir cuartos para alquilarlos)

loans.name: Affossogbe Setoko Group

texts.fr:
Social measures implemented by the government to help the poor and the needy led to the 2002 creation of an all-woman association in Setoko, made up of three members. Its main aim is to convert palm nuts into palm oil for subsequent trading. This all-woman association is seeking financing not only to improve its production and income capacity, but also – more specifically - because it believes that external loans are more secure and stricter than the association’s annuity and savings schemes. The group has already benefited from several loans from local MFIs. This is also a group that has a good reputation in the area of conversion and trade of palm oil.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Les mesures sociales engagées par le gouvernement pour aider les couches sociales démunies et d’heséritées ont conduit à la création d'une association féminine constituée de 3 membres à SETOKO depuis 2002. Elle a pour objectif principal la transformation des noix de palme en huile destinée à la commercialisation. Cette association féminine recherche un financement non seulement pour améliorer ses capacités productives et économiques mais surtout parce qu’elle juge que la gestion des crédits externes est plus sûr et plus rigoureuse que les tontines et épargnes de l’association. Ce groupement a eu a bénéficier de plusieurs crédits auprès des IMFs de la place. C’est aussi un groupement ayant une bonne réputation en matière de transformation et commercialisation de l’huile de palme.

loans.use: To buy 5.2 metric tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Mabéza

texts.fr:
Mr. Mabéza E. was born on December 24, 1978 in Lomé. He is a bachelor with no children. In 2006 he opened up a center selling office supplies in the neighborhood called Agoè. He also prepares papers and photocopies. His business is doing well, especially since he is the only one to have such a venture in this neighborhood.

The loan that he is requesting will permit him to purchase 20 cartons of pre-packaged paper, 15 packages of file folders, and other office supplies.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur E. Mabéza est né le 24 décembre 1978 à Lomé. Il est célibataire sans enfants. En 2006 il a crée un centre de vente de fournitures de bureau dans le quartier d’Agoè. Il fait également les traitements de texte et des photocopies. Son activité marche bien d’autant plus qu’il est le seul à ouvrir ce centre dans le quartier.

Le crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 20 cartons de rames, 15 paquets de chemises et d’autres fournitures de bureau.

loans.use:
Purchase of office supplies

Achat des fournitures de bureau

loans.name: Luzmila's Group

texts.en:
Aurelia and Luzmila belong to the Village Bank Lila.

Aurelia is married, 36 years old and has 7 children. Aurelia sells clothing at the different fairs of the region every Saturday and Sunday. During the other days of the week she takes care of her children and makes sure they do their studies.

On the other hand, Luzmila is married, 39 years old and has 4 children. Luzmila, along with her spouse, are artisans and make fabrics and weavings such as tapestries – and they have commercialized their products into an export business.

Aurelia and Luzmila need loans of 600 soles and 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of skirts, blouses, sweaters, and wool of alpaca.

The dreams of Aurelia and Luzmila are that their children become professionals, to grow their business, to produce more and to export directly to the exterior market.

loans.use: Aurelia and Luzmila need loans of 600 soles and 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of skirts, blouses, sweaters, and wool of alpaca.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Halima T.. She is married and has three children with ages between 1 and 11.

In 2001, Halima established her grocery business. Working six days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about US $130 every month from this business. Halima has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk. In the future, Halima plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock.. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is "genge." A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia is 22 years old and is single. She lives in the neighborhood Unidad de Propósito. She still doesn't have children, and her dream, like most women, is to be able to form her own family one day. Maria Eugenia works in a bank in Managua, and has become a cashier. Before she began this job, she began a business selling shoes, with capital supplied by her parents. At the moment she only sells shoes, but her plans are to have a store where she can offer a variety of products. This loan would be used to buy a variety of shoes in order to improve what she can offer her clients, and this will also allow her to attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Eugenia tiene 22 años, es soltera, habita en el barrio Unidad de Propósito. Todavía no tiene hijos y su sueño como la mayoría de las mujeres es poder formar algún día una familia. Maria Eugenia trabaja en un banco de Managua, desempeñándose como cajera, pero antes de empezar este trabajo empezó el negocio de la venta de zapatos, con capital otorgado por sus padres. En estos momentos sólo vende zapatos pero sus planes son llegar a poner una tienda donde pueda ofrecer variedad de productos. El préstamo será usado para la compra de variedad de zapatos para poder aumentar la oferta hacia sus clientes, y con esto también poder atraer más clientela.

loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes to improve her business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Караев Хасан житель района Яван.Возраст 34 года, женат, имеет 3 детей.Образвоание среднее.Клиент более 5 лет занимается  разведением крупно-рогатого скота.Он покупает на рынке молодых бычков ,откармливает их и сдает на мясо в мясные ларьки. Этот вид бизнеса позволяет ему прокормитьт свою семью.В данный  момент клиент хочет купить 2 бычков.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hasan K. is a resident of the Yovon region. 34-years-old, he is married and has three children. He attended secondary school, and has raised large-horned cattle for more than five years. He purchases young steers, fattens them and sells the meat to butchers. This type of business permits him to feed his family. At present he would like to purchase two steers. He plans to repay the loan over the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two steers

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm P., 48, is a widow who lives with six of her children. She sells lotus stems in the Battambong province, typically making US$3 each day. She is also supported by her children who work and sell lotus stems and its flowers with her. She would like to ask for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport the lotus to sell.

loans.use: Morm would like to purchase a motorbike to transport lotus to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Corina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores D. Nuevo Edén ubicado en el PSJ Virgen D. Lourdes Mz. A Lt. 6 AAHH. Nuevo Edén, distrito D. Yarinacocha, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 45 años D. edad, es madre D. 6 hijos, 2 D. ellos mayores D. edad y 4 que aún depenD. D. ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la extracción D. madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. madera. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio, viaja con su esposo a extraer madera para luego venderla a sus clientes. Este negocio le brinda ganancias que le permiten pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 bidones D. combustible y construirá dos botes para ampliar más su negocio D. madera.

Gracias a la ayuda del banco comunal su negocio ha mejorado y también le brinda la oportunidad D. darles una mejor educación a sus queridos hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Las Flores D. Nuevo Eden (The Flowers of New Eden) Communal Bank located in the PSJ Virgen D. Lourdes Mz. A Lt. 6 AAHH. Nuevo Eden, Yarinacocha district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 45 years old and has 6 children; two of them are grown-ups and 4 still depend on her for support. She is married and her husband works on wood extraction. With the first loans that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles (Peruvian currency), she decided to invest it on selling wood. She has been working with the communal bank for 5 years.

Currently, she still running the same business. She travels with her husband to extract wood to sell it to her customers afterwards. This business offer her earnings that allow her to pay the loan on time.

With this loan of 2,300 soles (Peruvian currency), which will be paid back in 4 months, Rosa will buy 4 drums of gasoline and she will build 2 boats to expand her wood business more.

Thanks to the communal bank's help, her business has improved and also has given her the opportunity to proviD. her dear children with a better education.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 4 drums of gasolines and will build a pair of boats.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She sells drinks to both wholesale and retail customers. She is happy because the festive season will increase the sales of her drinks. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting this loan to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Jabier

texts.es: Jabier tiene 33 años, vive junto a su esposa y a sus 3 hijos en edad escolar y son su razón de salir al frente laboralmente. El se dedica a la compra y venta de yuca, producto que consigue durante las madrugadas en el puerto fluvial de su región. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 6 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que le genera muchos ingresos, también le agrada dar una buena atención y convencer a sus clientes para que le compren. Para poder vender sus yucas se encuentra ubicado en una buena zona del mercado, le va muy bien. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Y con el dinero requerido construirá un almacén para tener sus productos en un lugar seguro y cómodo.
texts.en:
Jabier is 33 years old and lives with his wife and 3 school-aged children who are his motivation to go to work. He buys and sells cassava which he gets in the morning in the river port of his region. He has been doing this for 6 years. He likes that this work pays well and enjoys taking care of his customers and convincing them to buy his cassava. He is well situated in the marketplace to sell his cassava, and business is good. This is his first loan with MFP. He will use the loan money to build a warehouse in order to keep his products safe and handy.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a warehouse for his produce.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La señora Rina es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, estado civil casada y esta al cuidado de tres hijos, posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace un año medio con el Movimiento Manuela R., posee un negocio de engorde de ganado; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que compro en la alimentación de su ganado para engordarlo y luego venderlo.
Ella desea obtener un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de semillas (alfalfa, cebada y otros),  para engorde ganado vacunos; por ello viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, asimismo ella agradece a Manuela R. por su apoyo, ya que le permitió mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar y ayudar a la educación de sus hijos que es lo más importante para ella, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rina is a member of the “Sacuyo” cooperative bank located in the Sacuyo community, Puno province. She is 40 years old, married, cares for three children and completed her primary school education. She has been working with the Manuela R. movement for the past 1½ years. She has a business raising livestock. Her first loan was for 500.00 Peruvian soles, an amount she used to buy feed to fatten her animals so she could later sell them. She hopes to receive a new loan to invest into purchasing seed (alfalfa and barley, among other varieties) to fatten her livestock. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan of 500.00 Peruvian soles. She thanks Manuela R. for its support as it has permitted her to improve her standard of living and, most importantly to her, educate her children. Lastly, she commits to paying her loan punctually in three monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seed (alfalfa and barley, among other varieties) to fatten her livestock.

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es: MARIA TIENE HIJOS INDEPENDIENTES, ELLA TRABAJA SOLA. TIENE CASA PROPIA UBICADA EN LA ZONA DE TICTI NORTE. LA CLIENTE TIENE UN NEGOCIO DE PREPARACION Y VENTAS DE COMIDAS, ELLA PREPARA ALMUERZOS Y PLATOS EXTRAS, TIENE LA VENTAJA QUE FRENTE A SU DOMICILIO, SE ENCUENTRA LA PARADA FINAL DE UN TRUFI (bus). TAMBIEN CUENTA CON UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE BARRIO EN SU MISMA CASA. LA COMPETENCIA DE MARIA ES MINIMA DEBIDO A QUE NO EXISTE OTROS PUESTOS QUE VENDEN COMIDA A LOS CHOFERES DE LOS TRUFIS, ASI MISMO LA TIENDA DE BARRIO SE ENCUENTRA BIEN SURTIDA Y TIENE CLIENTES ESTABLES. CON EL CREDITO OBTENIDO LA CLIENTE PLANEA INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES TANTO DEL PUESTO DE COMIDAS COMO DE LA TIENDA DE BARRIO. MARIA SE ENCUENTRA EN LA TERCERA SECUENCIA. SE TRATA DE UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE QUIEN CANCELO EL ANTERIOR CREDITO SIN PROBLEMAS. TUVO CIERTOS RETRASOS, PERO ESTOS NO FUERON SIGNIFICATIVOS.
texts.en:
Maria has grown up children and she works alone. She owns her own house in the North Ticti area. Maria has her own business preparing and selling food, lunches, and extra dishes. She has an advantage in her business because in front of her house is the final stop of a bus line. She also runs a small neighborhood store from her house. Her competition is quite low because there are no other stalls selling food to the bus drivers, and her store has a wide variety of goods and a stable client base. With this loan Maria plans to increase the working capital for her food stall as well as for her corner store. This is Maria’s third loan cycle. She is a very responsible person who has repaid the previous loans without problems. She had a few late repayments but the delays were not significant.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital and Repayment of Agrocapital Loan

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
La esposa de Juan David S. la señora Martha Alicia Espino sale en la foto ya que el señor se encontraba trabajando.
Ellos ya han empezado la construcción con sus propios ahorros pero para terminar le falta capital, ellos quieren ampliar su casa para vivir cómodamente. Su proyecto es hacer dos cuartos ya que tienen 4 hijos los cuales requieren su privacidad y su propio espacio.
Su esposo trabaja en una constructora y ella en una maquiladora desde hace 14 años lo cual con estos ingresos pagaran el préstamo dado.
texts.en:
Juan David S.'s wife Martha Alicia Espino is photographed because her husband was at work. They began construction with their own savings but lack the capital to finish the build. They want to expand their home in order to live comfortably. The plan is to build two rooms as they have four children who need their privacy and their own space. Her husband works for a construction company and she has worked in an assembly plant for the past 14 years. This income is what they will use to pay for their loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel A. is married with two children and has received technical schooling. Emmanuel sells spare car parts in Swidu near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2005. He also runs a taxi which is generating a lot of income for him. His wife is a store dealer. Emmanuel uses his income to pay for utilities, housekeeping expenses, school fees and rent.

Emmanuel will use the loan to purchase more spare parts for his business and will also use part to make some minor repairs and do maintenance on his taxi. With the new profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his business and make minor repairs and maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Carol Davis

texts.es:
La señora Carol Davis tiene 35 años vive en Saucipe, distrito D. Paijan, provincia D. Ascope, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, no siguió estudiando debido a que se casò y se dedico a su hogar. Tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente D. ella.
Carol se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, al inicio se dedicaba a la crianza y venta D. patos (aves) junto con su esposo, negocio que tuvo durante 5 años y que dejò para iniciarse en la venta D.  ropa, el cual también abandonò para dedicarse a la venta D. productos D. belleza desD. hace 1 año, negocio que desarrolla actualmente en su domicilio y que le da muchas ganancias. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra D. alimento balanceado.
Con el crédito D. 1500 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. productos D. belleza para ampliar su capital D. trabajo.
Carol sueña con ser directora D. Unique.
texts.en:
Carol Davis is 35 years old and lives in Saucipe, in the district of Paijan, province of Ascope, in the department of La Libertad of Peru. She completed high school but did not continue her studies as she got married and then dedicated herself to her home. She has two children who are financially dependent on her. Carol sells beauty products. She started in business raising and selling ducks (birds) with her husband. She had that business for five years and stopped in order to begin selling clothing, which she also abandoned to sell beauty products, which she has been doing for a year now. She runs her business from her home and it generates good revenues. With her first loan of 300 soles which she received from her community bank, "Manos Unidas”, she bought a balanced feed for her animals. With this loan of 1,500 soles, which she will repay in six months, she will buy beauty products to increase her working capital. Carol dreams of becoming a director with Unique [Unique is a beauty products company].

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en:
Karomat E. is 43 years old. She is married with four children. She started her own business 20 years ago when her husband was unemployed. She sells confectionery like candies, cookies, and pastries in the local market. The income from this business allows Karomat to support her family. Karomat dreams of educating all of her children through higher education.

Today, she requests 2500 Somoni for the term of eight months. Karomat is going to spend the loan to purchase confectionery to enlarge her range of goods. She will use the added income on the well-being of her family as well as her children's education.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase confectionery to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Salt Sellers Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Isha K., Isatu T. and Abu K.. They named their group “Salt Sellers”. They are all local entrepreneurs in the small town of Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown.

This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva, each of them requesting a loan of Le 500,000. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. Consequently they can make better profit and improve their standards of living. 

Isatu (right) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-five years of age and was born in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a vehicle driver and they have three children who are attending primary and secondary schools.

Isatu sells both in wholesale and in retail. She sells salt in Waterloo market and has been a businesswoman for more than twenty years. She will invest this loan into her business. A bag of salt usually costs her Le 50,000.

loans.use: To invest in her salt business

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
Hoà Trần Thị (608970292) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Hoà owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Hoà has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, Hòa joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hoà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Hoà is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND, which will be used to renovate existing shelter for her livestock. The loan will be her twelfth from TYM Fund. Hoà plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To renovate existing livestock shelter

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna A. is from the village of Labuyo in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 52 years old. Myrna is married and has two infants. To make a living, Myrna sells fish. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional fish to expand her product offering. This is Myrna's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi.
Yovana es soltera, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Yovana vende muebles como separadores de ambiente, sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulatoria en la feria de las Américas los días domingos, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Yovana necesita un préstamo de 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de muebles.
Los sueños de Yovana son ampliar su negocio y tener mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Yovona is a member of Rubi Community Bank. She is 30 years old, single, and has one son. Yovana sells furniture, such as room separators, as an ambulatory vendor in the Americas Fair on Sundays. She purchases these products in Lima.

Yovona needs a loan of 750 soles to invest in the purchase of furniture. Her dream is to expand her business and have more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Purchase Furniture

loans.name: Kodzo Anaté

texts.fr: Ce monsieur fait la conception de tableaux et de tampons qu’il expose après pour la vente. Il fait ce commerce depuis 2002, étant célibataire, c’est cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses propres charges. Les matières nécessaires à son activité étant finies, Il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des fournitures pour faire les tableaux et les tampons.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who designs sign boards and stamp pads that he displays for sale. He has been in this business since 2002. Being unmarried, this business enables him to support himself. The basic supplies for his business are out of stock. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy supplies to make signs and stamp pads.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the necessary supplies for his business

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa Elena M. reside en Ilopango en el departamento de San Salvador. Rosa vive con su esposo y sus dos nietos de 15 y 12 años de edad estudiantes. Rosa tiene 15 años de trabajar desde su casa elaborando tortillas todas las tardes el negocio de Rosa no es solo la elaboración de las mismas también vende granos básicos por libra, este crédito lo solicita para abastecerse de mayor cantidad de granos para vender, de esta manera lograra aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy A. is from the village of Unidos. She is 25 years old and married. Tracy earns her living by planting and harvesting rice. Tracy has been engaged in her business for over three years.

In 2008, Tracy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tracy has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Tracy is requesting a new loan of $225 which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Tracy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Ko'ê Pyahû Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio Bernardino Caballero de Caaguazú, la Sra. Viviana Laura G. se enteró por medio de las promociones y la formación de grupos por la zona y habiendo muchas interesadas en su cuadra, decidieron  participar del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, son 16 (Diez y seis) mujeres trabajadoras que quieren seguir progresando como un pequeño préstamo que invertirán en sus trabajos diarios.

Lo que buscan es un apoyo; ellas poseen  trabajos propios  como vendedoras de ropas, venta de zapatos, bijouterie, frutas y verduras, etc. y las mismas recibirán  un monto de 300.000 gs. cada una así invertirán en la compra de azúcar, carne, harina, huevo, fideo, golosinas, vaqueros, remeras, polleras, camisas, lencería, queso, gallinas las mismas desean un progreso personal y familiar con este préstamo otorgado por la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the Bernardino Caballero de Caaguazú neighborhood. Mrs. Viviana Laura G. joined through the promotions and the formation of groups in the area. Since there were many interested people in her area, they decided to participate in the Group of Enterprising Women program. They are 16 hard-working women, who want to continue progressing with a small loan that they will invest in their daily work. They are seeking support. They have their own jobs, which include selling clothing, shoes, jewelry, fruits and vegetables, etc. They will each receive a loan of 300,000 guaranís, and they will invest in the purchase of sugar, meat, flour, eggs, noodles, sweets, jeans, t-shirts, skirts, shirts, lingerie, cheese, and hens. They want to make personal progress with this loan offered by the Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jeans, t-shirts, lingerie, skirts, shirts, merchandise, flour, eggs, noodles, sweets, meat, fruits, vegetables, fabric, milk, hens, shoes, plastic cutlery, etc.

loans.name: Deissi Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora DEISSI ALEJANDRINA R. G. , tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito de SALPO , provincia de Otuzco, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores de enfermería técnica, ejerció durante 3 años pero por dedicarse ala crianza de sus hijas dejo de ejercer y se dedico a su propio negocio.
DEISSI es conviviente  tiene 2 hijas de 15 y 17 años de edad por quienes trabaja para poder brindarles su educación.
DEISSI se dedica a la ventad e gaseosas y cervezas en su casa.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de cajas de cerveza al por mayor.
Este crédito de 3000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas al por mayor (gaseosas y cerveza)

DEISSI sueña con tener un  restaurante pero actualmente no puede realizar su sueño porque a parte de s u negocio esta trabajando como registradora en la Municipalidad de Salpo.
DEISSI sueña con tener un restaurante y aumentar sus ganancias y así poder apoyar a que sus hijas puedan estudiar una carrera profesional de su elección.
texts.en:
Sra. Deissi Alejandrina R. G. is 40 years old and lives in the District of Salpo, Otuzco Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de las Mercedes”. Deissi studied nursing and was engaged in that profession for 3 years before leaving to raise her daughters and start her own business. She and her live-in partner have two daughters (ages 17 and 15). She works in order to provide them with an education. Deissi sells sodas and beer out of her home. Her previous loan of 300 soles was used to purchase cases of beer wholesale. This current loan of 3000 soles will be used to purchase more beverages (sodas and beer) at wholesale. Deissi dreams of opening a restaurant but she is not able to at the moment because of her job as a registrar for the City of Salpo. One day she hopes to have a restaurant so that she can increase her income and support her children’s education in whatever career they choose.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer & sodas at wholesale

loans.name: Liliam Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Liliam del Carmen R. U., tiene la edad de 30 años, habita en el barrio Denis Larios, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe,  junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como operario en Tip-Top, ellos tiene tres hijos a su cargo , todos estudiante de primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y darle un buena educación a sus hijos , doña Liliam desde hace diez años , se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas ya que su abuelito le apoya con las tierras para que las cultive y las trabaje , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es el humo de cerros que en ocasiones afecta al cultivo , agradece a la institución por la buena aprobación de su séptimo crédito ya que ha mejorado las técnicas de producción y ha vendido a un buen precio los productos,  lo que le permite pagar en tiempo y forma sus desembolso. Con este préstamo comprara  insumos y venenos para aplicar al cultivo lo cual espera obtener una buena cosecha
texts.en:
Liliam del Carmen R. U., 30, lives in the Denis Larios neighborhood, which is located in the Ticuantepe municipality. She lives with her husband, who is a Tip-Top workman. They are raising three children, who are all in elementary school. The plans for the family are to improve their living conditions and give the children a good education. Liliam has been working in agriculture for ten years. Her grandfather supports her with some land to cultivate, and she works that land. The biggest difficulty is the smoke from the hills that occasionally affects the crops. She is grateful to the institution for the approval of her seventh loan. The technical part of production has improved, and she has sold her products for a good price. This allows her to pay on time and in good form. With this loan she will buy supplies and pesticide to apply to her crops in the hopes of getting a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and pesticides to apply and improve her production

loans.name: María Teodora

texts.es:
María Teodora O. Z. es una señora de 52 años de edad, quien vive con sus dos hijos,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San José de Upala, localizada en la  Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y le che) y agricultura. 

Doña María se dedica a la ganadería doble propósito desde hace 20 años. Dice ella que aprovecha los terneros para venderlos pero que mayormente  se enfoca en la producción de leche, queso y otros  derivados;  los cuales vende tanto en su comunidad como en lugares vecinos, que según su criterio, hay un excelente mercado ya sea por medio de venta a intermediarios o al público directamente. 
Doña María considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, sus condiciones de vida han mejorado mucho, también comenta que desde que inicio con el negocio su autoestima ha mejorado y ahora se siente muy capaz, dice que ha crecido mucho a nivel personal y profesional.

Lo que desea en estos momentos doña maría es un microcrédito por ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones) para la compra de 3 novillos más ya que así podrá aumentar su producción y hacer q su negocio crezca y salga adelante.

Doña María es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Mujeres la Esperanza; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres, ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su cuarto préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
María Teodora is a 52 year old woman who lives with her two children in a small rural community of Costa Rica called San José de Upala, in the Alajuela province. Common activities in this area are trade, livestock farming for both meat and dairy, and agriculture.

María has been a livestock farmer for meat and dairy for the last twenty years. She says that she makes the most of the calves by selling them but that, for the most part, she focuses on producing milk, cheese, and other dairy products. She sells these both in her own community and in neighboring towns, and in her opinion she has a good market both for selling to middlemen and directly to the public.

María thinks that, thanks to the success of this business, her living conditions have improved considerably, and she also comments that since starting her business her self esteem has improved and now she feels very capable. She says that she has grown a lot both personally and professionally. What María wants now is a microloan of $550 to buy three more steers so that she can increase her production and ensure that her business grows and moves forward.

María is a member of the microcredit organization Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Mujeres la Esperanza which is available only for women and which specializes in supporting non-professional women and women who are heads of their households. This is one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her fourth loan and with it she hopes to continue growing personally and economically and to participate actively in the credit organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three steers

loans.name: Pulchérie Mireille

texts.fr: A. Pulchérie Mireille est née le 12 Septembre 1970 à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Pulchérie Mireille vit à Ahito à Allada depuis une dizaine d’année. Mariée à TINHOUN Brice un vendeur de bois de chauffage, Pulchérie Mireille est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Pulchérie Mireille vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Pulchérie Mireille n’a pas fréquenté les classes. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Pulchérie Mireille vend de la bouillie (faite à base de maïs), accompagnée de beignets (faits à base de farine de blé et du sucre) de façon ambulante et aussi à son domicile. C’est à Allada que Pulchérie Mireille s’approvisionne. Pulchérie Mireille est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Pulchérie Mireille sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de l’institution afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
A. Pulchérie Mireille was born on September, 12, 1970 in Allada, in Atlantique county in Benin. She has been living in Ahito in Allada for twelve years. Married to TINHOUN Brice, a firewood vendor, she is the mother of one child who is in school. She lives with her child and her husband. The couple provide for the family jointly. Pulchérie Mireille has not gone to school. For twelve years, she has been selling porridge (made with cornmeal) served with beignets (made with wheat flour and sugar). She sells from place to place and also out of her home. She stocks up in Allada. She is a previous ALIDé client having already benefited from three ALIDé loans, which have been repaid. She's requesting a fourth loan from this micro-finance institution to augment her working capital and to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of corn, a sack of wheat flour, a sack of sugar, a container of vegetable oil

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Mr. Khin T. earns a living as a crop cultivator. He also depends on income from his wife’s business as a local tailor. He was not available for a photograph so his wife is pictured instead. Khin T. has been very busy with his farm and never wastes time. Recently, he has faced difficulties growing his crop because he doesn’t have enough farm supplies to best perform his farm work. Therefore, he decided to ask for a loan of $600 US to buy more farming tools.

Mr. Khin T. is 37 years of age and lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh city. He has been married for years and has four children who are no longer in school. Two of them are working in a garment factory and the other two are unemployed and dependent on him.

loans.use: To buy more farming tools

loans.name: Rosinah

texts.en:
Rosinah is a 41-year-old woman who has been tailoring and selling charcoal for the past nineteen years. With the KES 20,000 loan she hopes to purchase materials to make dresses and to buy more charcoal for sale.

Rosinah is single and has three children, two of whom are in school. She hopes to educate her children and send them to university. She also aims to be a wholesale supplier for school uniforms in the future. Rosinah describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy materials for making dresses and to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Abba

texts.en: Abba is fifty-seven years old. She is divorced and has six children who attend school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Abba works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She is a trader. Abba trades in cosmetics such as pomade, cream, body spray, etc. She sells her goods by hawking and some times treks as well to other communities. Abba procures her goods from Accra. She wants a loan to buy cosmetics in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 28 años, es un hombre muy alegre y luchador, vive en la casa de su hermana y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

Sus días de trabajo comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su motocarro sale en busca de pasajeros para transportar. Él es muy atento con sus clientes y siempre está pendiente de ellos, ya que desea darles muy buen servicio, para cuando lo vean de nuevo tomen otra vez su motocarro.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por la calles de la ciudad, ya que se distrae mucho haciéndolo, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. 
Con el tiempo, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un nuevo motocarro.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Juan con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que las que tiene actualmente están gastadas por el arduo trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan, 28 years old, is a happy and hard working man who lives with his sister and wishes most to stand out.

His work days start very early in the morning, when he leaves with his motocar to look for pasengers. He is very attentive with his customers and always is outstanding with them. He hopes to give them the best service so when they see him again, they will take his motocar. What he like most of is job is to drive in the streets of the city so they distract him a lot from doing it. He has been doing this acitivity for 8 years and considers the most dificult part of his job working late into the night. With time he hopes he can have enough money to buy a new motocar.

This is the fifth loan Juan has had from MFP and he feels responsible to pay it on time as he doesn't want to cause any trouble with the other communal bank members where he is well liked by the rest of his female associates. With the requested 500 nuevos soles, he will buy new tires for motocar as the ones now are actually worn out from the arduos job.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new tires

loans.name: Rakaya

texts.en:
Rakaya E. is currently in the business of selling pancakes in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use to make more cakes to sell. Rakaya is 45 years old and married to a peasant. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. 

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more materials to use to make more cakes to sell

loans.name: Juan Humberto

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Humberto M. se dedica a la venta de granos de maiz, los cuales son molidos para hacer masa para las tortillas de maiz, tiene muchas clientes ya que la mayoria son las productoras de tortillas. Juan y su esposa son los encargados de darle vida a este pequeño proyecto economico
ubicado en su casa de habitacion del municipio de trojes. El Sr. M. realiza las venta de manera domiciliar.
con su esposa tuvieron tres hijos de los cuales solo una depende de ellos y es pasante en la licenciatura en enfermeria.
el se traslada a lugares donde venden este grano a precios muy bajos y de esta manera ofrecerle un mejor precio a su clientela a la que atienden junto a su esposa con mucho esmero y dedicacion , Juan tambien se deica a la caficultura lo que le genera otros ingresos para bienestar de su familia , El nos esta solicitando el credito para invertirlo en su negocio ya que por los momentos no cuenta 
con el capital de trabajo suficiente.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Humberto M. works selling corn seed which is ground to make flour for corn tortillas. He has a lot of customers since the majority make tortillas. Juan and his wife are in charge of keeping this small business project alive. It’s in a room in their house in the town of Trojes. Mr. M. sells door to door. They have three children. Only one is their dependent and she is a university teaching assistant in nursing. He travels to places where they sell the seed at a low cost and this way can offer a better price to his clientele. He and his wife tend to them with care and dedication. Juan also grows coffee which generates more income for the well being of his family. He is applying for the loan to invest it in his business since at the moment he doesn't have enough working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase corn

loans.name: Ana Berta

texts.es: Ana Berta G. G. de 35 años reside en el departamento de Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijos de 15, 13 y 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ana posee una venta de tortillas en su propia casa, las cuales elabora de lunes a domingo al mediodía. Así mismo elabora tamales los viernes y sábado, los cuales comercializa muy bien. Ana es una mujer muy responsable quien trabaja muy duro por sacar adelante a sus tres hijas, las cuales dependen por completo de su madre, ya que Ana es madre soltera y gracias a su trabajo es como ha logrado brindarles lo más necesario a sus hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas y de los tamales, así mismo pollo, papas y hojas para rellenar los tamales y envolverlos. Ana desea poder aumentar su producción, ya que es esta la única manera que cuenta  para ganarse la vida, es por ello que es de mucha importancia el poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que ella cuenta con muchos clientes pero cuenta con la desventaja de no poseer mucha materia prima, lo cual la incentivó a solicitar dicho préstamo a Integral, lo cual le da la esperanza de poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Berta G. G. is 35 years old and resides in the Department of Usulután. There she lives with her three children (ages 15, 13, and 9) who attend school. Ana sells tortillas from her home and prepares them Monday through Sunday at noon. On Fridays and Saturdays she also sells tamales, which sell very well. Ana is a very responsible woman who works extremely hard to succeed for her three daughters, who are completely dependent on their mother. Ana is a single mother and, thanks to her work, is able to provide all the necessities for her children.

She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase large quantities of corn for preparing tortillas and tamales. Ana will also buy chicken, potatoes, and leaves for filling and wrapping the tamales. She hopes to increase her production, since this is the only way for her to make a living. For this reason, it is very important for her to improve her sales. She has many customers, but she is at a disadvantage because she does not have enough materials on hand. Ana was encouraged to apply for this loan from Apoyo Integral and hopes that it will improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, chicken, and vegetables

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua A. is a seamstress. She also operates a chop bar and in this bar she sells soft drinks and a variety of food. She has people who manage the chop bar for her. She spends most of her time sewing at Jukwa. Akua has attained senior high level of education. She is a single parent. Akua has been in the sewing business for about eight years. She is responsible for both her own and her daughter’s welfare. Her loan will be used to buy sewing supplies and more soft drinks to sell at her chop bar to meet the demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her child.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and more soft drinks to sell at her chop bar

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
39 year- old Flor A. aims to support the education of her three children until they graduate from college and have their own careers. Her eldest child is 15 years old and has graduated from high school/secondary school. In June (opening of classes), she will be entering college and will be incurring larger expenses for tuition, fees, uniforms, and other expenses related to her education. It is good that Flor's two younger children are only seven and eight years old and yet in primary school. Expenses are somehow too much for Flor and her husband to bear.

Flor and her husband have been in a rice farming business since they started their own family. The land they use for that business is rented from someone in their village. Before Flor became a member of ASHI, the only capital she had to finance her business was borrowed from wealthy people in their village. The owner of the land takes a percentage from their harvest, and so did the person who lent them money. At the end of the day, all that is left for Flor and her family is just enough for their consumption.

With the growing expenses of her family as her children grow older, Flor wants to improve her family's economic status by growing her business and no longer borrowing money from usurious money lenders who charge huge interest rates. She felt very lucky that she was able to join ASHI and had the opportunity to request a loan that has the smallest interest rate. With the loans she is requesting now and can request in the next months or years, the life of her family will improve and her dream ensuring that her children graduate from college will be achieved.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers, and to rent tractors and other farming equipment for rice planting

loans.name: Odontuya

texts.en:
Odontuya is 25 years old, single and lives with her parents and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a house. Her younger sister attends a college. Odontuya operates a grocery store in her yard which is in an excellent location. She is a very hard-working person who has been operating her business since 2008 and has built a stable operation.

She started her business with working capital of 400,000 tugrugs (~293 USD). After years of successful operations, she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 2,165,000 tugrugs (~1,583 USD) today. Odontuya has been planning to purchase large amounts of products for her store to increase her sales. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory and to build storage.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and build storage

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianey

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianey (JMV) is 34 years old and is married with three children who are aged between 1 and 7. He also takes care of one dependent relative. He works hard for the development of his family.

JMV owns a small shop which sells various styles of clothes and this is his tenth year of successful operation. He employs four people from his community as helpers so that his business runs well. His daily activities run from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day except Saturday.

JMV is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing his business. He plans to add some equipment like a sewing machine to be used in sewing clothes. This loan will be very important for him because it will allow him to attract more customers. This will help him to earn more profits.

With the extra money, JMV hopes to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to be used to sew clothes

loans.name: Mathusalam

texts.es: Mathusalam tiene 21 años, es un joven muy  responsable y  trabajador, es el tercero de 6 hermanos, por lo que aún vive en casa de sus padres. Lo que más desea, es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, es por ello que desea terminar de construir su casa, aprovechando además su oficio de albañil, para cumplir ese propósito. Anteriormente trabajaba como ayudante de albañil, hoy se ha independizado y se dedica hacer revestimientos de paredes y pisos, es así que ha logrado trabajar por más de 5 años. Por el momento que aún no tiene contrato, tiene días libres para levantar la pared y arreglar el piso de su casa con ayuda de padre y hermanos. Él disfruta mucho su trabajo, sin embargo el tener que cargar las latas con mezcla batida le resulta pesado, pero sabe que solo así podrá mejorar su condición de vida. Con el tiempo espera invertir en un negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para ayudar a construir su casa, por ello se compromete pagar todas las cuotas puntualmente. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar materiales de construcción, como: arena y piedras chancadas para terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mathusalam is 21 years old. He is a very responsible and hard-working young man. He is the third of six children. That is why he still lives in his parents’ house. What he wants most of all is to improve the quality of life for his family. That is why he wants to build his house, and he will take advantage of his trade as a bricklayer to complete this proposal. Previously he worked as a bricklayer’s helper. Now he has become independent, and he makes coverings for walls and floors. He has worked this way for five years. For the moment he does not yet have a contract. On his days off he can raise the wall and do the floor with help from his father and brothers. He really enjoys his work even though he has to carry the heavy cans of the mixture. But, he knows that this is the only way he will be able to improve his quality of life. In time he plans on investing in his business. This is his first loan with MFP. He knows that the loan will be very beneficial in helping him build his house. He commits to making all of his payments on time. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy construction materials like sand and crushed stones to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand and stones to finish building his house

loans.name: Wendy Santana

texts.es:
La señora Wendy Santana G. tiene ya más de un año dedicándose a la venta de comida afuera de una escuela. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos que obtiene ya que es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajos su responsabilidad. 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en más variedad de mercancía y así tener un ingreso mejor en su negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Wendy Santana G. has been selling food outside of a school for more than a year. This business is her source of income since she is a single mother with three children who are her responsibility.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in a wider variety of merchandise so that she can generate more income from her business. She plans to repay the loan using part of the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
P. Nguyễn Thị (20211020026) is a 34 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, P. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community.  P. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, P. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  P. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  P. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding a food preparation business

loans.name: Marylene Atieno

texts.en:
Maryline Atieno O. quit selling groundnuts in 2004 and started hawking secondhand clothes in Nyamasaria Kisumu Kenya, since her previous business was not earning her good income. She purchases her stock on a weekly basis from Kibuye market. She would wish to get a loan worth Ksh.30000 that will be used to purchase more stock and boost her business.

She is 29 years of age, married, and a mother of five (5) children, with a dream of educating them.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Edina

texts.es:
Edina vive en la zona de alto chijini de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es soltera.
La cliente es empleada en una Limpieza y para mejorar sus ingresos decidió iniciar una actividad económica como la venta de perfumes y cosméticos, para lo cual solicita un crédito para comprar los productos.
Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito y la primera que requiere el apoyo de kiva. El análisis socio-económico indica que ella es un sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Edina lives in the Alto Chijini region of the city of La Paz. She is single. She is an employee of a house cleaning company. To improve her income she would like to start up a business of her own such as the sales of cosmetics and perfumes, which is the reason for this loan. For the first time she is requesting a loan from Kiva. The socio-economic analysis indicates that she may access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and perfumes to start her own business.

loans.name: Melba Begonia

texts.es:
Melba Begonia G. C., tiene  21 años.  Es soltera y vive con los padres y un hijo,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.
 
Melba es una socia de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Melba se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y arroz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en Ventanas en el recinto.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y arroz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es mejorar el estado económico de la familia y salir adelante. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos.

Le gusta pasear y estar en la casa.
texts.en:
Melba Begonia G. C. is 21 years old. She is single, and lives with her parents and 1 son in the Ventanas province of Los Ríos. She has 1 son. Melba is a member of the rural cooperative group “San José de los Amarillos”, located in the Los Amarillos region about one hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, the majority of whom are dedicated to agriculture. This is their second loan through the San José Cooperative. Melba dedicates herself to agriculture, planting corn and rice. She buys products every month in the city of Ventanas, and sells them in the surrounding areas. She requests this loan to invest in buying corn and rice. She believes this access to credit is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to improve her family’s financial standing and to get ahead. She meets challenges, such as insect plagues and disease in her crops. She likes to travel and also to be in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in purchasing corn and rice.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo D. R. is from the village of Sampaguita, Solana, Cagayan. He is 52 years old, married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Domingo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Domingo has been engaged in his business for over 34 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Domingo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27,000 PHP from ASKI. Domingo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan that Domingo has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Mrs. Khoem V., who was born in 1960, lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Non Phoeut, are farmers who own a  4-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family; her husband also owns an agricultural machine. Mrs. Khoem V. has some problems because her field's soil is infertile. To improve production, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide. She is the mother of three children: one is a student, one is a laborer, and one helps with his parents’ businesses. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Burulkan's Group

texts.en:
Burulkan M. is the leader of this group. She is 74 and a widow. She has one son. Burulkan is a pensioner; her pension benefit is 3500 soms per month. Over 4 years she has managed to build a temporary house. She needs to get a loan in order to pay her granddaughter's university study. She cherishes a hope to see her children happy.

Asel M. is the treasurer of the group. She is 36 and married. Together with her spouse, who is a farmer, they are raising three children; their sons are schoolboys and their daughter goes to kindergarten. 15 years ago, the head of the family privatized a building, which later was reshaped into a café. Now this café is the main source of family income. Out of the profits they have managed to purchase a house. The family hopes to get a loan in order to buy some café implements. In future Asel is planning to develop the business further. 

Berdibek J., 49, married. His wife earns her living by working in a shop as a saleswoman (she earns 2500 soms per month). The couple has 2 sons; both of them are schoolboys. Berdibek supports his family by working as a watchman at a petroleum station, besides he is an MIA pensioner, and on the basis of this fact gets a pension benefit. His total earnings are about 10,000 soms per month. During 5 years of working hard, the family has managed to increase their herd of cattle. The loan purpose is to purchase cattle for fattening. In future Berdibek is planning to buy a house and a car.

Sagynbek I. U., 54, is married. Together with his wife he runs their own family business. As his wife has vocational education, they rented premises and opened a pharmacy. I.’s duty is helping his wife to transport medicines. The family wants to use the loan money for commodity circulation. In future they are planning to purchase a car and to expand the business even more.
