--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for the granddaughter's education at university

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina lives in Khanewal which is a small city located in Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She owns a 2 room brick house there and lives in it with her family. She moved here after she got married with M. I.. 

Sakina is a seam-stress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients and generates income for the family. She is good at her art and receives regular orders. Her husband has a business operating a grocery store. His store is located in the market where he deals with good number of customers every day.  

Sakina has given birth to 3 sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in school and getting their education except the eldest son who left after the 5th grade because he didn’t show any interest in education. He works in a factory for a monthly wage and supports the family from his earnings.    

Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partnerAsasah, to financially assist her husband with his grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity which helps him increase his business. She is hopeful that her husband will make his business better after this loan investment. Sakina is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application.  She is a responsible client and fulfills her duties responsibly.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Sakina”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Glorina

texts.en:
Glorina is optimistic that her sewing business will produce a steady income to improve her economic stability and her family’s quality of life. Her long term dreams are to continue funding her children’s education and to have a successful tailoring shop someday. Glorina would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory (including fabric cottons and other materials needed) to continue her sewing business.

As a member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Glorina is thankful for access to loans to support her dreams.

loans.use: To pay for fabric cottons and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie D. is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Girlie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Girlie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Girlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Girlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Girlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evelio Antonio

texts.es:
Evelio de 45 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 hijas, la mayor de 18 años y la menor de 17, ambas estudiando la universidad; Evelio labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como responsable de secretaria del campo desde hace 10 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de terminar de echarle la ceramica a su casa en Cuapa, pues con el credito anterior solo logro ponerle a una parte, y como se acerca diciembre quiere darle a su familia ese regalo y asi ver bonita su casa. 

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijas culminen su carrera y poder brindarle mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Evelio, 45, is married and has two daughters.  The oldest is 18 and the youngest is 17; both are in the university.  

Evelio has been a City of Juigalpa municipal employee for ten years.

He is asking for his 3rd loan to lay tile in his house in Cuapa.  His previous loan only managed to get part of the job done and because December is approaching he wants to give this gift to his family to see his house be pretty. 

His greatest dream is to see his daughters finish their career and to be able to provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: To install tile in his house.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. sells kenkey (a type of steamed dumpling) and earrings at Takoradi market. Her husband is a mason. She is married and has four children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to sell and to cook kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to revive her earring business.

In the picture, Maame is standing by the maize which she sells.  She also uses the maize to make kenkey for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize to sell and cook kenkey for sale

loans.name: Oswaldo Raul

texts.es:
Oswaldo de 47 años, hace varios años atrás trabaja como maestro constructor en obras que le solicitan hacer por un tiempo determinado. Inicio esta actividad para continuar con lo mismo que hace toda su familia. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana trabaja desde muy temprano en las construcciones. Realiza su trabajo solo pero cuando tiene varias construcciones contrata a dos o tres personas para que le ayuden. Los materiales que mas sutiliza en las construcciones son cemento, arena, bloques ya que las casas que construye son muy resistentes.  

Uno de los inconvenientes para ganar mas dinero es la competencia que hay en este servicio de construcción por eso quiere comenzar a dar servicios con materiales incluidos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, arena, cerámica para una casa que está construyendo y así  obtener buenas ganancias. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando para mejorar la casa.
texts.en: Oswaldo, age 47, has worked as a master builder for several years, doing jobs for which he has been requested to work for a determined period of time.  He began this work to continue in the footsteps of the rest of his family. He lives in a periurban zone and works in construction, starting very early in the morning. He works alone, but when he has several jobs he hires two or three people to help him. The materials that he uses the most of in construction are cement, sand, and blocks, as the houses that he builds are very strong. One of his challenges in making more money is the competition in construction; so he wants to start providing a service with  materials included. With this loan, he wants to buy cement, sand and ceramics for a house that he is building, and thus make better earnings. In the future he wants to keep working to improve his home.

loans.use: cement, stones, ceramic

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa B. cooks food such as rice, beans, and wakye for sale in Elmina. She is divorced and has seven dependents. She has been cooking food for sale for thirty years. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a cafeteria. 

Adjoa is dishing out some of the cooked rice.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to cook for sale

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea M. is from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 43 years old. Lea is married and has 2 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Lea owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste, to the local community. Lea has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital. 

Lea is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as snack foods & canned goods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lea from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase daily use products to resell

loans.name: Francisco Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Ramon F. es de la Ciudad de Santaní, barrio Santa Rosa, es soltero, con casa propia, el señor es propietario de una Clínica Odontológica, es una persona muy humilde, trabajador, honesto y muy responsable; posee buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
Según comentó el señor, empezó a trabajar como ayudante en una clínica desde los 8 años, con un mecánico dental y de ahí en más le gustó ese trabajo y su sueño era ser un gran profesional en el ramo,  al terminar su bachillerato empezó a estudiar esa carrera, al correr de los tiempos se especializó y con gran esfuerzo y dedicación salió adelante.
Ahora ya es todo un profesional con mucha experiencia, cuenta con un local propio con toda la infraestructura necesaria para realizar dicho trabajo, con clientela bien formada. Recurre a la Institución en busca de ayuda económica para la compra de Productos Odontológicos, para poder atender en forma permanente a cada uno sus clientes brindándoles la atención adecuada que merecen.
texts.en:
Francisco Ramon F. is from Santaní City, Santa Rosa neighborhood.  He is single, with his own home. He owns a dental clinic. He is a humble, hard-working and honest person who is very responsible; he has good trade and personal references.  According to him, he started working as an assistant in a clinic when he was 8 years old with a dental technician. He liked this work and his dream was to be a great professional in the industry. After finishing high-school, he began to study this profession. Over time he specialized and with great effort and dedication got ahead.
Now he is a professional with a lot of experience.  He has his own local, with all the infrastructure necessary to perform this work and a good patient base. He turns to the institution in search of financial help in order to buy dental products to be able to permanently attend to each one of his patients, providing them the appropriate attention they deserve.

loans.use: To buy dental products

loans.name: Jose Wiliam

texts.es:
José, tiene 46 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, nació en la ciudad del Cusco y ahora vive en la misma ciudad. José tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos alimenticios en base a plantas medicinales como por ejemplo kiwicha, maca, yacon y otros más. José en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquina procesadora de productos alimenticios o suplementarios.

José pertenece al banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: José is 46 years old, has 2 children, and was born in Cusco city, where he nows lives. He has a small business selling health products made from medicinal plants such as kiwicha, maca, yacon and others. José requires a loan to purchase a processing machine to make health products and supplements. He belongs to the communal bank 'Inti Pakareq', part of the Arariwa Association, and is thankful for the opportunity granted to him. He promises to make the repayments according to the specified time period.

loans.use: To purchase a processing machine to make health products and supplements.

loans.name: Badeya Kadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BADEYA KADI sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30  ans et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Mancourani II un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles.
DJENEBA T. fait le commerce de pomme de terre à travers ce groupe de femmes BADEYA KADI. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 350kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants Sikasso.
Elle les revend au grand marché de Sikasso, au marché du quartier Médine de Sikasso et en famille, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the Badeya Kadi group are married women, averaging 30 years of age with two children. They live mainly in monogamous families in Mancourani II, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso, the third administrative district of Mali. 
They are on their first loan cycle with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of better meeting customer demand.
As an example of this group’s business activities, Djeneba T. sells potatoes.

She plans to use her loan to purchase 350 kg [800 lbs] of potatoes. She stocks up in villages near Sikasso. She sells her goods at the big market of Sikasso, at the local market of the Médine district in Sikasso, and out of her home, for cash, to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 31,500 West African francs, one part of which will be used to repay the loan and the interest on it, and the other part put away as savings. Her goal is to increase her business volume in order to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for resale

loans.name: Leonor Cristina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres 13 De Septiembre, esta ciudad es conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leonor, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos todos mayores de edad, cuatro de ellos aun viven en su casa y también tiene a su cargo a un nieto de 7 años que está en escuela y es como su hijo. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de sabanas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja dos días a la semana en las tardes, deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Picoaza ya que allá le entregan más barato. Nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio  tres años y que una amiga fue la que un día la invito a que le ayudara en sus ventas y le gusto por eso tiempo después empezó en su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas. Está en el Banco Comunal dos años y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital city of Manabi, the members of the communal bank named “Women September 13" meets every two weeks. The city was known many years ago as the city of the royal tamarinds, for the great quantities of these fruit during those times.

Here we meet Leonor. She is 54 years old, married, and from her marriage she has seven children, all of whom are grown. Four of her children still live at home and she also have a 7-year old grandson in her care. He is in school and he is like one of her own children. Her husband is a security guard. 

She is a dedicated housewife who also sells bedding. She sells door to door and she also sells from her home where she has a small store. She says that her clients place orders. She works every day of the week in the afternoons. She completes her sales on credit and she takes payments every two weeks. She purchases her merchandise in Picoaza because there she can find better prices. She says that she has three years in the business and she started out when a friend of her's invited her to help her do her sales. She liked it, and some time later she started her business.

This loan will be used to purchase bed sheets. She has been a member of her communal bank for two years and she enjoys it for the easy payments. 

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets for resale

loans.name: Magdai

texts.es:
La señora Magdai Sánchez M., es madre soltera  quien afortunadamente  ya todos sus hijos están casados, tiene  a su responsabilidad a dos nietos y son: Axel de siete  años  de edad y Roxana de nueve años quienes son su razón de seguir adelante.

       Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes que lleva por nombre abarrotes kendra y solcito el préstamo el crédito para  invertirlo comprando mercancía de mejor precio y la que sus clientes desean comprar, en su negocio lleva   seis años  lo que nos comenta que le va bien.

       Se inspiro en ello para  tener de donde pagar los  gastos generados en su familia  ya que su esposo el abandono con sus hijos  pequeño y  tenía que buscar la manera  de trabajar, comenzó vendiendo frutas hasta  que sus hijos crecieron la apoyaron aponer su negocio de abarrotes  que es con lo  que está trabajando hasta ahora.

      Su sueño es seguir trabajando para apoyar a sus nietos a seguir adelante con sus estudios y lograr termine una carrera de la que les pueda ser útil más adelante.
texts.en:
Magdai Sánchez M. is a single mother.  Fortunately, all her children are now married.  She has two grandchildren in her care: 7 year-old Axel and 9 year-old Roxana.  They are her reason for carrying on.

Magdai has a grocery store called 'Abarrotes Kendra' (Kendra Groceries).  She requested this loan to invest in buying merchandise that her customers would like to buy for a better price.  She has been running her store for six years and she tells us that it is doing well.

Magdai set up her business so that she would have enough money to cover her family's expenses since her husband left her alone with her young children and she had to find a way to work.  She started out selling fruit and then when her children grew up they supported her in setting up her grocery store which is where she now works.

Magdai's dream is to continue working so that she can support her grandchildren in getting ahead in their studies, so that they can go on to complete a university degree which will be useful to them in the future.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah W. K. is 28 years old, married and has two children. For two years she has been running a retail shop. She has managed to sustain her business through her hard work. She formerly sold secondhand clothes.

Hannah has requested a loan for 20,000 KES to buy rice, maize flour and paraffin. In five years she hopes to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy rice, paraffin and maize flour.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a 39-year-old farmer from the village of Ninotsminda. He lives with his wife Lucine, two sons (7 and 5 years old) and his mother. Armen works as a provider in a local hospital. Besides his regular job, he is actively involved in the family agricultural businesses. The family owns two milk cows. The dairy products from the cows are sold locally. The family also has 25 beehives with bee colonies. Honey is sold locally to the retailers. Along with the above-mentioned, they own an agricultural plot (.15 hectare) where they grow potatoes. Harvested potatoes are sold locally to the retailers. 

With the requested loan, Armen will purchase 700 kg seeds for potatoes and start sowing. Part of the profit will be used to purchase additional beehives and bee colonies.

loans.use: to purchase seed to grow potatoes

loans.name: Nelly Leopoldina

texts.es:
Nelly de 58 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, es separada y tiene 2 hijos de 35 y 30 años son profesionales y trabajan. Tiene una mini tienda.

Empezó hace 20 años con una herencia que recibió de su papa decidió instalar un negocio y poco a poco fue creciendo. Empieza desde las 6H00 hasta en la noche que termina de atender a sus clientes. Vende recarga de $33 hasta $20, colas de $0.70, varios. Le dificultad en su negocio la delincuencia ya que hace unos 15 días le robaron a un cliente cuando compraba. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en arroz, azúcar, vitrinas para adecuar su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias en producto de ventas. En un futuro desea establecer su negocio con sucursales en la vía principal, ya que las ventas han disminuido un poco.
texts.en:
Nelly, 58, lives in a periurban zone in El Fortín in Guayaquil.  She’s separated and has two children who are 35 and 30 years of age; they are professionals and they work.  She has a minimarket.

She started 20 years ago using an inheritance she got from her father.  She decided to set up a business and it gradually grew.  She starts working from 6am and goes until night when she finishes taking care of customers.  She sells phone recharges ranging from $33 to $20, soft drinks for $0.70.  and miscellaneous goods. The difficulty she faces in her business is the crime rate.  About fifteen days ago a customer was robbed while shopping.

With help from the loan Nelly wants to buy rice, sugar and display cases to equip her store and increase profits on sales.  In the future she’d like to open branches of her store on the main thoroughfare because sales have diminished a bit.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and display cases.

loans.name: Blanca Olivia

texts.es:
Después de que su esposo falleciera, Blanca Olivia tuvo que hacerse cargo de su hogar y eligió la confección, oficio que había aprendido algunos años y que además le permitiría trabajar desde su casa y generar los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante, fue entonces cuando después de un tiempo, esta emprendedora empezó a ser reconocida en su barrio en Itagüí - Antioquia. 
 
Ropa sobremedida, arreglos de prendas de vestir, entre otras confecciones son la fuente de ingresos de esta luchadora que actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos como telas e hilos que le permitirán mejorar su capacidad de respuesta en cuanto a los pedidos y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
After her husband passed away, Blanca Olivia took charge of her household and decided to become a seamstress. She learned this trade a few years ago and it has allowed her to work from home and generate the necessary income she needs to get ahead. After some time, this entrepreneur began receiving recognition in her neighborhood of Itagüí-Antioquia.

This determined woman earns her income by providing alterations, mending garments, and designing clothes. She currently needs a loan to buy supplies, such as fabrics and thread, so that she can improve her capacity to fulfill orders and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 28 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucel has requested a loan of 20,500 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs. Lucel has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.
In the future, Lucel would like to save money, and to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Shakirah's Group

texts.en:
Shakirah‘s group is comprised of eleven hardworking women. Shakirah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. One of her children is currently in school.  She has had a business of a beauty salon for 1 year. 

To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids and cream relaxer oil for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Shakirah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, she hopes to own a barber shop. 

Shakirah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: to purchase braids and cream relaxer oil for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es: El  señor  Cristino es una  persona  muy  trabajadora   que  se  esfuerza  día  con  día  para  salir  adelante,  el    junto  con su esposa  se  dedican  a  la  venta  de  leche   ya  que   poco   a poco  han ido  comprado  vacas y  actualmente  cuentan  ya  con  seis animales,  en esta  ocasión ellos   requieren de  nuestra  ayuda  porque  decean  realizar  la compra   de  una   vaca   para  de  esta  manera  obtener  mayores  ingresos  que  les  permitirán tener  una  mejor estabilidad  económica, agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en: Cristino is a hard working gentleman who puts forth great effort to get ahead every day.  He and his wife sell milk and have been buying cows little by little.  They now have six.  They need our help because they want to buy another cow so that they can increase their income, allowing them to have greater economic stability.  [Cristino] appreciates the support he has gotten toward completing this project.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señora María es cliente de la institución desde el 2006 antes trabajaba con el grupo solidario Fuego pero el grupo se  separo y ella continuo con nosotros en forma individual pagando puntualmente sus cuotas,  ella vive en la zona  de Chasquipampa a una cuadra de la agencia tiene tres hijos,  ella junto a su marido se dedican a la elaboración de pan desde hace varios años,  gracias a su actividad ellos están saliendo adelante el préstamo que están solicitando es para la compra de harina y manteca para la elaboración del pan, son una familia muy unida agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
María has been a client of this institution since 2006. Previously, she worked with the "Fuego" solidarity group, but that group broke up, and she continued with us on an individual basis, paying her instalments promptly. She lives in the Chasquipampa area, a block from our office. 

She has three children. She and her husband have been baking bread for several years. Thanks to their hard work they are getting ahead in life. They are applying for the loan in order to buy flour and shortening.  They are a very close-knit family, and are thankful for the help that the institution offers them.

loans.use:
COMPRA DE HARINA Y MANTECA	
To buy flour and shortening

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a resident of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of 4 grown children. Lydia has owned and operated a retail store at home for 30 years and continues serving people. She receives a total of PHP 7,300 monthly from business operations.

Lydia became a GDMPC member in 2009. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to order additional stock of liquor to sell. The revenue from this investment will be used to improve the business and to maintain a motorcycle which provides additional income for the family.

loans.use: To order additional stock of liquor to sell.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im, 40 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer with $3 per day for his income. She has three children, two are studying and one is working in the factory with $4 per day for her income. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $4 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a hand tractor for plowing. In the future, she wants to send her children to study in the university so that they can have a good jobs to support themselves.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor for plowing

loans.name: 2 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Huyền works in agriculture with poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

She is 52 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 2 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2004, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main hardship that Huyền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Marta Emma

texts.es: Marta Emma D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual lo conforman su esposo y 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores D. edad y trabajan como empleados. Ella pose una tienda la cual ha logrado establecer en su hogar D. residencia y  mantener activa por muchos años. Para ella lo más importante es que su familia este bien y cuente con las condiciones necesarias para poder vivir tranquilamente. Su negocio es muy conocido en la zona y muchas personas demandan los productos que ella comercializa ya que Marta se caracteriza por ser una mujer creativa, servicial y honesta. Su sueño es ver su negocio crecer aun más D. lo que ha crecido, con el fin D. mejorar su nivel D. ventas y por consecuencia su nivel D. ingresos. Esto la ha hecho tomar la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra D. diversidad D. productos D. tienda (frijoles, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, pan dulce, aceite, detergente, etc.) que le permitan lograr sus aspiraciones y poder tener acceso a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Marta Emma is 52 years old and lives in her own house with her family which comprises her husband and 3 children who are all adults and work as employees. She has had a shop for many years which she managed to set up in her house. The most important thing for her is that her family be well and have the necessary conditions to live peacefully. Her business is very well known in the area and many people ask for the products that she sells as Marta is a creative, helpful and honest woman. Her dream is to see her business grow even more than it already has so as to improve her sales and thus her income. This has maD. her take the decision to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in her business with the purchase of a variety of products (beans, rice, sugar, sweets, pastries, oil, detergent, etc.) which will allow her to achieve her aspirations and have access to a better quality of .life.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, sweets, pastries, oil, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Anelia

texts.en:
Anelia is 50 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anelia has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old.  She is married and has  4 children.   She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Vilma has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.

Vilma is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business.

loans.use: buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Njuguna

texts.en:
Njuguna has operated his cereal business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years.  He is 50 years old,and married to Loise and they have three children who go to school.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more assorted cereals to sell in his shop.

In the future, Njuguna hopes to expand his cereal business and make more income and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more assorted cereals for sale.

loans.name: Dilbarhon's Group

texts.en: Dilbarhon is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a bookkeeper. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons and a daughter; all the children are employed. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, Dilbarhon opened a grocery store. With the profits gained from the trade, she buys livestock for breeding and fattening. She resells the livestock after fattening, and in this way, she earns additional money for the family budget. With money received from the loan, she plans to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a thirty three year old modest lady from Kisumu city, a city along the shores of Lake Victoria, Kenya. She is married to Jared and they have three children between three and seven years of age.

Evaline operates a second hand clothes business in Kisumu town and has been doing this for the last four years. She makes a monthly income of Kes 5,000. She is requesting a first loan of Kes 20,000 which she will use to buy more used clothing for sale. 

Evaline plans to save her profits so that she can buy a plot and build a residential house for her family.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en: Lorpu is 48 years old and lives in the Airport community. She is married and has six children between the ages of six and twenty-one. They are in school and live at home. For the past twelve years she has been operating a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase cassava, fish, pepper, rice, onions, salt, and oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, fish, pepper, rice, onions, salt, and oil for her business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Ibrahim from Waterloo branch, eastern area in Freetown. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 2 years and 21 years. Two of his children attend school. He started this type of business because it is not diminishing in value.
 
Ibrahim runs an assorted goods store at his marketplace. He sells items such as shoes, bags, suitcases and grinding machines. He has been running this business for 12 years. He works at the business from 7am until 6pm, 6 days per week. His business is the only source of income he has. Ibrahim says that the main challenge to his business is high cost of income tax.
 
Ibrahim has requested a loan in order to buy some assorted goods. The extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his saving and educate his children. In the future, he plans to do international business, especially with China. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, bags, suitcases and grinding machines.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 25-year-old married man. He has a child who  is 2 years old. He describes himself to be a very determined man. 

Peter offers bicycle transportation services and has been working in this business for a year. 

His business is located within a busy environment and his primary customers are the general public. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Peter will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy another bicycle. 

His business goal is to own many motorcycles within five years. 

He hopes that in the future he will be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy another bicycle for his bicycle transportation business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Hardworking Benson operates a bar in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He is a married man who lives together with his wife operating a bar business. He has been in business for one year having started with savings he mobilized from crop farming. Long distances to the shopping centre and small capital base are his challenges. Benson is working harder to achieve his mission. He will use the loan facility to buy beer to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en: I have been in business for three and a half years with my grocery.  It has been a good business and I have been able to raise my family with the income from it.   With this loan, I will increase my offering to my customers.

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy would like to venture into the shares business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. is the mother of five children, all boys, ages 16, 14 (pictured), 13, 11 and 5. 

Maria builds furniture out of a 10'x 10' workshop adjacent to her home in Hato Mayor. She constructs tables, shelving, dressers, chairs and couches, which she sells to larger stores in the city. 

This loan will go towards the purchase of wood, not only for making furniture, but also to construct a larger workbench to saw and drill on. She will also be able to purchase a motor for her power tools.

Maria has received two previous loans and paid them back with the substantial earnings she receives from her steady source of clientele.

loans.use: Purchase a motor, a saw blade and wood to build furniture as well as a work bench.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a food kiosk for his wife

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina lives in the Villa Ingenio neighborhood, in the city of El Alto and has three small children, ages 3 months, 2 and 9. She sells chuno (potato starch) and tunta (dried, dehydrated potato), which she buys from rural areas. Her husband works as a tailor in a small garment factory in La Paz.

She will use this loan to purchase additional merchandise for her business and in that way, increase her family's income.

This is her 2nd loan with IMPRO. She used the 1st loan to install running water in her home, which greatly improved her family's health and living conditions. That loan was repaid in its entirety.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina vive en la calle de Urus de la zona de Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de el Alto. Tiene tres hijos pequeños de 9, 2 años y uno de 3 meses, se dedica a la comercialización de chuño, tunta (patatas deshidratadas, que no se descomponen con el paso del tiempo, en ambiente seco) los cuales adquiere en el área rural del departamento. Su esposo trabaja como costurero en una pequeña fabrica de chamarras ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos en su familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, El primero lo invirtió en la conexión de agua potable al interior de su domicilio y así pudo mejorar la salud de su familia. Actualmente este credito esta completamente pagado.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ni Putu Artini

texts.id:
Ni Putu Artini lives in Ekasari village, West Bali. As a Balinese woman, it has been a tradition to raise pigs at home. Most of such business are side business. This is not the case for Ni Putu Artini, since this business could bring good profit for her family, if done well. Ni Putu Artini runs this pig farming with dicipline and persistence, since she wants to advance family economic situation. Before, Ni Putu Artini only raised 1 mother pig. That mother pig bore up to 12 piglets. After 4 months those piglets could be sold for Rp 250,000 (about US$28)/each. After subtracting all expenses, Ni Putu Artini could still have enough profit to support her family. With Dinari's loan, Ni Putu Artini plans to buy 1 other mother pig. She already calculated: With the mother pig ready to be impregnated, and ready to bore piglets, within the 6 month loan, Ni Putu Artini could sell the pig feedstock, and the loan could be returned timely. Ni Putu Artini plans to expand the business so that her family economic condition would improve.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Artini tinggal di desa Ekasari, Bali Barat. Sebagai seorang wanita Bali, sudah menjadi tradisi untuk memelihara babi dirumah. Sebagian besar memang usaha ini digunakan sebagi usaha sampingan. Hal itu tidak berlaku bagi Ni Putu Artini, karena usaha ini baginya dapat mendatangkan keuntungan yang cukup besar bagi keluarganya jika diolah dengan baik. Ni Putu Artini mengelola usaha ternak babi dengan disiplin dan rajin, karena ia sangat ingin memajukan perekonomian keluarganya. Sebelumnya Ni Putu Artini memelihara 1 ekor induk. Dari 1 ekor induk itu bisa melahirkan anak sampai dengan 12 ekor. Setelah dipelihara selama 4 bulan, anak babi itu bisa dijual kembali dengan harga Rp. 250.000.- per ekor. Dengan dikurangi semua biaya pengeluaran yang ada untuk perawatan, Ni Putu Artini masih bisa mendapat keuntungan yang dipergunakan untuk kehidupan keluarga. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, Ni Putu Artini membelikannya 1 ekor induk lagi. Hal itu sudah diperhitungkannya dengan baik. Dengan kondisi induk yang sudah sudah siap dikawinkan dan akan melahirkan anak, selama jangka waktu 6 bulan pinjaman, Ni Putu Artini sudah mampu menjual bibit babi dan pinjaman bisa dikembalikan tepat waktu. Ni Putu Artini berencana mengembangkan usaha ini agar kondisi perekonomian keluarganya lebih baik dari yang sekarang.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig

Membeli induk babi

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Mrs. Tum S., aged 30, works on her farm growing and selling her crops to earn about $2 per day in income.  Her husband wants to become a motor-taxi driver to earn around $3 per day in revenue.  Their two children are students.  She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to operate a business and increase the family’s income.  She will use the remainder of the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to start a taxi service as well as seeds and fertilizer for her crop growing business.

loans.name: Mariluz Rosa

texts.es:
Mariluz Rosa is 38 years old and has 4 children who depend on her. She has a small business making dairy products which are in great demand in the towns of Trujillo and Moche. She will open a new location in the Talara market soon, and is just waiting for the certificate of sanitation which allows her to distribute her products without any problems. She tells us it's in process. Mariluz studied as an executive secretary, but she did not finish her studies because she had the opportunity to take courses to learn how to prepare dairy products. This course allowed her to start her own business. She is a member of the group Mientras Tanto, Siempre Adelante, (always forward), from whom she received her first loan to buy necessary ingredients. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase vitamins for her two cows, and bottles for the yogurt. Her dream is to have an exclusive area set aside where she can prepare her dairy products without inconveniencing her family.

La señora Mariluz Rosa tiene 4 hijos que aun dependen de ella, tiene 38 años y es toda una microempresaria, ella elabora productos lácteos (yogurt, queso, manjar blanco, toffes, chocolates, etc.), tiene muchos pedidos en Trujillo, Moche y ahora esta abriendo mercado por Talara, hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien en su negocio, solo le falta el Carnet de sanidad (permiso) que certifica que puede distribuirlo sin ningún problema, pero nos comenta que ya está en trámite. La señora Mariluz estudió secretariado ejecutivo pero no pudo terminar los estudios porque cuanto estaba en el último ciclo viajó a su ciudad natal en Junín. Tuvo la oportunidad de recibir cursos sobre preparación de productos lácteos los que le sirvieron para iniciar su negocio Es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Adelante”, en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 solees con los cuales compró cobertura, fruta seca y azúcar (insumos). Con este préstamo de S/.500.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará vitaminas para las dos vacas que tiene y envases para el yogur. Su mayor sueño es tener un área exclusiva donde elaborar sus productos sin incomodar a su familia.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE VITAMINS FOR HER TWO COWS AND BOTTLES FOR THE YOGURT SHE PREPARES.

loans.name: Ysabela

texts.es:
Mrs. Isabel belongs to “The Jasmines” Comunal Bank, she lives in the San Martin region, in the province and region of Moyabamba. She has a beauty salon in her house where she dedicates herself to cutting and dying the hair of women, men and children, at the same time she offers services such as manicures, pedicures and sells beauty products, an activity that suits her well because her work is well known in the city. With the loan of 1,000 soles, which she will pay off in 6 months, she will buy materials that she will use daily such as dyes in different colors and nail polishes in different tints, at the same time part of the money she will invest in the marketing of her business. Mrs. Isabel is 43 years old, she lives with her husband and her 3 children, she is a young, optimistic woman, she dreams of installing a Spa in her house that offers her clients integral attention to physical beauty

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “Los Jazmines”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Moyabamba. Tiene un salón D. belleza en su propia casa en la que se dedica a cortar y teñir el cabello D. damas, caballeros y niños, asimismo da servicio D. manicura, pedicura y venD. productos D. belleza, actividad para la que esta capacitada, por lo que su trabajo es bien reconocida en la ciudad. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará materiales que utiliza diariamente como tintes en diferentes colores y marcas por docenas, shampoo, cremas para cuerpo y manos por docenas, esmaltes en diferentes tonos, asimismo parte del dinero lo invierte en publicidad para su negocio. La señora Isabel tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, mujer joven y optimista, anhela instalar también en su casa un SPA que ofrezca a su clientela una atención integral D. la belleza física.

loans.use: To purchase materials and pay for the advertising of her business

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami F. is 44 years-old man, married and father of three children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Nizami is engaged in moveable groceries (a mobile grocery store). He purchases fruits and vegetables from Guba and Khachmaz cities of Azerbaijan and sells them in Beylagan streets. 

Nizami applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for the KIVA loan in amount of $350 to purchase more kind of goods, increase the number of his customers and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Enala

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Enala M.. She is married, and has two children, ages 2 and 6. In 2000, Enala established her shoe business. Enala has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock of shoes in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her selection of shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Custom East 2018-3 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Senda B.. She is currently in the business of selling at a hotel and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Senda is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has 2 children, ages 8 and 16, and her children go to school. Each week, Senda makes approximately 375 Sudanese pounds (about US$ 185) in profit and with the extra money from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Senda is joined in her small group by Tabata H., Jabe J., Elizerbeth M., and Margret K.. Tabata H. has a business selling vegetables and wants to expand the business. Jabe J. is currently operating a business selling charcaol and wants a loan to expand her business. Elizerbeth M. operates a business baking bread and wants to expand the business. Margret K. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Donohol

texts.ru:
Donohol Q. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 38 years old. She is divorced and has two children. Donohol has a secondary education and was trained as an elementary school teacher. Unable to make enough money as a teacher, Donohol works as a trader. She has stall in the Tursan-zoda market where she sells fabrics. She has been in this business for 2 years. Since she is the only breadwinner of the family, she has to work a lot. Now she wants to increase her turnover. She plans to obtain a loan which will help her to increase her turnover and will allow her to increase profitability of her business. She plans to pay back her loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Кувандикова Донохол проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 38 лет. Разведена и имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. По специальности учитель в начальной школе. Но по профессии не работает. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города Турсун-заде.Торгует тканями. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 2 года. Так как она является единственным кормильцем семьи ей приходится много работать. Сейчас она хочет увеличить товарооборот. Для этого она планирует получить кредит , который сможет ей увелить товарооборот и получить больший доход от бизнеса. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem S. is 25 years old, has one child and resides with her husband in Phnom Penh. She works selling vegetables and groceries. She is able to make $4 of profit each day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver. To meet growing customer demand, Sem is requesting for a loan to add to inventory. The loan will help to meet her customer demand. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Sem S. was unavailable)

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her customer demand.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
This young entrepreneur is involved in the sale of basic necessity items; rice, oils etc. He maintains a general grocery store in the Kadior district. He is requesting this loan to increase his business and meet the ever increasing demand for products of mass consumption.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Ce jeune entrepreneur intervient dans l'offre de produits de premiéres nécessité : riz, huile etc Il tient une alimentation générale au quartier de Kadior. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce et faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante de produits de consommation de masse

loans.use: Store Improvements

loans.name: Esperanza Yolanda

texts.es:
Esperanza ('hope' in english) is a member of the Rickchary Community Bank. Rickchary means, "to wake up" in Quechua.

Esperanza is 35 years old and married with 4 children. Many years ago Esperanza owned a grocery store which she closed due to credit problems. Since then she has looked for other business opportunities, and as her husband was a topographer, she acquired topography machines which she currently rents out to people and business that need them. Also, Esperanza has a small book store which is growing little by little.

Esperanza needs a 1,600 soles loan to purchase a photocopier.

Esperanza dreams of building a house, growing her business, and sending her children to universities.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Esperanza es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchary que significa Despierta en quechua.

Esperanza es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Esperanza hace muchos años tenia una tienda de abarrotes negocio que cerró debido a que vendió al crédito y no le cancelaron, por lo que Esperanza busco otras oportunidades de negocios y como su esposo era topógrafo, adquirió equipos topográficos que actualmente alquila a instituciones y personas que necesitan de este equipo, además tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de artículos de librería que poco a poco esta surtiendo.

Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de una fotocopiadora.

Esperanza sueña con construir su casa, surtir más su negocio y que sus hijos estudien en universidades particulares.

loans.use: Purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi A. M. is 49 years old and married with two children, aged 19 and 22. She has owned and run a small shop for home products since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm.

Mkasi now seeking a loan to buy more inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Abdumajod

texts.en: D. Abdumajod lives in the Nausky region. He is married and has 4 children. He decided to apply to MicroInvest because he heard many successful stories from friends about people developing and improving their businesses thanks to MicroInvest loans.  D. raises livestock. It is the family business. He has the appropriate knowledge and skills because he taken care of cows from early childhood, helping his father at the farm, raising and selling livestock. D. wants to build a new cowshed and asks KIVA for a business support loan of 3200 STJ for 4 months. He thanks KIVA for its work and support.

loans.use: to build the new cowshed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize and additional food products

loans.name: Doniyor

texts.en: K. Doniyor is 49 years old and is married and with 3 children. Twenty years ago, he started his business of raising cattle. His primary business is with the local restaurants. Also during harvest season, Doniyor works an job as a farmer to help with the harvest. Despite having two jobs, his business is still quite small, and doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Doniyor would like to request a loan to expand his business. He will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. K. Doniyor is asking for a loan of $ 750 in order to buy more calves to raise. K. Doniyor thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing the small cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid A. is a Tanzania business man. He runs a workshop, making furniture and selling it to customers. He employs three professional carpenters and in total, his business has four employees. The business is located in the Buguruni wood market center and he has been in the business for seven years. He is requesting a loan of TZH 1,400,000  to buy a specialized circular saw to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy new circular saw

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Mrs. Yong K. is a farmer in Kbal Chin village in Kampong Speu province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is a 60-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a tailor while the other is attending the local school. 

Mrs. Yong K. is requesting a loan to buy cloth for her first child's business. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy cloth for her child's business.

loans.name: Adama Alassane

texts.fr: Agé de 26 ans Adama est un chauffeur de taxi sans femme.Avec son vehicule de transport urbain,il fait chaque jour plusieurs fois le tour de ville pour transporter des passagers.Les revenus ussis du  taxi lui  permet d'aider ses perents restés au village mais aussi de faire quelque économies pour le mariage.Il envisage avec le pret qu' il demande de renouveler le moteur du vehicule qui commence à etre fatigué avant que le vehicule ne s'arrete.
texts.en:
Adama, age 26, is a taxi driver without a wife. With his vehicle for urban transportation, he goes around town several times a day to transport passengers. The revenues from it enable him to assist his parents back in the village but also to save a little money for marriage. With this loan he is requesting, he envisions refurbishing the motor, which is starting to wear out, before the vehicle gives up.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: Josefa del Carmen S. Chavarría tiene 41 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Josefa tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Josefa es una pulpería además posee otro negocio como la elaboración y venta de tortillas Doña Josefa tiene cuatro años de realizar este negocio y además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos pero debido a su salud tuvo que dejar esta actividad y con los ingresos de la venta y elaboración de tortillas es que decidió establecer una pulpería. Los propósitos de Doña Josefa son de mantener su negocio activo ya que le gusta este negocio y es una buena fuente de ingresos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo  ya que con esto pude comprar productos como frutas, golosinas, y productos de consumo diario. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 5.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Josefa del Carmen S. Cavaría is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children. Josefa makes her living from a small grocery store and also owns another business where she prepares and sells tortillas. Josefa started this business 4 years ago, and in addition also dedicated herself to raising pigs, however, due to her health she had to abandon this activity. With the income earned from preparing and selling tortillas, Josefa decided to establish a small grocery store. Josefa intends to maintain her business active given that she likes this business and it is a good source of income. The loan will be used towards work capital given that with this loan she will be able to purchase products such as fruits, sweets, and other products consumed daily. The quantity that she is requesting is 5,000 NIO.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital to purchase fruits, sweets, and other products consumed daily.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana A. M. has worked as a seamstress and trader in Elmina, Ghana for the past eleven years. She sells material, zippers, and other sewing notions. She is married with five dependents, and has received an education through junior high school. Joana’s husband works at a beach resort named Coconut Grove Hotel in Cape Coast. She uses her income to help pay for the family’s light bill and school fees. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sewing materials to sell, which will help her expand her business. Joana plans to reinvest new profits to ensure that her business carries on successfully.

loans.use: Purchase more sewing materials to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is a hair dresser and also sells different types of soft drinks Nyankomasi. Janet has received junior high school education.  She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a designer.Janet has been selling different types of drinks and worked as a hair dresser since 1986. She is responsible for paying utility bills, feeding, school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase additional hair shampoo and other her dressing materials for her work. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase capital of business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase additional hair shampoo and other her dressing materials for her work.

loans.name: Bahronjon

texts.en:
Bahronjon A. is an entrepreneurial woman who has worked very hard at the various jobs she has learned over the years. Seven years ago, she decided to stay in the business of raising cattle and sheep. After many years of hard work and dedication, Bahronjon can now see the fruits of her labor. The number of her animals has increased rapidly and they keep getting bigger and more beautiful. She dreams of eventually becoming one of the best cow exporters in the local market. To achieve this, Bahronjon needs to improve her operation. She is requesting a loan of $525 USD to purchase young cattle. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Samuel Escalante

texts.es: Samuel Escalante A. tiene la edad de 48 años, su estado civil es soltero. Samuel tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Samuel es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Don Samuel tiene ubicada su pulpería, en la comunidad de la carreta, el negocio nació cuando Samuel  se encontraba en momentos difíciles económicamente y además sus hijos tenían que estudiar y fue esto lo que le llevo a tomar la decisión de establecer una pulpería. Sus propósitos son de incrementar su inventario. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, gaseosas y granos básicos. Los sueños de Samuel son de construir un local adecuado para acondicionar su negocio en que tenga mas espacio para mostrar todos sus productos.
texts.en:
Samuel Escalante A. is a single, 48-year-old man. Samuel has two children who are both students. Samuel has a small store in his home, which is how he makes a living. He has had this business for more than four years. Samuel decided to start this business because he found himself in hard times and also his children had to study. He hopes to increase his inventory. Therefore, this loan is meant for working capital to buy sweets, natural drinks, bread, soft drinks, and basic grains. Samuel’s dream is to build a place with air conditioning for his business, that is bigger so he can display all of his merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Coumberou

texts.fr: Coumberou  S. est une femme berger son activité principale est l’élevage des ovins. Elle fait ce métier depuis longtemps. Elle a passé toute sa vie à errer  en brousse avec ses moutons. A chaque approche de l hivernage, elle achète des moutons qu’elle embouche pour les revendre à la tabaski c’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter des moutons. Les  revenus tirés de son activité d’embouche lui permettra d’acheter des vivres pour sa famille et de réparer sa case.
texts.en:
Coumberou S. is a shepherdess. Her main work involves raising sheep. She has been practicing this trade for a long time. She has spent her whole life roaming in the brush with her sheep. With each approach of the off-season, she buys sheep that she fattens for resale for the Tabaski holiday (Eid al-Adha). This is why she's requesting a loan, so as to buy sheep. The revenues derived from her business fattening livestock will enable her to buy provisions for her family and to repair her hut.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina E. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Avelina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Avelina owns & operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling different seasonal food products in the local community. Avelina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Avelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Avelina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Bathishig

texts.en:
Bathishig H. is 30 and lives with his wife and three small children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two children go to a local high school. Bathishig drives a small passenger car in Ulaanbaatar. Before this passenger transportation business, he used to sell second-hand car accessories at the local black market where most of the car-related products and services are offered.

Since he obtained permission to drive a passenger bus in the city, he decided to pursue the passenger transportation business as he saw brighter opportunities in the transportation business in the city. His wife Hajidmaa also helps in his business; she is the conductor on the bus and makes sure that money does not get lost. Bathishig requests a loan to maintain his house and to buy new tires for the bus.

loans.use: For home maintenance and new tires

loans.name: Sabougnouma  2 De  Sogola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA 2 est composé de huit  hommes mariés qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 5 enfants. Ils vivent tous dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, enfants et épouses  dans le village de SOGOLA de la commune urbaine de BOUGOUNI, région de SIKASSO, république du Mali. 
Ils se sont connus par des relations familiales et professionnelles. 
Dans le souci d’assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de leurs familles respectives et de se faire de l’argent, ils ont fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt agricole et le précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt ces hommes comptent acheter, pour faire 6 hectares de maïs, 30 sacs d’engrais (dont 12 sacs de complexe céréales et 18 sacs d’urée) et payer les frais de labour de charrues. Tous les intrants agricoles du groupe seront achetés sur le marché de BOUGOUNI. La production totale attendue par le groupe est estimée à 24 tonnes de maïs. La consommation familiale va prendre une partie de cette production et le reste sera vendu en gros et au comptant aux commerçants de BOUGOUNI. 
Après le remboursement des intérêts du prêt, le groupe compte avoir un bénéfice de 275 000 FCFA en fin de campagne qui sera  utilisé pour soutenir les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The SABOUGNOUMA 2 group is composed of 8 married men who have an average age of 40 and on average 5 children. They all live in traditional extended conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, children, and spouses in the village of Sogola, township of Bougouni, Sikasso region, Republic of Mali. They met because of family and professional relationships.

With the intention of ensuring that they grow enough to feed their respective families and make some money, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second rural loan after having reimbursed the preceding one correctly.

With this loan these men intend, for 6 hectares of maize, to buy 30 sacks of fertilizer (12 of a cereal complex and 18 sacks of urea), and pay for plowing. All the agricultural inputs bought by this group will come from the market in Bougouni. They expect a total production of 24 tons of maize. Part of this production will be consumed by their families and the rest will be sold wholesale and for cash to the business people of Bougouni.

After reimbursing the interest on the loan, the group expects to make a profit of 275,000 F CFA at the end of the growing season, which will be used to support their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fees for plowing

loans.name: Costeñitas Ii Group

texts.es: El  centro focal villa Exaltación encuentra ubicado en la zona del mismo nombre,de la ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación “Costeñitas II”, actualmente está formado por diez miembros. Diferentes son los negocios de este grupo, por ejemplo Beatriz tiene un puesto de cerveza, Omar realiza tejidos de chompas para colegios, Miriam vende ropa para bebes, María vende cosméticos, Guadalupe  tiene una pensión familiar, Rosario vende chompas. Todas afirman que necesitan capital para la compra de productos en mayor cantidad, con esto aumentaran sus ventas y mejoraran las condiciones económicas en sus hogares.

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
At the age of 66, Benigna M. is already a widow, but continues to live and be productive for her six children: Norma, 44; Isidro, 42; Christopher, 40; Joyen, 36; Olivia, 34; and Alma, 28. Benigna’s children describe her as a hardworking mother. The thing that Benigna always kept in her mind is that she will work as long as she can for herself and for her family.

Benigna’s variety store, that sells different goods that are necessary to the people in their place, has been running for twenty-eight years. It has become the main source of their income which they can use for their expenses and to buy things that they need.

The business continued to grow after Benigna joined and obtained her first loan from Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI). Now, she has asked for a loan to again improve her business. She will use he loan for buying items to sell like soft drinks, wine and different kinds of groceries. Also, she wants to use the loan for her fish buy and sell business which she started after her first loan. She will buy assorted fish to sell to her neighborhood to generate extra income.

Benigna really hopes right now that her two businesses will became stable for the family to be able to live a sumptuous but simple life.

loans.use: To finance her variety store and also her fish buy and sell business

loans.name: Horneda

texts.es:
Horneda tiene 44 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica con mayor énfasis a las labores agrícolas y a la venta de animales (ganado vacuno, porcino y ovino). Todos los sábados vende estos animales en la feria ganadera, para ello debe madrugar para comprarlos directamente de los ganaderos, buscando un precio  que le ofrezca mayores posibilidades de ganancias. Este negocio le ha resultado más rentable que la siembra de papa, debido a que las ganancias son seguras, a diferencia que en la agricultura, el clima y el precio del mercado, pueden perjudicar sobre manera sus ganancias. Aun así, Horneda sigue cultivando sus terrenos, pero sólo para el consumo familiar.
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de animales para incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Compra de más animales

loans.name: Rosa Leny

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Rosa trabaja  vendiendo ropa  le va bien su clientela aumentado,  ella esta trabajando  en la tienda  de abarrotes de su mamá por las tardes, ella esta viendo para invertir un capital, pero antes quiere ver como están las ventas.  
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para  comprar ropa.
El sueño de Rosa es incursionar en un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Avancemos Juntas” [“Let’s Move Forward Together”]. Rosa works selling clothing and things are going well as her clientele is increasing. She works at her mother’s grocery store in the evenings, and is hoping to invest in this, but wants to see how sales are going first. Rosa needs a loan of 1400 PEN to purchase clothing. Rosa’s dream is start a new business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothing.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: La señora Natalia vive en la comunidad de Chicani, aproximadamente a 40 Km de la ciudad  de La Paz, se dedica a la venta de leche , tiene dos vacas lecheras cada una produce 12 litros al día los vende a la empresa  lechera PIL, lleva  20 años con esta actividad, tiene una hija pequeña, su esposo está en Argentina trabajando en costura, pero  volverá este mes y se quedará a trabajar aquí con su esposa. Sus suegros siempre la apoyan y velan por su bienestar y el de su nieta. El crédito será invertido en la compra de dos terneritos (dos toros pequeños), es una cliente muy responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
Natalia lives in the community of Chicani, approximately 40 kilometers from the city of La Paz. Her business is selling milk. She has two milk cows producing 12 liters per day, which she sells to the PIL dairy company. She has worked in this field for 20 years. She has a small daughter; her husband is currently in Argentina working as a tailor, but he will return this month and remain here to work with his wife. Her parents-in-law always support her and ensure that she and their grandchild are doing well. The loan will be invested in purchasing two bull calves. Natalia is a very responsible and punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing two calves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
