loans.use: To buy an automobile for public transit

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Isabel P. C. tiene 55 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, en su pulperia vende varios tipos de productos, pero ahora no la tiene muy surtida, por tal razon es que esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi tener mas surtida su pulperia.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya su negocio esta creciendo cada dia que pasa.
Maria esta casada y juntos con su esposo salen adelante los dos, comparten los gastos del hogar.
nos explico que ahora las ventas estan malas, pero con el cambio de gobierno en Honduras todo va a mejorar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel P. C. is 55 years old and she sells popular consumer products. In her small grocery store, she sells various types of products but now the store is poorly stocked. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy more wholesale merchandise in order to have a better selection in her store. She has told us that she feels very happy that now her business is growing each day. Maria is married and together with her husband they are pulling through, sharing the household expenses. She explained to us that now sales are bad but with the change in the Honduran government, everything is going to get better.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy butter, oil, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, bread,cookies, soft drinks, juices, corn flour, wheat flour, tortillas

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad C. is from the village of Purok 4, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 51 years old. Solidad is widowed. To make a living, Solidad provides waste-management services. The main source of income for her business comes from hauling plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Solidad has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Solidad joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Solidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Solidad is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Solidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy generic products

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is 33 years old, married and has three children. Her oldest child is aged six. She is a rice farmer and inherited land from her parents. She works hard to maintain the farm. She also wants to save for her children’s education. She hopes that some day, all of them will finish school and find decent jobs.

Maribel applied for a loan of PHP7,000. She will use this loan to buy farm inputs, like seeds, fertilizers and many others.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Nganga

texts.en: Ng’ang’a is 35 years old and married with three children in school.  He runs a greengrocer shop in a very competitive environment.  He was previously employed in a private company.  He also does farming for extra income.  He hopes to improve his standard of living.  He requested 60,000 KES so as to add to his stock of groceries.  His dream is to expand his shop into a wholesale business.  He describes himself as an ambitious man.

loans.use: Add stock of groceries

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia, 48, is a rice farmer in Surallah, South Cotabato. She also owns a sari-sari store as a  source of additional income for her family. A mother of three children, the eldest 14 years old, Alicia started her business in 2008. She's now requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for 10,000 Php. This will enable her to buy farm supplies and groceries for her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and groceries

loans.name: Taulafo

texts.en:
Taulafo Elenoa S. is 55 and widowed with 2 children (ages 13 and 28).  She owns a business venture selling fruits and vegetables.  Taulafo Elenoa has 2 years of experience in this business.  Taulafo Elenoa needs a loan of WST $1000 0.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.  

In 2008, Taulafo Elenoa joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Taulafo Elenoa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Elenoa is a client who willing to help her family as she now rejoins the program.

The following social metrics for Taulafo Elenoa S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and farming equipments

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne, 34, is married and has three children, two of whom go to school.  She has been running a restaurant for nine years and has four employees. Her husband is employed in a co-operative Sacco (Savings and Credit Cooperative Organization). 

She has previously taken out one loan from Faulu Kenya which she has successfully repaid.  She hopes to grow her business and to improve her standard of living. She has requested a loan of Kes 80,000 to renovate her business premises and to buy ingredients such as cooking fat, wheat flour, maize flour and rice. She describes herself as hardworking and social.

loans.use: To renovate the business premises and to buy stock

loans.name: Fulisia

texts.en:
Fulisia L. is 31 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  Fulisia has 1 year of experience in this business.  Fulisia needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Fulisia joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fulisia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Cadelenia

texts.en:
Cadelenia J. is from the village of Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 19 years old. Cadelenia is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Cadelenia owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Cadelenia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cadelenia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cadelenia is requesting a new loan of 2500 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cadelenia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora D., 47 years old, is a rice grower. She has two children with the eldest one aged 13. She currently tills a ½ hectare farm. She started farming in 1995. The reason she would like to apply for a loan is for business expansion. She is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 Philippine Pesos which she will use to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. Leonora says that she likes CEVI services so much because they also offer micro-insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Caring Sisters Group

texts.en:
Helena D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Caring Sisters. She is 31 years old, single and has two children who range from 5 to 8 years old. She was only able to attend school through 5th grade due to poverty.

For four years, Helena has been selling kitchen utensils at the Waterside Market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more kitchen utensils. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Helena is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Maikel

texts.es: Maikel Castillo V., tiene la edad de 18 años, está soltero, y vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una motocicleta. La idea es tener un medio de transporte que le permita movilizarse hacia su trabajo y así poder llegar a tiempo al trabajo y poder lograr tener una estabilidad laboral. El cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para conducir la moto. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Maikel espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona, además de poder alcanzar el logro de sus metas y proyectos.
texts.en:
Maikel Castillo V. is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase a motorbike. The idea is for him to have a means of transportation for getting to work, and to therefore be able to arrive at his job on time and to achieve employment stability. Maikel has the experience necessary to drive a motorbike. This is the first time that he has taken out a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the assistance offered to him. Maikel hopes that in the future he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and to be able to achieve his goals and plans.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mrs. Mean T. is the mother of four children: one is now married with their own home, while the remaining three are single. To help meet the family’s living expenses, two of her daughters are employed: one sells cake and one is a part-time laborer. Mean T. has been generating $2.5 per day from working as a rubber collector on the plantation where her husband also works. Mean T. is concerned that the current revenue she and her husband earn is not enough to support them. She plans to make extra income by investing in a grocery store, but doesn’t have the money to begin this process. Thus, Mean T. would like a loan to build a small store in front of her home where she will sell grocery items.

loans.use: To build a small store in front of her home.

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham P. is a 62-year-old widow with six children, four of whom are married. Most of her children are employed, and Ham P. makes a living by raising pigs and planting crops on a small farm. She has been in this line of work for years and usually earns around $2.50 of profit a day, all of which she uses to meet her family's needs. In the photo, we see Ham P.'s single daughter, who helps meet household expenses by working in a garment factory. Ham P. will use this loan to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne A. O. is twenty one years old. She is married with three children, aged between one and five years. Her husband is a casual laborer.

Everlyne's business is located at Nyamasaria in Kisumu. She also sells her items door to door in the Nyamasaria area. She sells plastic items like basins, mugs, plates, buckets, water tanks and other items. She has been engaged in this business for ten years. She says that this business is profitable. Her major challenge is that other people in the area offer the same products as hers; competition is very high. However, Everlyne works very hard to keep her business doing well.

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy plastic basins and plastic water tanks to meet her customers' demands. She hopes to diversify in business by beginning a fish processing business.

She hopes to improve the living standards of her family as well. She describes herself as a caring and loving mother.

loans.use: To purchase plastic basins and plastic water tanks

loans.name: Alex Ignacio

texts.es:
Alex de 35 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, el tiene una panadería/tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, su esposa le ayuda en la tienda mientras que el hace los panes para la panadería, tienen tres hijos de 14, 9 y 4 años. 

Antes de tener su negocio el trabajaba en el aeropuerto pero como lo despidieron no tuvo opción que gastar sus ahorros e invertirlos en harina, y readecuo su casa para ubicar un pequeño local, poco a poco haciendo panes, pudo comprar víveres. Cada pan lo vende a $ 0.10 centavos, trabajan desde la madrugada con su esposa. 

El quiere readecuar su negocio y su casa para tener mas espacio para el loca con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques y pinturas. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con exito y tener su negocio mas surtido.
texts.en:
Alex, 35, lives in El Suburbio, Guayaquil. He has a bakery/store in the front of his house. His wife helps him tend to the store while he bakes the bread for the bakery. They have three children who are 14, 9 and 4 years of age. Prior to having his own business he worked at the airport but when he was let go he had no other option but to spend his savings on flour and rearrange his house to set up a small locale. Little by little baking bread he was able to buy food. He sells each roll for $0.10 cents. He and his wife start working at dawn. He wants to rearrange his store and his house in order to have more room for the store. He will use the loan to buy cement, concrete blocks and paint. In the future, he’d like his children to successfully complete their education and to have a better stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement, concrete blocks and paint.

loans.name: El Milagro 6 Group

texts.en:
Valentinia is the coordinator of her group El Milagro 6 ("The Miracle"). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have a successful business. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to serve others.

Valentinia is excited to be taking her 12th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for six years, starting when she received her first loan in Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, where she has a little grocery stand and takes it to the local public school to sell snacks, candies and other groceries. She also sell shoes and clothing. She will use the profits to invest and save. She wants to run her business from home or her own location, because she doesn't want in the future to be moving.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she was needing motivation to start a business, which she received in her group and with Esperanza. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy candies, snacks, fruits, soda

loans.name: Twekembe Kabungo Namutamba Group-Mityana

texts.en: Rosco N., age 72, belongs to Kabungo Twekembe group loan.  He is a poised, well-rounded, diligent, and clear-sighted man which explains his success the past 12 years working as a butcher. Rosco worked previously in a retail enterprise, and that is how he saved money to begin his current butcher shop business in Butumbirizi of Mityana. He can earn 100,000 shillings (UGX) in one week, and often earns more profits from selling milk.  With this loan he will purchase cattle for butchering. His dream is to start a cattle farm.

loans.use: To buy cattle for his butchery.

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: Mrs. Sieng C. is 42 years of age and is a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. To pursue a daily income, Sieng C. always purchases small pieces of clothing in bulk at the cheapest price from garment factories and turns the clothing into furniture to sell. She makes the items such as cradles and mats, and she also saves many sets of her items before selling them to middlemen who then take them to retail at the market. She has a life partner in her husband, who assists her in the business and who also works in farming. Sieng C. said that she needs to hire a vehicle to travel from and to the garment factory in order to buy clothing. She hopes to own a vehicle by using a loan to buy one so that she can transport without hiring taxis.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: Violet Mideva

texts.en:
Violet Mideva O. is 29 years old and is married to Joseph O., who operates a motorbike in Kisumu town. They have four children attending school. Violet sells school bags and suitcases in Kisumu City. Her monthly income is Kshs.5,000.

Mideva has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she is applying for first loan of Kshs. 21,000 from KADET LTD to add more stock of bags and suitcases. She will use the profit to plough back into the business, so that it can grow to provide a stable income.

She hopes to open up a wholesale shop of bags and suitcases in the future.

loans.use: To add more stock of school bags and suitcases.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin G. is from Ozamiz City. He is 40 years old. Darwin is separated from his spouse and has one infant child. To make a living, Darwin owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating service-based services. Darwin has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Darwin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darwin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Darwin is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to repair his motorcycle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Darwin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair motorcycle for better service

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Mrs. Hak P. earns a living by breeding and selling pigs in a pen behind her house. She has been married for many years to Mr. Savorn, 43, who works at a company in Phnom Penh City that makes alcohol. They have two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Over the years, she has raised a lot of piglets, and usually aims to sell them to buyers four months after she begins raising them. In order to earn extra income, Mrs. Hak P. has applied for a loan to buy more pigs to feed and raise, as well as expand the pen in which she keeps them.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise and expand the cage in which she keeps them.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 8 children. Her children are mostly married and have their own families already. 

Fe raises pigs for a living. She says this kind of business is quite challenging but she is happy to have a source of income. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him maintain their rice farm.

Fe is in need of feeds and vitamins for her pigs to grow healthy. She also needs additional rice seeds and fertilizers for their rice farm. She applied for a loan of Php 18000 that she will use to run her piggery and her husband's farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, vitamins and additional rice seeds

loans.name: Teresita De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Teresita O. es socia del banco comunal El Progreso de Azogues, vive la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de sus calles, sus iglesias son el símbolo de la religión en la ciudad, su gente es amable y cordial, cuentan también con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La Señora. Teresita tiene 55 años, es divorciada y tiene 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, cuatro son casados y solo 3 hijos viven independientes, su hijo casado que vive en su casa comparte los gastos del hogar y su último  hijo es soltero y está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Teresita es profesora de educación primaria, actividad que la desempeña hace 32 años, también hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias maracas, este producto lo vende a sus amigas y conocidas en su tiempo libre.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y tiene muy buenas amigas con quienes comparte cada quince días en las reuniones del grupo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  cosméticos para la temporada navideña. Su sueño es tener  casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs Teresita O. is a member of the 'El Progreso de Azogues' community bank.  She lives in the city of Azogues.  This city is known for the architectural beauty of its streets.  Its churches are the symbol of the city's religion.  It people are kind and friendly.  The city's gastronomy is also very impressive.

Teresita is 55 years old.  She is divorced and has 5 grown-up children.  Four of her children are married but only 3 live independently.  Her married son who lives at home shares in the household expenses and her youngest son, who is single and studying at school in the city, doesn't have his own home.  He rents.

Teresita is an elementary school teacher.  She has been doing this job for 32 years.  She has also been selling various brands of cosmetics for four years.  She sells her products to her friends and acquaintances in her spare time.

Teresita has been a member of her community bank for 2 years.  She has very good friends in the community bank with whom she shares meetings every fortnight.  Her loan will be invested in buying cosmetics for the Christmas season.  Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy various brands of cosmetics

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth owns a business selling vegetables. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children who are 5 and 9 years old. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Elizabeth has been selling vegetables for four years. She plans to use her loan to buy more vegetables, specifically tomatoes, which give her a larger return on her investment. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to keep her store strong. She believes that she will have a booming business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as tomatoes

loans.name: Ufani Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad tiene 57 años, nació en el departamento de Ayacucho y actualmente vive junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Cusco provincia del Cusco.

Soledad se dedica a la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, leche y muchas cosas más, ella tiene un pequeño kiosco donde expende sus productos y la pueden encontrar desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Con su próximo préstamo, Soledad que espera recibir de $ 600 USD  y desea aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más.

Soledad pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal está empezando una nueva etapa y estará bien administrado por la antigua junta directiva.
texts.en:
Soledad is 57 years old.  She was born in Ayacucho department and currently lives together with her husband and three children in Cusco district, in Cusco province.

Soledad's business is selling foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, milk and many other products.  She has a small kiosk where she sells her products and she can be found there from 6.00am until 10.00pm every day.  She has been in this business for 8 years and it is going very well indeed thanks to the hard work that she puts in.  Soledad hopes to receive $600USD for her next loan and would like to increase her business capital, buying merchandise such as, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

Soledad is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "El Templo del Inca" (The Incan Temple) community bank which is starting a new stage and will be well managed by its former board of directors.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as, for example, rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 48 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 2 hijos mayores y su nieta; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa. Recuerda cuando enseñaba a sus hijos a coser, pues ella realizaba este oficio desde que eran pequeños, con el tiempo ellos crecieron y ahora el mayor de sus hijos confecciona todo tipo de prendas de vestir. Teresa ayuda a su hijo cuando puede, pero más lo ayuda en la venta de las prendas que él confecciona. Es así que viaja constantemente al interior del país y las ofrece a los mayoristas de las ciudades que le pagan muy bien por prenda. Le gusta mucho la labor pues apoya a su hijo, conoce lugares y se distrae, pero en el futuro tiene planeado instalar su tienda de venta de prendas de vestir que elabora su primogénito, asimismo desea continuar vendiendo en las provincias del país. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Teresa tiene planeado invertir este crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de tela para producir buena cantidad de prendas de vestir para el verano, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por concretar.
texts.en: Teresa is 48 years old and lives in her own home, beside her two older children and her granddaughter.  Together they struggle daily to get ahead.  This enterprising woman makes and sells clothing.  She remembers when she taught her children to sew, which she did from the time they were small.  They grew up, and now her oldest child makes all types of garments.  Teresa helps her son whenever she can, but is the most useful selling the garments he makes.  For this reason, she travels constantly to other parts of the country, offering clothes to the cities’ wholesale merchants, who pay her well for each piece.  She likes this work a lot, since she supports her son, sees different places, and enjoys herself, but in the future she plans to set up a store to sell the clothing made by her first-born.  She would also like to continue selling in the provinces.  This is the fifth loan she takes out with MFP, and she promises to make the payments punctually.  She doesn’t wish to leave a bad impression with those who have made this support possible, which support will enable her to continue to work towards her goals.  Teresa plans to use the requested loan to purchase enough fabric to produce a large number of garments for summer, since she has several orders to fulfill.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is currently in a business of selling alcohol, tea and charcoal. She is 35 years old, divorced, with 4 children who all go to school. Ayuba wishes to use her loan to stock more alcohol, tea and charcoal. With extra profits, Ayuba hopes to buy a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: Stock more tea, alcohol and charcoal for sale

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 53 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 14 et 33 ans. En 2010 ayant vu les différentes charges de sa famille, son mari qui avait prit sa retraite, les frais d’écolage des enfants a l’université, elle ouvre un dépôt de boissons gazeuses et non gazeuses.
Pour ce faire, avec un fond de commerce que son mari lui avait attribué, elle s’achète des casiers des boissons vides et elle trouve un abonnement a la brasserie pour ouvrir un grand dépôt de boissons, c’est une activité très rentable, ses ventes sont de 50.000 a 150.000 fr par jour. Avec le prêt elle compte renforcer son capital et acheter des vins, des boissons importées et tous ce dont les clients ont besoin.
Elle pense a l’avenir q’ avec les bénéfices qu’elle a du jour au jour  être un distributeur des boissons en gros .
texts.en: This customer is a 53-year old businesswoman, who is married and mother to six children, whose ages range from 14 to 33 years old. Being aware of the various family expenses, the fact that her husband has retired and her children's university education costs, she opened a store for fizzy and non-fizzy drinks in 2010. In order to do this, she bought with the funds that her husband gave to her, empty crates of drinks, and she managed to get a contract from the brasserie to open a large drinks store. It is a very lucrative activity and she has sales of 50,000 to 150,000 drinks a day. With the loan she is planning to increase her capital and buy wines, imported drinks and everything that her customers need. With the day-to-day profits she makes she is planning in the future to become a wholesale distributor of drinks.

loans.use: Purchase of crates of beer, fizzy drinks, imported drinks, wines

loans.name: Antonio Abad

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Antonio; El socio tiene 56 años de edad, el socio  es casado; el socio tiene 4 hijos; (todos independientes) el socio tiene como principal artesanal, el socio se dedica al arte el realiza bellos trabajos en bastidores, se encarga de la textil ería y plasma la bella naturaleza andina, el socio es considerado un artista paisajista, el realiza bellos cuadros y textiles muy coloridos. La sobras del socio se pueden encontrar en el mercado artesanal de Chinchero. El socio desea comprar materiales como oleo, pinturas, bastidores, pinceles y otros. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales. 

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Here is a member who belongs to the communal bank named "Nueva Victoria-Chinchero". It is located in the district of Chinchero, in the Urubamba province of the department of Cusco.

His name is Antonio. His is 56 years old and he is married. He has 4 children who are independent. He is an artisan and he makes beautiful paintings. He makes textiles which caputre the nature of the Andes. He considers himself to be a landscape artist, painting beautiful and very colorful paintings and textiles. His art work can be found in the artisan's market in Chinchero. He wishes to purchase materials such as oil, paints, canvasses, paint brushes, and others.  He requests a loan to invest in the purchase of materials.

He is happy with the loan which was granted to him and he is committed to making payments at the established times.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as oil, paints, canvasses, and paint brushes

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: The man in the photo is Onesmus W. K..  He is 33 years old and married, with an eight year-old child.  He has been earning his living from his bakery for the past ten years.  He has employed three people to assist him in his tasks.  He hopes to supply cakes at wholesale in the future.  He has requested  80,000 Kes to buy a motorbike for transporting his goods.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Susana Jannet

texts.es: Susana tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 05 años de edad. Reside en la casa de sus padres en el distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. La zona se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el norte de Perú. Su comunidad es pequeña y la mayoría de sus residentes se dedica a la producción de hortalizas y a la crianza de animales menores. Desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende a los restaurantes de la zona. Es muy conocida en esta comunidad y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales. Con esta inversión, puede lograr un mejor tamaño y peso de sus animales para poder venderlos a un mejor precio. Susana es muy trabajadora y responsable. Ha manejado otro préstamo y lo canceló en manera puntual. Desea seguir invirtiendo en y creciendo su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos. Su más grande sueño es darle a su hija una educación de calidad. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Susana is 34 years old.  She is a single mother and has a 5 year-old daughter.  Susana lives in her parents' home in Monsefú district, an area which is known for its tourist and religious festivities.  It is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, in the north of Peru.  Susana's community is small and most of its inhabitants grow vegetables and raise animals.

Susana has been raising pigs and poultry for six years.  When they have reached a good size and weight, she sells them to restaurants in her area.  Susana is very well known in her community and she has an established customer base.  She would like to invest her loan in buying balanced animal feed for her animals.  With this investment, her animals will achieve a better size and weight which means that she will be able to sell them for a better price.

Susana is a very hard-working and responsible woman.  She has already had a loan and paid it back on time.  She would like to continue investing in and growing her business so that she can increase her income.  Her biggest dream is to provide her daughter with a good-quality education.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting her in achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Rafael David

texts.es:
Rafael, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, es agricultor en pequeño, es una persona de familia vive con su esposa y un hijo. Aprendió las actividades agrícolas de sus padres y lo realiza desde hace 4 años, para sostener a su familia y brindar lo necesario.
El solicita un préstamo para la preparación del terreno donde sembrara maíz, para realizar esta actividad necesita comprar fertilizantes e iniciar todo el proceso para el momento que deba sembrar.
Rafael quiere aumentar la producción y generar mayores ganancias de la comercialización de la cosecha, también velar por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael resides in the Jiquilisco department of Usulután.  He is a small-scale farmer, and is a family person.  He lives with his wife and one son.  He learned farming from his parents and has done this for four years, to sustain his family and provide for necessities.  

He asks for a loan to prepare the land where he will grow corn.  To do this activity he needs to purchase fertilizers and begin the whole process for the moment that he has to sow.

Rafael wants to increase production, generate bigger profits from crop commercialization, and watch over the well being of his family.

loans.use: for the purchase of fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials she needs to improve her stable.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives together with her husband, parents-in-law and two children.

In a rented factory space she makes bed linens. To meet the increased demand Anna needs to purchase necessary fabrics and other materials. With the loan’s help Anna will increase her trade and income.

loans.use: to pay for fabrics and other materials.

loans.name: Sifaga

texts.en:
Sifaga is 51 years of age and married with five children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has three years of experience in this business.  

Sifaga needs a loan of 2,000 WST to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week) to improve the business.

In 2007, Sifaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sifaga's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio José tiene 65 años. Tiene 5 hijos y solamente 4 están a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de pan. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Con estos ingresos mantiene a su familia él ha logrado salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo uno de sus desafíos es el tiempo que es debido a que tiene una gran demanda de clientes y esto le proporciona mucho cansancio. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de semita, picos, pan simple, empanadas y otras. Sus sueños para un futuro son de obtener un vehículo y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvio José is 65 years old. He has five children, but only four are under his care. Silvio has been selling bread for more than 10 years. With his earnings he is able to support his family. Silvio has been able to get ahead through great effort. One of his challenges at the moment is being able to keep up with the high demand from his customers. As a result, the amount of work causes him to become tired.

This loan will be used as operating capital for buying pastries, sweet bread, plain bread, empanadas, and other items. His dreams for the future are to obtain a vehicle and offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase pastries, sweet bread, plain bread, empanadas, and other items.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 50 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Joan works very hard to provide for her family.
Joan runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. Joan has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, sardines, sugar, etc. In the future Joan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
65-year-old Em lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. They have 5 children, 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her husband no longer works and is not in good health. 

Em has been running a general store in front of her door for 10 years. The income generated by her business is the only source of income to cover all her family's expenses. From her store Em sells everyday items such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, soaps, shampoo, chewing-gum and cooking oil.

Em plans to take out a loan to buy more items for her store so that she can offer a wider variety of goods to her customers. She believes that with a wider variety of goods she will attract more customers and her income will increase which will enable her to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of goods to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Rosa Endrina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 11 hijos, 10 de ellos ya mayores de edad, la menor de ellos tiene 17 años y estudia en colegio, 4 de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran mujer que para ayudar a su marido realiza los créditos para que este lo invierta en su negocio, el se dedica a la venta de pescado para lo cual recorre en un triciclo las calles en la ciudad de Manta con la finalidad de vender mejor sus productos. él trabaja todos los días y sale desde la madrugada a las playas de Manta para tener el mejor pescado para sus clientes. Lleva más de 30 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar pescado para la venta. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace diez años y le gusta por las facilidades de pagos. 

Sus sueños son comprar un carro para que su esposo se traslade con más facilidad.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora (Mary Help of Christians) Loan Group meets in La Sequita parish, which belongs to Montecristi Canton, a flourishing canton in Manabi, known as the birthplace of the Viejo Luchador ("Old Fighter" and a former president of Ecuador) Eloy Alfaro, and known for its famous Panama hats, which are known in and outside of the country.

Rosa lives here. She is 57 years old, married, and has 11 children, 10 of them now grown. The youngest is 17 and goes to high school, and four of her children still live at home. Her husband is a businessman.

She is a great lady who helps her husband by getting loans for him to invest in his business. He sells fish, and to do this he rides a three-wheeled bike through the streets of Manta with the goal of selling his products. Our friend Rosa tells us that he works everyday, and that he goes out to Manta's beaches at dawn to have the best fish for his customers. He has been doing this work for more than 30 years, and thanks to God it has always gone well for him.

He will use this loan to buy fish to sell. Rosa has been in the Loan Group for ten years, and she likes it because of the easy payments. 

Her dream is to buy a car so her husband can travel more easily.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Dedicación

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Dedicación; La socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y  tiene 3 hijos de 12, 6, 3 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos para automóviles, la socia compra piezas para los distintos modelos de autos y los vende también compra lubricantes, aceites de carros, y todos los respuestas que se solicite para el automóvil. La socia requiere en esta ocasión invertir el crédito en la compra de repuestos para automóviles, la socia compra de la ciudad de Lima, ella hace el pedido y le envían, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de repuestos de automóviles.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian communal bank, located in the Huanchac district, Province of Cuzco, Department of Cuzco.

Dedicación is the member’s name, and she is 35 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children, 12, 6, and 3 years of age.  She buys and sells automotive parts.  She buys items for the various models of cars and sells them.  She also buys lubricants, oils, and any parts that may be requested for a car.  Right now, this member wishes to invest the loan to purchase automotive parts.  She buys from Lima, placing the order and they send the items to her.  This member requests the loan to purchase automotive parts.

She is grateful for the support given her, and commits to making installment payments faithfully.

loans.use: the member requests a loan to purchase automotive parts.

loans.name: Altynbu's Group

texts.en:
Altynbu is the treasurer of this group. She is 42 and works as a social worker in the Regional Social Funds. She is married to a builder who went to work in Russia. Altynbu takes care of her son, who is 12 and studies at school. In order to earn additional money to meet their needs, Altynbu breeds livestock. She started this activity four years ago with an initial investment of 13,000 soms. At the moment, reselling livestock after being fattened, she earns an additional 1,500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Altynbu wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the near future, she plans to expand a shed for keeping livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Disability is not the clog for not working, Anabelle says. She is 44 years old, married and blessed with two children who are going to school. Anabelle engages in a retailing business at a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells eggs, cooking oil, shampoo and soap. 

Anabelle walks lamely; it is inborn but according to her, it is not a hindrance to achieving her goals. Anabelle has her sari-sari store stand in front of their house. 

Anabelle works hard to give a better quality of life for her family. She wants to maintain and develop her business. Anabelle is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy additional goods to sell in their village like toothpaste, noodles, spices and drinks. She hopes to increase her income by adding these goods to increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in their village like toothpaste, noodles, spices and drinks.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a business woman, aged 39; she is a single-mother of two. For ten years, Lucy has been managing a nursery school to earn a living. She also practices livestock and poultry farming for extra income. The number of pupils in her school have increased, thanks to Faulu Kenya for helping her to boost the business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to renovate the school.

loans.use: to renovate the school.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 11 children. 

Mila has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future,Mila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 46 years old, married, has six children and earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this line of work for two years and is applying for a loan for PHP 18,000 from NWTF to buy more livestock to raise. She is working very hard to achieve her goals of saving money and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years.  He is 62 years-old and married to Margaret. While his retail business is his primary activity, Joseph also practices farming. 

He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy more stock such as sugar, tea leaves and match boxes to sell in his retail shop.  He also will buy some farm materials. 

In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale and also increase his farming thereby increasing his income in order to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as sugar, tea leaves, match boxes and farm materials.

loans.name: Panambi Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado panambi, tiene 12 miembros, las cuales trabajan en forma coordinada y siempre dentro de un ambiente de ayuda mutua. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de generan mayores ingresos, para que de esa forma ellas puedan ayudar a sus familias a salir adelante. Actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Odilia es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de toda clase, es gracias a su esfuerzo y buena atención en dicho negocio que puede ayudar a su familia y cubrir sus gastos. Comenta que tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compran de ella las prendas que vende, además de eso nos dice que tiene pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir y es por eso que solicita el crédito.
Desea comprar remeras, pantalones, camisas y otras prendas de verano, las cuales son muy solicitadas en esta época.
texts.en:
This group is called Panambi, made up of 12 members all working in a coordinated manner and in an environment of mutual support. They united in order to generate more income to help their families survive, and are currently on the fourth cycle of the Foundation's female entrepreneurs program.

Odilia is one of the members of Panambi, and she sells all kinds of garments. Thanks to her effort and dedication to her business, she is able to help her family and cover her expenses. Odilia explains that she has a well established customer base who always buy the clothes that she sells, and she receives orders from them which she would like to be able to fulfill - this is why she is requesting this loan. 

Odilia wants to buy knitted tops, shirts, pants and other summer clothes, which are in currently in high demand.

loans.use: to purchase items of clothing for subsequent sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 33-year-old married man from Gaza. He lives with his wife and three children. Ahmad owns his own small farm where he raises chickens. 

Ahmad is requesting a loan to buy more chickens for his farm. This will increase his income and allow him to sell more chickens.

loans.use: buy chickens

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 37-year-old married woman, the mother of two beautiful, smart children. Nine years ago, she opened a clothing shop after working as a teacher for some time.

Khalida has worked hard to establish her own business. She accepted the challenge of this courageous step forward in order to earn more income and to give her children a better standard of living than what she could provide as a teacher. She is happy that she's capable of helping her husband earn income and meet their expenses.

To take another step forward, Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to expand her selection of merchandise with special new autumn and winter collections. This is Khalida's first experience with Kiva, and she hopes it will be a very exciting and impressive one that will lead to future expansion, such as opening a new branch or starting a wholesale business.

loans.use: to add autumn and winter collections to her inventory.

loans.name: Lizbeth Edith Denisse

texts.es:
Lizbeth pertenece al banco comunal “Los Chaccoc” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pilcopata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. 

Lizbeth es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a sus hijos, ella nació en la tribu nativa de Kosñipata llamada Guadaria pero actualmente, Lisbeth vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Lizbeth se dedica a la venta de bebidas alcohólicas y también se dedica  a brindar servicio de entretenimiento como juegos de mesa. 

En esta oportunidad Lizbeth requiere el préstamo para comprar más bebidas alcohólicas como cerveza. Lizbeth se encuentra agradecido  a la Asociación Arariwa por que fue la primera entidad financiera que le préstamo capital para su negocio. 

Lizbeth agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Lizbeth belongs to the "Los Chaccoc" communal bank. The members of the communal bank meet every 30 days in the city of Pilcopata, in Paucartambo province, Cusco department.

Lizbeth is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who moves her children ahead. She was born into the native tribe of the Kosñipata district called Guadaria, but currently Lizbeth lives in the city of Pilcopata, where she works. Lizbeth sells alcoholic beverages and also provides entertainment such as board games.

At this time Lizbeth needs the loan to purchase more alcoholic beverages such as beer. Lizbeth is grateful to Asociación Arariwa because it was the first financial entity that loaned her capital for her business.

Lizbeth is thankful for and values the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic beverages such as beer

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is married and has two children, ages six months and one year. She is an ambitious woman.  She has been selling khat for the last six years in an area conducive for the business.  She was previously involved in a farming activity and engaged in khat selling to increase her income. Her business challenge is the high cost of khat when buying it. She plans that with the loan of Kes 10,000 she will be able to boost her business by buying more khat for selling.  Judy dreams and hopes to diversify her business in the next five years.

loans.use: buy khat to sell

loans.name: Nely Antonia

texts.es:
Nely Antonia, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en una aldea de El Níspero Santa Bárbara junto a sus 3 hijos de 3,8 y 11 años de edad.
Nely trabajo por un tiempo en una maquila, y hace 1 año y medio estableció su propio negocio con sus propios esfuerzos, ella vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, arroz, azúcar, manteca, harina, huevos, pollo, productos de limpieza, pan etc.  Debido a que los vecinos tenían que caminar larga distancia hasta llegar a la otra pulpería, ella aprovecho la oportunidad de invertir en una pulpería. Poco a poco a reinvertido sus ganancias para incrementar el inventario. Y para mantener surtido este negocio ha solicitado un préstamo de L.15,000.00 para comprar granos básicos, azúcar, arroz, manteca, pan, harina, y otros.
Su meta es mantener este negocio surtido, hacerlo crecer más y lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nely Antonia is 32 years old. She lives in the village of El Níspero, Santa Bárbara together with her three children who are three, eight, and eleven years old. Nely worked for a bit in a factory and one and a half years ago she started her own business through her own efforts. 

She sells basic needs products like staple grains. sugar, rice, lard, flour, eggs, chicken, cleaning products, bread, etc. Due to the fact that the neighbors have to walk a long distance to reach the other small grocery store, she took advantage of the chance to invest in her own small grocery store. Little by little she is reinvesting her profits into expanding her inventory. 

To keep the business supplied she is requesting a loan for 15,000.00 lempiras to buy staple grains, sugar, rice, lard, bread flour and other things. Her goal is to keep the store supplied, make it grow, and make sure that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to supply her store with basic products like staple grains, rice, sugar, bread, sodas, lard, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en: Sokny, a mother of one little child and is 28 years old, is a villager from Sangke district of Battambang province. She earns a living via tailoring business and her paid-working job. From these main source of income, she can earn up to 33,300 KHR per day.This is the third loan for Sokny with VisionFund(Kiva's partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan completely and now her living condition is getting better than before. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her business. Therefore,she teams up a group of five to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more fabric to make more clothes for the customer as well as to use for resale. She hopes that she can make more money than before.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to make more clothes for the customer

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en:
Vianney is 50 years old. He is married with 6 children aged 11 and 24 years, They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been in a business for the past 11 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en: Living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Hong is 41 years old. She is a mother blessed with two children and one of whom is in school. To support on her family’s living, she grows rice and works as a labor for others. Moreover, she can get extra income via buying mango for resale. She has been with her business for 23 years and she can save from her daily income about 7 USD per day. This is her fifth micro loan with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loans on time. Her living condition is getting than before with her previous loans. In a group of two, she is the group leader to get this new loan. Hong will manage her entire loan to buy more fertilizer to input her rice farm to grow well than last year. She hopes that she can get more yields and sell it in higher price, so she can upgrade her lifestyle and support on her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm in order to produce higher yield than last year.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Maira Yessenia

texts.en:
My restaurant is in a good location, and I have been serving people for many years. This business has enabled me to provide for my children, and I am grateful for the progress of my business.

Here is a recipe from Honduras:

Honduran Pollo Con Salsa (Chicken In Sauce)

3 1/2 lbs frying chicken, whole
1/4 cup cooking oil
1/8-1/2 teaspoon hot chili powder
1/4 cup ground sesame seeds
3 whole cloves
1 cinnamon stick
1 teaspoon brown sugar
1/4 teaspoon fenugreek seeds
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
2 cups boiling water
2 tomatoes, chopped
1 green pepper, chopped
1 onion, chopped


  1. Brown chicken in oil on all sides; remove from pot.
  2. Add chili powder, sesame seeds, cloves, cinnamon, brown sugar, fenugreek, and salt and pepper; brown in oil.
  3. Add remaining ingredients.
  4. Simmer until tender.
  5. Add chicken and cook until tender, turning occasionally.
  6. Add more water if necessary.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: María Velia

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of 4 children. She lives with her family in the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León. Her husband is a welder; however, his income is too low to cover all the household expenses. Due to this situation, she decided to begin selling pumpkin seeds to her neighbors from her own home. She later began to sell and make tamales. This activity has allowed her and her family to achieve a better quality of life than before and be able to handle most of their expenses.

For this reason she continues to struggle day to day in order to grow her business. At this time she is in need of a loan of $250 for acquiring merchandise to be used as ingredients in the preparation of the foods she sells. This is your chance to help someone who needs it. Don’t hesitate any longer, the decision is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mary es una mujer casada y madre de 4 hijos, ella vive con su familia en la localidad de Monterrey, Nuevo León. Su esposo es soldador, sin embargo su sueldo es muy bajo para poder cumplir con todos los gastos del hogar. Por esta situación ella decidió comenzar a vender semillas de calabaza a sus vecinos en su propio domicilio. Luego comenzó a vender y elaborar tamales, esta actividad le ha permitido a ella y su familia a lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida que antes y poder hacer frente a la mayoría de los gastos.

Es por ello que ella sigue luchando día a día para poder hacer crecer su negocio. En este momento ella requiere De un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 DLLS, misma que utilizará en la compra de mercancía que ella utiliza como insumos para poder preparar los alimentos que vende. Es tu oportunidad de ayudar a alguien que lo necesita, no lo dudes más, la decisión esta en tus manos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Faalua

texts.en: Faalua lives in the Samoan village of Lotofaga and is a mother of six and a grandmother of twelve.  Faalua began her taro plantation with funds from her first SPBD loan.  In her first planting, she raised 600 taro plants.  After two harvests of similar size, she found she had raised enough money to greatly increase her family’s income and help buy food for her many grandchildren.  Faalua’s family is very encouraging of her efforts, as it has not only made a valuable contribution to the family finances but has also been a source of satisfaction and pride for Faalua.  Faalua is committed to growing her plantation further.  Some of the income she saved from her initial two harvests went to buy additional taro seeds, and she is currently raising 1,200 taro plants.  She has set her goal even higher, and with her first SPBD fully repaid, Faalua is seeking an additional loan to purchase more seeds and buy supplies such as a wheelbarrow, knives and weed killer.

loans.use: Purchase taro seeds, wheelbarrow, knives, weed killer

loans.name: Izzat

texts.ru:
Izzat K. is married with 3 children, who all attend school. She has been in business for 5 years. She started her business selling fruit. She is a fairly new client of MicroInvest. After receiving her loan she was able to greatly expand her sales. At the moment it is the fruit season and so Izzat K. is asking for $500 to expand her sales and business.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Иззат замужем, имеет 3 детей. Бизнесом занимается 5 лет. Ее дети учатся в школе. Начинала свой бизнес с продажи фруктов. В Микроинвесте она недавно. После получения кредита, она намного увеличила свой товарооборот. Так, как сейчас сезон фруктов, Каримова Иззат запрашивает 400$ для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Expanding her business during the current fruit season

loans.name: Jamie

texts.en: Jamie B. is twenty-seven years old and has four children. Jamie started her business three years ago selling saucepans and palm oil in front of  her house.  She goes to the villages to purchase palm oil in bulk in “gerri cans” and distributes them to retailers in the neighborhood.   She would like a loan of $250 to purchase fourteen more “gerri cans” of palm oil.

loans.use: to increase her inventory to distribute wholesale to local retailers
